title: Tech Tuesday
body:
A new nightmare for windows users, PrintNightmare
On July 1st,\u00a0 the security research at Microsoft uncovered a new vulnerability, the PrintNightmare. It seems as if the security analysts accidentally unveiled it before Microsoft could convey a fix. Though later they acknowledged that Microsoft had viably fixed the issue.\u00a0

Microsoft labeled the vulnerability as CVE-2021-34527, suggesting to be aware of the vulnerability and working on a patch. Microsoft has not disclosed the severity of this vulnerability, as it claims to be investigating more into this.

So how does PrintNightmare impacts us?
PrintNightmare impacts the Windows Print Spooler, which handles imprinting on Windows PCs.\u00a0 The Print Spooler had also accomplished notoriety 10 years prior when it was utilized by a still-anonymous entity to obliterate nuclear centrifuges, that were being utilized by Iran to handle nuclear fuel. The PrintNightmare is portrayed as zero-day since it offers PC administrators no possibility for detection and hence no ideal opportunity to react.\u00a0

It can not only cause an accursed person to get access into our PC and become an admin, but the scarier aspect of this entire circumstance is far-off code execution, which can be weaponized by lawbreakers. It takes into account both nearby access and sidelong development into different frameworks like a domain controller. Domain controllers are influenced if the print spooler service is empowered. The Authenticated Users bunch is nested within the Pre-Windows 2000 Compatible Access which is raised and makes domain controllers vulnerable in default organizations.\u00a0

All forms of Windows contain this vulnerable code and are helpless. Your system might also be at risk if Point and Print is enabled in your system or the Authenticated Users group is nested and settled inside any of the groups that are listed in the mitigation section.

While everyone awaits Microsoft's release to fix this issue, it is encouraged to impair the Print Spooler for the time being. To be on the safer side, you can either disable the Print Spooler service or disable inbound remote printing through Group Policy. Microsoft strongly recommends installing the June 8, 2021 security updates as all versions of Windows are vulnerable.

title: Women's Day
body:
International Women\u2019s Day (March 8th) is a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women. The day also marks a call to action for accelerating gender congruence. International Women\u2019s Day is all about unity, celebration, reflection, advocacy and action. Globally, purple is a colour for symbolizing women. Historically the combination of purple, green and white was used to symbolize the qualities of a woman which originated from the Women\u2019s Social and Political Union in the UK in 1908. Purple signifies justice and dignity, green symbolises hope and white represents purity, but is no longer used due to \u2018purity\u2019 being an arguable notion.
Woman \u2013 the power to mould, nourish and remould. The word \u2018woman\u2019 conjures up the image of selfless love, care and affection. At the same time, women ignite the spirit of power and hope. Women, from time immemorial have fought for the rights of others and now it\u2019s their time to get their rights realized and acquire equal participation in the society. Women are born with the power to save and love and are the collosal reservoir of talent which has yet not been employed.
The bottom line of celebrating women\u2019s day is due to widespread differences in various fields-the pay difference of 14.9% between men and women, only 21.4% of seats for women in parliament around the world, lack of awareness for women education and many more. A conventional myth in the society is that issues related to women empowerment can only be addressed at an infinitesimally slower pace. Many people think that gender gap does not really exist and some are also of the belief that the efforts made by individuals cannot actually make any difference. These beliefs over the years have enfeebled the power of women. The first in the endeavor is to eradicate this deep rooted menace and realise that the problem can only be identified and solved by encountering the actual irrational vetoes of the society.
We are to take more advantage of the potentials and the talents of half of humanity and not just seek to anoint gender equality in principle. We are entering an exciting period of history where the world expects balance. We notice its absence and celebrate its presence. So make a difference, think globally and act locally to develop a balance for better.
This is a day to celebrate all ladies who have dared to dream big, the diversity and talent that lie within a feminine heart and the courage and determination that prevent every human from crumbling. A little girl with passion is turned into an inspiring woman of tomorrow. Celebrate all women and acknowledge the great things they do and tell every woman close to your heart, how much she means to you.

title: ICITAM 2019
body: The International Conference on Information Technology and Applied Mathematics was held in S.N.Bose auditorium from 7th of March to 9th of March. It functioned as a supreme forum for display and presentation of advances in the field of Information Technology and Applied Mathematics. This was a major opportunity for all the students interested in the respective fields; they got a chance to meet leading academic scientists, experts from renowned industries, and blooming researchers as well. The program\u2019s co-chairs are Mr.Oscar Castillo, Tijuana Institute of Technology, Mexico, Mr.Debasis Giri, Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology, India and our very own, Mr.Dipak Kumar Jana, Haldia Institute of Technology, India. Along with the demonstrations and research paper presentation, we witnessed a diversified cultural night performed by the students of Haldia Institute of Technology on 8th of March. Here are a few glimpses of the three day- program that was espoused by highly revered dignitaries and enthusiastic students.

title: Viral Corner
body:
Adhara P\u00e9rez S\u00e1nchez, might not ring the bells at the present moment but hopefully it will in a few years from now. Reason? There are a lot actually.

To begin with the background, she is just a ten year old Mexican girl but she certainly stands out from her peers with a huge gap in between. With an IQ of 162, which is actually believed to be two points more than that of Albert Einstein and Stephen Hawkings her academic file is all fat with degrees even at such a young age. She started with algebra at  an early age of three and graduated from high school by the time she was eight. Presently this wonder girl of ten is pursuing two engineering courses simultaneously in Mexico. One in Systems Engineering at Universidad CNCI and the other in Industrial Engineering with a focus on mathematics at UNITEC.

But sadly her childhood was not a bed of roses despite her talent. She was diagnosed with Asperger's syndrome , a kind of autism, which makes social interaction difficult at an age of three and hence was often called "weirdo" or "oddball" by her classmates.

But she outshined in her own unique way. Let\u2019s see if this aspiring astronaut could actually colonize in Mars and make her dream come true. All the best wishes for her future.

title: Disillusionment
body:
I'm stumbling in the rain, can't see the end,
I hear you say you are with me, but I see no proof.
Even though I'm broken down and nothing is left,
I'll give you all of me; my life is the only thing left.
I may be knocked down, but I know that you'll lift me up.
Incredulity drives through when it's dark and solemn around,
And when the storms of life come tearing through, I lose the sight of you.
Even though I can't locate you amidst darkness, I know you've never left my side.
Ergo, I'll continue praising you through this time;
I'm not broken, just bent over from the weight of this life.
So, I'll give it to you; I just have to believe in your promises,
I believe you'll wipe all the tears away and throw the burdens off.
I've traversed this road many a time, only to be met with confusion.
There's hope, but I've never come across it.
I'm spinning my wheel on that one small thing in my life, but I'll make it.
Dreaming is believing.

title: "Butterflies"
body:
\u201cThe magnificent butterfly finds a little heap of dirt and sits still on it, but men will never on his heap of mud keep still"-Joseph Conrad
Loved for her striking and diverse colors, she roams around everywhere, living her life independently, and gifting fervor grips to everyone. Wondering, what it may be? Well, it's a butterfly.
While we were cherubic lads, we were very fond of butterflies. Every one of us had adored the field hunting of butterflies. Even at this point in time, we are left awestruck when we trace them thronging in the full-bloomed chaparrals. They are small but approachable, they flutter around, lurk beneath the bushes, are even perishable, but still add beauty and color to the spaces they touch.
Erstwhile we find ourselves cocooned in isolation and despair and are unable to find our way out of the darkness. We think of giving up, but remember that this is similar to the phase a caterpillar goes through and emerge with majestic wings. A butterfly initiates her life as a round, oval egg. A similar phase of our life when we are in our mother's womb. When the egg hatches the larvae turn into caterpillars. For humans, this phase is of nourishing and growing a child to make him stand on his foot. The caterpillars are done growing once they reach their full-length and are now termed as a chrysalis. This impersonates our teenage. After the continuous metamorphosis, a butterfly emerges and spreads her wings to live her life independently alike us when we grow from mere boys into men.
We fulfill daily plodding-from going to college and meeting deadlines. This is an endless time loop that goes on forever. We can't escape these moments. Moments of values, moments of appreciation. So the next time when we spot a butterfly, we need to look beyond the binaries of an average human spectrum and feel the charm, look for hope, celebration, and transformation as this is what a butterfly symbolizes.

title: The annual college fests- A fresher's expectations
body:
Prayukti and Riviera. Amongst innumerable events, large-scale or small-scale, organised in Haldia Institute of Technology, these two are the most preferent ones. At the onset of every year, the even semester comes about with slews of exhilarating events, with a promise of trimming down the pressure of studies and examinations; the most stimulating ones being Prayukti and Riviera, the techno-management and cultural fests, respectively. Freshers as well as seniors await to either participate or perceive the fests and look forward to fall upon some refreshing events in the same.

Everyone's aware of the fact that the maximum number of participations comes from the flock of passionate and inquisitive freshers. This year, too, won't be an exclusion. There is hardly any fresher who hasn't participated in either of the fests- and why not? There are no less than 25 events in Prayukti, all of which are enough to pump up the entrants- gaming events, MUN, events based on the enthralling world of robotics and circuit-design, treasure hunt, coding event and many more! That's not the end- there's Riviera waiting to take you to cloud nine- from fashion shows to musical performances by students and renowned mainstream artists, Riviera provides you with one heck of an experience. 

All these augmented delineations of the fests increase the expectations of the freshers and, on the D-days, exude varied feelings of excitement. They participate, in the maximum number of events they are allowed to, and aim at winning accolades, including prizes in the form of hefty amount of money. Nevertheless, one could only carry out an appropriate reality-check on the forthcoming days and know whether the zeal's worthful.

title: Avengers : Endgame
body:
Not every fantasy or fictional books have the ability to draw their readers into their fictional world. The instance lies differently for the Marvel comics. The saga of Marvel superhero movies began when The Marvel Cinematic Universe dropped its first superhero movie IRONMAN in 2008. The film grossed over $585 million. It received praise from critics for its action, screenplay, visual effects, and action sequences. More than a decade after its launch The Marvel Cinematic Universe has become a force to be reckoned with.
Over the past 10 years, The MCU has provided fans with over 21 movies till date each one imgurling with the other. These movies were evenly spread over 3 phase of The MCU timeline collectively known as The Infinity Saga. Last year was the biggest blockbuster for Marvel Studios as the much awaited AVENGERS: INFINITY WAR hit the theatres. This indeed was the biggest project for The Marvel Studios. Made with a budget of $316-400 million this was the most expensive movie ever made. The much-anticipated movie was well received by fans all over the world. It grossed $2.048 billion worldwide. Packed with an incident from the off, it was an onslaught of action, thrills, gags, and gasps, played out with an ensemble so gigantic it leaves all other extended universe crossovers in the dust. This probably wasn\u2019t the best place for an uninitiated newbie to start. It took the audience to a place most tentpole movies wouldn't dream of. At the end of the movie, most of our popular superheroes were decimated leading their fate in a cliff hanger. Since then fans around the world want to know what the next movie might hold for them.
AVENGERS: ENDGAME the sequel of Avengers(2012), Avengers: Age Of Ultron(2015), and Avengers: Infinity War. Scheduled to release on April 26, 2019, the movie has already made fans go brainsick. Nobody expected that Thanos- a despot of intergalactic infamy, would succeed in his attempt to wipe out half of the universe for the sake of creating a balance amongst all living creatures and resources. We are all eagerly waiting for our dusted characters to come back to life. We are all waiting to see what Dr.Strange saw in his 14000605 outcomes of the battle. This movie will wind up a successful decade for The MCU. Moreover, this might be the last Avengers movie we will come across. Last week Marvel Studios dropped its second official trailer for the much-awaited movie of the year. Since then fans around the world have engrossed themselves in the trailer breakdown and suggesting fan theories. The dialogues "Some People Move on, but not us" and "Whatever it Takes" by our much-loved heroes including Captain America, Ironman, and Thor went viral after they decided not to move on and rather undo the wrong done to the living beings of the universe. With less than a month in its release, the movie has already set numerous records and has dominated geek conversations for days. We don't know what kind of grief the movie holds for us, we should prepare ourselves to mourn over once Avengers: Endgame hits the theatres and the fate of our heroes finally get settled.

title: Joystick Junkies
body:
Name of the game: Sleeping Dogs

Can you run it?
This game ran comfortably on a pc with a 2nd gen Core i3, 4gb
of RAM, with the integrated GPU of the Core i3, so it won\u2019t be much of a
trouble to run on modern machines

Minimum system requirements:
\u25cf CPU: Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or Althon X2 2.7 GHz
\u25cf CPU SPEED: Info
\u25cf RAM: 2 GB
\u25cf OS: Windows Vista Service Pack 2
\u25cf VIDEO CARD: DirectX 10 or 11 compatible Nvidia or AMD ATI card, ATI Radeon 3870 or
higher, Nvidia GeForce 8800 GT or higher
\u25cf PIXEL SHADER: 4.0
\u25cf VERTEX SHADER: 4.0
\u25cf SOUND CARD: Yes
\u25cf FREE DISK SPACE: 15 GB
\u25cf DEDICATED VIDEO RAM: 256 MB

Synopsis: Play as Wei Shen, an undercover cop from the US of A in the hustling and bustling streets of open-world Hong Kong, infiltrate the
infamous triads, and \u201cAction Hijack\u201d vehicles in this game, highly stylized and inspired by Chinese action movies.

Gameplay: This is an open-world game that is inspired by the GTA franchise, but brings a lot of innovations to the table. Wei Shen is a martial arts expert, and that\u2019s what you would be doing for the majority of
the game to finish off your enemies. The game has a unique levelling
system which involves three different areas of expertise: Triad, Cop and
Face. Levelling each of the areas of expertise gives you access to skills
based on that area of expertise: rank up your Triad level enough, and
you won\u2019t need to trigger alarms to steal cars, rank up your Cop level to
get more access to Police equipment, and the Face level is all aboutyour reputation among the Hong Kong locals. You get access to guns
pretty late in the game, but when you do, you get access to many more
skills, such as disarming enemies if you get close enough, Bullet Time
mechanics, and all that shiny stuff. As you progress through the game
you unlock more and more Martial Arts moves, and by the endgame, you
have become the superhuman equivalent of Jet Li and Jackie Chan put
together. Small spoiler: you should learn the Action Hijack thing, it\u2019s pretty epic.

Story: The story involves Wei Shen trying to infiltrate the Triad gangs, but getting more and more involved with them as he rises up the ranks
and gains more reputation. The story is a cheesy one, characteristic of Chinese action movies, and involves a lot of emotional moments. You
feel more and more attached to the characters in the game. Overall, the story does a good job of keeping you hooked to the game, when coupled
with the stellar gameplay mechanics.

TL;DR: A really great gameplay experience along with a good story, for
people wishing to get into some beat-em-ups and doing some cool tactical takedowns. The difficulty is very balanced, and would give you a sense of achievement without getting cumbersome. A very rewarding experience when you unlock more combos and make your way towards
becoming the unstoppable martial arts master.

title: TechBytes - Mercedes Benz AVTR
body:
We have often wondered what if cars could read our minds and operate according to the thoughts of the person. Well we don't have to wonder anymore because German luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz is here to make that dream a reality. At the recent IAA 2021 show in Munich, Germany it unveiled a new version of its AVTR concept car that uses "Brain Computer Interface" (BCI) technology to act in accordance to the wishes of its driver. The company's 'Vision AVTR' concept is inspired by the sci-fi movie 'Avatar'. The mock-up transportation's BCI is "similar to the neuronal connection between the Na'Vi and the nature".

This high-tech car aims to seamlessly merge man and machine, allowing humans to perform "intuitive interaction" with the vehicle. Void of the traditional steering wheel system, one has to simply wear electrodes on the head, think about something and it gets done. For example, the technology will allow you to change the music on the vehicle's stereo system without even lifting a finger. Raise a hand, and a menu selection is projected onto the palm of the hand. Users will have this auto-giant wrapped around their little finger.

BCI technology measures the brain function via a headset as the user focuses on light on the dashboard, it picks the signal and performs certain tasks like temperature control, A/C speed and interior lighting customizations. The first interaction between man and vehicle is completely intuitive. As soon as the driver places his hand on the centre console right next to his seat, the interior comes to life with the help of biometric detection. It can detect the pulse of the people in the car and also sense their breathing. "The Vision AVTR thus establishes a biometric connection with the driver and increases his awareness of the environment," said Mercedes.

Implementation of BCI technology in cars unravels revolutionary possibilities for intuitive interaction with cars in the future. This concept vehicle is just a stepping stone to the future of mobility, a future where man and technology will coexist in perfect harmony with each other.

title: TechBytes - Neil Harbisson
body:
#Techbytes
*"I am not using technology I am a technology"*
*Meet World's First Cyborg NEIL HARBISSON*
Neil Harbisson is a New York City-based artist and transspecies rights activist Globally and Legally recognized as the world's first Cyborg.
Born with achromatopsia (total color blindness), Harbisson's world was all black and white, but he saw his natural worldview as an asset, even though he wishes to comprehend dimensions of sight. To accomplish this, he began working on the antenna with Adam Montandon in college in 2003, and it has since been improved by Peter Kese and Matias Lizana.
The Cyborg Antenna is a sensory system that\u2019s designed to enhance color perception. It is implanted and Osseointegrated in Harbisson's head, protruding from his occipital bone and allowing him to feel and hear color schemes as audible vibrations inside his head, including infrared and ultraviolet, which are undetectable to the naked eye. The antenna also enables internet access and, as a result, color reception from other sensors and satellites. The ability to hear the sound of color may appear absurd to us, but Harbisson has been able to do so since 2004.
In the beginning, he would face a little difficulty but things changed once his brain began to adapt to the device, letting him see colors in his dreams. The device designed to aid him soon became a part of his body almost like an organ transforming him into a cyborg. The ability was not restricted to colors alone, He created a sound portrait describing the sound of one\u2019s face. But there were several consequences too- he began to hear normal sounds, such as a telephone ringing, in the color green. Moreover visiting an art gallery or supermarket seemed like visiting a concert or a nightclub.
Since 2010 Neil's non-profit organization The Cyborg Foundation has been fighting for cyborg rights and helping those who desire to be cyborgs.
What are your thoughts?  Is CYBORG something meant only for comics? Should we advance ourselves into one?

title: Book Review
body:
BOOK: MEIN KAMPF: My Struggle 

AUTHOR: ADOLF HITLER

Adolf Hitler. Mass Murderer. Most Notorious political leader. After knowing of the horrors of World War 2, more importantly, the Holocaust, the first question that comes to any sensible mind is why is this book even in print anymore. Even though the book is not a blueprint of the chambers of Auschwitz, to quote Major F. Elwyn Jones, junior counsel for the United Kingdom, \u201cFrom Mein Kampf the way leads directly to the furnaces of Auschwitz and the gas chambers of Maidanek.\u201d The book is essentially in two parts, the first part is \u201cThe settlement of Accounts\u201d or \u201cRevenge\u201d, was written in 1924 in the Bavarian fortress of Landsberg, where Hitler was imprisoned in 1923. It is in the first volume that we first see Hitler\u2019s anti-Semitic ideas, and how the Germans are essentially the more pure race and the Jews are parasites. Not only that, he even talked about how it was more humane to \u2018end the plight\u2019 of the specially challenged, as that is the nature\u2019s law, the survival of the fittest. And to him, no other race was better than the German Aryans. In Mein Kampf, Hitler used the main thesis of "the Jewish peril", which posits a Jewish conspiracy to gain world leadership. The narrative describes the process by which he became increasingly anti-Semitic and militaristic, especially during his years in Vienna. Another thing we come to know in the first volume is Hitler\u2019s relation with his father, even though according to most scholars, the filial affection between the men was rather fabricated by the author. An excerpt from the book reads \u201cMy father forbade me to nourish the slightest hope of ever being allowed to study art. I went one step further and declared that if that was the case I would stop studying altogether. As a result of such \u2018pronouncements,\u2019 of course, I drew the short end; the old man began the relentless enforcement of his authority.\u201d Lastly, the first volume talks about how the German masses should increase their living places, by encroaching onto the neighboring territories. This book is no work of literary masterpiece nor does it have any original ideas, also neither is it as appalling and snarly or creepy as one might think. What it does is provide the readers with is a monolog-ish repetitive narrative that might remain in the back of the mind of its readers. The second volume of the book, entitled \u201cThe National socialist Movement\u2019, after his release from the prison outlines the political program, including various methods to achieve a \u201cnew order\u201d.
           
There was no doubt varied opinions\u2019 regarding the reprinting of the book, especially in German, after the copyright rules expired in December of 2015. Two noteworthy things that should be mentioned here are that when the Nazi party came to power in 1933, it was not because of Hitler the writer but because of Hitler the orator because this book became a staple of the German households only after Hitler rose to power. The second and most important thing is that it now is better to talk about this book and its content in a classroom, rather than the curious pupils going on the internet to read about it, where the teachers cannot influence their opinions. So if you are looking to get a look at the mind of history\u2019s most notorious even though morbidly most successful dictator, then get yourself a copy today and embrace yourself for quite a few grammar errors and mind numbing logic.

title: Word Worth Million - Natsukashii
body:
Word:Natsukashii
Origin: Japanese
Pronunciation:Naat-su-katshii 
Meaning : a nostalgic longing for the past, with happiness for the fond memory, yet sadness that it is no longer
Usage: 
After so many years,
There he was in front of my eyes.
I felt myself drowning ,
in Saudade just at the sight. 
The dark loneliness still cried,
Natsukashii was the only hope of light.
All those memories echoed in my mind.
Was it for real? Daydream or what?
It can't be true ,
Not so fortunate or was I?
Meeting again was just an amazing dream.
The scene envisaged to me so many times
But happening for real was incredulous in itself
But here we are believe it or not.
A step forward or backwards?
That was all I thought...

title: Destination
body:
My parents began to sketch out an imaginary map of the path they believe I should take in order to have a successful life. A "successful life" is defined by how victoriously the map holder completes the journey that is set before him or her. As soon as a child can comprehend the meaning of words, a map of the long and difficult journey, described with hope and admiration, is set before them. The maps other than physical are passed on by mouth through family, friends, and acquaintances describing their experiences and opinions about the routes that they had taken on their own personal journey. A journey is made up of one overall map and various smaller maps, telling of the alternate routes that are available. On the map of my journey, I was told not to fall into the City of Trouble, to stay on Honor Street and continue on Career Road in order to end up at the town of Happiness and Security. My parents told me that I was expected to complete my journey of becoming both financially and emotionally stable.
Life is the journey we all traverse riding on the train we call Time and running on the tracks we call Destiny. And in this journey we meet people, explore, learn and avail experience. It is a journey filled with lessons, hardships, heartaches, joys, celebrations and special moments that will ultimately lead us to our destination, our purpose in life. The road will not always be smooth; in fact, throughout our travels, we will encounter many challenges and some of these will test our courage, strengths, weaknesses, and faith. 
It is a beautiful struggle. We must keep the journey going, not because of the guarantee but because of the possibility. It is a journey with so many options, a world to discover, dreams to chase, goals to reach and people to meet. So, continue on your imaginary map and reach your destination.

title: The Snacks Counter
body: Utpal Mohapatra, a 26-year-old man, who runs a perfect snack and mingling joint. Located beside the department of Electrical Engineering it is an epitome of a modest rejuvenating coffee hub. Moreover, providing the foodies with a minuscule essence of a paradise in a gray bleak land of Haldia. Hailing from the land of Contai, West Bengal he came to the premises of Haldia Institute Of Technology on being suggested by his elder brother. He has been assigned for feeding empty bellies since 2007. The cafe is visited by a plethora of students and faculty members throughout the day. After spending more than a decade in HIT, he has assorted persuasions on various batches of students who passed out from the institution. He adds that the quality of students has declined over the past years. He is planning on innovating the hub by adding multiple online payments options. His family comprises of his father, his elder brother and sister-in-law. Last but not least, he gives a special message to the students to believe in themselves and their abilities, so that they perform better in the future because in the end that is all that matters.

title: Virtual Labs
body: The IEEE Student's branch of Haldia Institute Of Technology organized a free of cost workshop on "Virtual Labs" on 18th April 2019. A plethora of students thriving for knowledge gathered in the CCF lab, multimedia lab, and RDBMS lab to gather cognition on the same. The project aimed to provide remote-access to Laboratories in various disciplines of science and engineering for students at all levels while also intending to develop a complete Learning Management System wherein the pupil can learn web-resources, video-lectures, animated demonstrations, and self-evaluation. A team of seven distinguished professors and scholars from IIT KGP addressed these sessions. The workshop turned out to be an epitome for all the tech educatee and was concluded with students acquiring satisfactory outcomes.

title: Chess Tournament
body: After a number of exciting events and tournaments in sports, the Chess Tournament was organized on 21st April, 2019, that is, today, in the Department of Electrical Engineering , 1st Floor. As many as 160 students, with astute decision-making skills, participated in the same, which began at around 10 am. The rules were as generic as pie. \u2018Twas a \u201cSwiss league match\u201d which followed the \u201ctouch and move\u201d rule; the \u201cwalkover\u201d system was applicable. Each participant was allotted a time period of 15 minutes. There were two rounds: one was from 10 am to 1 pm, while the other was from 2 pm to 5 pm. The participants used their intellect and cunning to the fullest, which resulted in intriguing games.

title: Khanahbadosh
body:
Khanahbadosh
Meaning- Wanderer
Origin- Urdu

It's the light of the sky that warms the crumbled sleeves of the heart.
The unknown waves that kisses the feet and tends to the open wounds.
It's the woods that forces a scream of the long lost words buried in the heart. 
They ask me, " What is this wanderlust?"
Sometimes, it's unfair to cage a bird. 
No home, no strings bound to the eternal chains of looking back.
Just a beautiful fear of walking into the unknown. 
Maybe birds like that ain't meant to be caged.
To a place. A job. Or a person. 
I'll find solace in the wind brushing through my hair,
And the whisper of the words forming a babble.
An open road,
And the simple pleasure of being lost in the labyrinth of the unknown,
Only to find a way back home,
To a heart that'll beat to the same rhythm of the unknown.

PC (IG) - @breakawaytribe

title: The Seven Ages
body:
William Shakespeare in his poem "The Seven Ages" describes the phases of human life through soliloquies. "All the world's a stage..." appropriately reflects the metaphor of human life as a play with actors. One amongst those stages of life is the phase of being an innocent, slow, reluctant, school child.
While we were mere cherubic lads our mothers used to narrate us bedtime stories. It was a phase when innocence over-shadowed almost every mistake. We believed in the irrationals of Santa Clause, Fairy Tales and even stories of Monster under the bed. They help in the instrumentation of a child's well being in the emotional and physical state.
Children are a reflection of emotions-smile, laugh, cry and with glittering eyes gazing with bewilderment. Moreover, they are a contemplation of pious air of heaven. They bring essence and notions of eternity. Gifted with physical beauty and innate humor they are a depiction of innocence. They grow up to bridge the gap between innocence and experience. They can trigger strong emotions; they stay happy for no reasons; they are curious and fight tirelessly for something. But, what's in a child that no adult has? Well, the answer is they live in the moment. They seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves them free to enjoy, which only a few adults can. The day we fret about our future is the day we grow up to be an adult. 
Today, a few of us are grown up while some still need to span this gap of being mature and experienced. Look at the night sky you'll see innocence. Listen to the chirping of innocent birds you'll experience calmness. Experience the earth breathing out of white and pink blossoms, you'll see what's it like raising a child. Life affords no greater responsibility, no greater privilege, than raising of the next generation. Let the child within ourselves lives before the phase of the second childishness and mere oblivion.

title: International Yoga Day
body:
Yoga is an ancient physical, mental and spiritual practice that originated in India.
The word \u2018yoga\u2019 derives from Sanskrit and means to join or to unite, symbolizing the union of body and consciousness. On this note, the Indian Prime Minister, Narendra Modi, in his UN address, suggested the date of 21 June, as it is the longest day of the year in the Northern Hemisphere and shares a special significance in many parts of the world.

Today it is practiced in various forms around the world and continues to grow in popularity. International Yoga Day aims at raising awareness worldwide of the many benefits of practising yoga.

\u300bBenefits of Yoga: Yoga is very necessary and beneficial for all human beings if it is practiced by all on daily basis in the early morning.

The benefits of Yoga include :-

-Increased muscle strength and tone
-Increased flexibility
-Improved respiration,energy and vitality
-Maintaining a balanced metabolism
-Weight reduction
-Cardio and circulatory health
-Improved athletic performance

The HIT Times observes International Yoga Day and urges the audience to practice yoga, early in the morning, in order to remain active and fit throughout the day!

title: Viral Corner
body:
Referred to the context of the scenario in the past couple of months, everything has come down to this one term "COVID-19." Amidst this onerous of a situation, over the past week the US president, Donald Trump has been aggressively promoting the hydroxychloroquine drug as a treatment for coronavirus, despite there being no conclusive medical evidence to prove its potency. Not only he encouraged his people for consuming this drug without proper medical consultation; now he is leaving no page unturned to secure the abundance of this drug stock for his nation.

India, being the world\u2019s largest producer of hydroxychloroquine, had put a temporary export ban on the drug. This was done in order to preserve the domestic stocks. But in a statement on Tuesday i.e 7th of April, Anurag Srivastava, a government spokesperson, said that India had lifted some restrictions after it has been confirmed by the respective officials that the availability of medicines for all possible contingencies has been secured. The drug has been categorized under 'licensed' but will be continuously monitored. And in medical front, these tablets are used to prevent and treat malaria, lupus and rheumatoid arthritis.

The partial lifting of the export ban came only after Trump confirmed he had called Narendra Modi, the prime minister of India and basically threatened him of \u201cretaliation\u201d if the country did not release its stocks. This statement is a harsh contrast to the nature of relationship between the two as on his inaugural visit to India in February, Trump declared Modi as an \u201cexceptional leader\u201d and \u201ctrue friend\u201d.

The basis for the president\u2019s proclamations of the drug as a "game changer" has been completely dismissed by pharmaceutical experts and major medical bodies. However it is very obvious that Trump has developed an obsession with hydroxychloroquine as a miracle cure for coronavirus, and publicly also stated that the US had already stockpiled 29m doses of the drug. Now it remains to be seen what course of events follow given that more than 1500 patients in New York has already been dosed with the drug.

title: Shades of Life
body:
\u2022Shades of Life\u2022

"Sometimes you fight what you are, and sometimes you give in to it. And some nights you just don\u2019t want to fight yourself anymore." 
-Laurell K. Hamilton

Ever since we were mere nestlings, we were taught to follow an appropriate path of becoming an ideal and reputed figure in society. Somewhere between getting those lessons from our parents and implementing them in our lives, we grew up. As we have turned into adults, we are expected to meet our demands, all by ourselves. As the society seeks, this is the idyllic age to bear witness to what we were taught. Our society asks us to be perfectly world-wise, curious and ingenious human beings. But, it doesn't teach us about the thorns that would come in our path while seeking the flowers. It has always expected the outcome off of us, irrespective of the pain and the struggles that life would engage us in.

While a few of us emerged victorious from the sea of expectations, most of our boats are on the verge of sinking. The unending demands and wishes of the society meddle with our lives. Few get betrayed, while the rest get cheated on or are on the verge of perishing. All in all, it turns out that, we are unable to cope up with the state of affairs because we are under high societal pressure. Our society doesn't accept flaws. We entangle ourselves so much in searching success that we forget to love ourselves. We forget that failing gives rise to new hopes and aspirations. Above all, it gives rise to our new self.

By the end of the day, it all comes down to how much effort we put in. If we fail today, it implies that a new tomorrow awaits us. Maybe we couldn't seize the present day but who knows about tomorrow? Even the mighty Sun that shines majestic throughout the day has to set with the fall of the dawn. As the universe tips towards the commencement of a new beginning, so does our lives.

\u2022Picture Courtesy: 
Aritra Majumder (16/ME/125)

title: Ebony Hues
body:
\u2022Ebony Hues

Black like the depths of the oceans,
That's how I am.
Others come to me with their problems,
I lend them an ear and help them solve them like equations.
My coal black hues swallowing the emotions of others;
Never to let them see the light again.
But, even though I care for others,
Nobody wants my ebony hues.
So I am black, always taking in, never letting out.
The wind whispering it's dilemma in my ears,
Just like a damsel with curly black hair.
She enters my room and
Spits out her problems, like a sour cough syrup.
Into the black cauldron it goes,
As I were a wizard with no problems of his own.
It bubbles but has nowhere to go,
For I am the one who gulps it in.
I experience the pain and sorrow, never love or comfort.
Myself, he stares at the mirror.
As if I were a hairless alien,
My eyes, big and round.
He wonders what is wrong,
But knows not the despair;
As my coal-rimmed black eyes keep on staring at him;
For, even the brightest day can't save me from the dark,
I'm black like the depths of the oceans.

title: Happy Birthday J.K. Rowling!
body:
"Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light."

The creator of the famous Harry Potter series, J.K. Rowling was born on July 31, 1965. The 53-year-old writer is turning a year older, adding another year of wisdom and fame to her life. She is no stranger to anyone who loves to read books. Known by her pen name usually, Rowling\u2019s original name is Joanne. She has also authored books like 'Casual Vacancy', 'The Silkworm', ' Lethal White', and 'The Cuckoo's Calling' under the pseudonym of Robert Galbraith. Born in Yate, Gloucestershire, England, Rowling is one of the best-selling authors in the world.

J.K. Rowling did teach us to turn on the light in ourselves and fight the darkness away, just like she said, "We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves, already."
The HIT Times wishes her a magical fifty-fourth Birthday! May the spell that she has cast with her words grow evermore strong and enticing to readers, all around the globe!

title: RIP Sushma Swaraj
body:
In a democratic country like India, where political leaders come and go, enumerable leaders tend to emerge from the aspects of just political agendas and insinuate in people's heart. One amongst those prominent leaders was 67 years old Sushma Swaraj. On the night of 6th August 2019, we came across the news stating the untimely demise of India's best-loved politician. She suffered a cardiac arrest and was admitted to AIIMS Delhi. But, Alas! Destiny played its card.
Born on 14 February 1952, Swaraj came to be recognized as one of the eminent leaders when she stood in opposition to the then Prime Minister Ms. Indira Gandhi. She was elected as a Member of Parliament seven times and she even served as a member of the legislative assembly three times. In 1998, she was elected as the Chief Minister of Delhi. She was elected as the minister of external affairs for the tenure of 2014-19.

Sushma Swaraj was a great lady, an exceptional human being who never retreated from fulfilling her chores while serving as a ministry and helping the people in distress. She was an affectionate personality, a powerful orator, a true servant of our country and an inspiration to millions.

We extend our earnest condolences to this sorrowful and tragic demise. It's a national loss mourned by millions. May her soul rest in peace. You can rest now Sushma Swaraj Ji.

title: International Tiger Day
body:
29th July is celebrated as International Tiger Day, every year, in order to raise more and more awareness about conservation of tigers and promotion of their natural habitat.

This day was established in 2010, at Saint Petersburg Tiger Summit in Russia, to raise awareness about the decline of wild tiger numbers, leaving them in the brink of extinction and to encourage the work of Tiger conservation. In the Summit, a declaration was made that Governments of tiger populated countries had vowed to double tiger population by 2020.

With just 3200 tigers left on Earth, let us take inspiration from the strong and fearless tigers and let us make a promise to save them on International Tiger Day. It is high time that we act to protect them and save them from getting extinct.

"Happy International Tiger Day!\u201d\ud83d\udc2f

title: Book Review
body:
Name of the book: Why We Sleep
Author: Matthew Walker
Rating: 4.5/5.0
Recommended: Yes!!

"The best bridge between despair and hope is a good night\u2019s sleep."
Matthew Walker

Given the world that we survive in, we have all acquired more knowledge of sleeping pills than the actual effects of 'sleeping' itself. This book by acclaimed neuroscientist Matthew Walker delves into the startling information about the effects of suboptimal shut-eye levels. Yes, he does state a few facts, as in relating conditions due to lack of sleeping to Alzheimer's; which aren't quite medically proven as of till now. But, even if we leave out these small details, there's so much more to learn from this book.

In the end, we all do strive to be a better version of ourselves, and Walker just focuses on a minute but an extremely important factor to this self development. In this piece, he discusses on the role-play of sleep in all sorts of causes for morbidity and mortality. Grounded on today's culture, our author elaborates that how sleeping is wrongly tagged as something for wimps and the admiration we have for people who supposedly sleeps only four or five hours. As an example, he points at Margaret Thatcher and Ronald Reagan, both of whom consequentially succumbed to dementia. Also, he emphasizes the fact that crucially one cannot catch up on lost sleep and sleeping late at the weekend will not undo the damage done during the week and also how important it is to have a proper schedule for it.

A little word of warning though that some pages can get a bit too dramatic. But on the fair parts, our writer is a certified neuroscientist, so trust him with his words. Hence, for all those late nighters and sleep deprived overworking studs out there, taking a peek into this book will help you to rectify your current situation.

title: Grammarism
body:
\u2022I practise/practice the piano every day.
If you chose \u201cpractise\u201d as your answer then you are absolutely correct with the usage of practice and practise. To understand this difference we need to go back to the very roots of grammar, specifically the parts of speech and also the different forms of English like the British, American, etc. In British English practise is a verb and practice is a noun. Whereas in American English,  practice is used as both the noun and verb. A general thumb rule for this can be those forms that end in ce or cy are nouns. The other forms that end in se or sy are verbs. Other examples include, advice\u2019 is a noun, whereas \u2018advice\u2019 is a verb. In the same way, prophecy is a noun, whereas prophecy is a verb.
Examples
1. What advice do you have for the first day of college? (noun)
2. Please advise me on what to do when filling in this application(verb)
3. I practise the piano every day. (practise \u2013 verb)
4. You just need some practice. (practice \u2013 noun)
5. Some of her prophecies have come true.
6. The Mayans prophesied that the world would end in 2012.

title: Viral Corner
body:
DD National started re-telecast of the classic Ramanand Sagar's Ramayana as the part of the channel's broadcast lineup during the 21 days nationwide lockdown on public demand. This re-telecast became a massive hit as it took the older generations and 90s kids down the memory lane.

According to the recently released data by Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC)India, Ramayana's re-telecast has got the highest ever rating for a Hindi General Entertainment Channel show since 2015. It garnered 170 million viewers in four shows over the last weekend. It also became the most watched serial in the Hindi general entertainment space. It was also the highest rated in urban as well as megacities. The inaugural episode of Ramayan on Saturday had an audience of 34 million which was equivalent to a rating of 3.4 percent. The re-telecast of the same episode in the evening garnered a viewership of 45 million Indians. The rating in the evening broadcast had increased to 5.2 percent, which is highest for any show to date.

Apart from Ramayana, the state-run broadcaster Doordarshan has further expanded on its slew of nostalgic offerings to keep viewers engaged at this time. Among the classics revived by the network are mythological epic Mahabharat and historical dramas Chanakya. On popular demand the also started the re-telecast of the superhero show Shaktiman and popular classic detective show Byomkesh Bakshi.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
\u201cMosques aren\u2019t the places meant to preach
It is the abode of the almighty, where you find inner peace\u201d

Situated in Abu Dhabi and acting as a beacon for all, the Sheikh Zayed mosque is truly one of its kind. With 82 white marble domes adorning the top and 96 semi precious jewels in the internal columns, it really is an architectural wonder. The grand mosque was constructed between 1996 and 2007 under the guidance of Yousef Abdelky, a Syrian architect. The project was launched by late president of UAE, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan who wanted to unite the cultural diversity of Islamic world. His final resting place is in the courtyard of the complex.

Currently holding the title of the largest mosque, the Sheikh Zayed mosque has the capacity to take in 40,000 people in the main prayer hall with 1500 each in the sub-prayer hall, one of which is reserved for the women.
An artistical feat at its best, the mosque is quite appealing to look and has a calm and peaceful feeling, just by entering the mosque, you will feel as if you have been transported to the oriental world, where the sheikhs held the titular positions. The intricate marble work, the wall paintings, all of these contribute towards making the Sheikh Zayed mosque a one-of-a-kind place.
So, if you ever get a chance to visit Abu Dhabi, make sure you visit this mosque, although with the proper dress code; the men are not allowed to wear shorts whilst women are required to wear long sleeved shirts and long pants. Take in a brief moment of peace, an escapade from reality and dive into the cultural heritage as you visit the Sheikh Zayed mosque.

title: Book Review
body:
Name of the book: Norwegian Wood
Author: Haruki Murakami
Rating: 5.0/5.0
Recommended: A definite yes

"Death exists, not as the opposite but as a part of life." ~Toru ( from Norwegian Wood)

Named after the popular song by The Beatles, " Norwegian Wood" is one of a kind masterpiece by the Japanese writer Haruki Murakami. Set in the backdrop of the Japan of the 1960s during the period of student revolution, this\u00a0coming-of-age dark romance takes us through the life of a guy called Toru Watanabe. 

Toru moves to Tokyo for further studies. He is haunted by his melancholic past. The suicide of his best friend Kizuki has him shattered and his only way forward is to move on and continue his academic front. This is when Naoko, the then girlfriend of his dead friend also comes to Tokyo for the same reason and a chance encounter one day brings them together.\u00a0 In spite of their initial closeness, Naoko rejects any prospect of them being together. Then we also have the fun loving vivacious Midori, who also falls for Toru. But things don't turn out as easy on the surface. These three individuals are broken on the inside and are fighting their own demons. As life goes on, these characters find themselves amidst the adversities of the world, dwelling on the emotional aspects of life. The complicated relationships scarred by grief and death holds a very real dynamic of mortality in this piece.

Murakami time and time tackles the rapacious aspects of some human relationships. He wrote this piece with detailed vision while portraying each of the characters to their realest form. The characters along with their personal journey is what makes this novel so heart wrenching and beautiful. Simplified writing and easy flow of the story just makes it more readable. Murakami creates an\u00a0intricate web of plots which keeps the reader glued to the book. So, for anyone searching for some intensely emotional and real read, look no further than the " Norwegian Wood."

title: #InternationalDayAgainstDrugAbuseAndIllicitTrafficking
body:
\u201cWhat is addiction, really? It is a sign, a signal, a symptom of distress. It is a language that tells us about a plight that must be understood.\u201d \u2013 Alice Miller

The human mind is a prolific home of contradictions, the mechanisms of which can churn out the best but can also be equally equipped to bring out the worst.

Throughout decades, it is mankind that has repeatedly put its mettle to work in order to device some magic drug to cure an incurable disease. These torchbearers of our society have taken lifestyle light years ahead by providing people a chance to be free of pain or to live a longer life in health.

But on the other hand, it is also mankind that has stumbled upon the misuse of drugs, that was once a boon. Clinging to the stereotypes, we are well aware of the fact that the percentage of young adults on drugs is much more than the mid-aged strata of the society. Authoritarians and their eventual jurisdictions believe that cutting out their production or distribution might make society a drug free place to live in. Of course, this approach seems more feasible than addressing the real issue. Imposition of rules is always easier than diving to the root of the problem and fixing it. The questions to be asked are rather simple. " Why do people do drugs?" It's a naive belief that most people are on it just to have the fun of it. Mostly, on careful investigation of the conscience and the emotional background of these people, it is found out that drugs act as an escape route from reality, from society that must have left behind scars of unjust trauma, be it the pressure from parents to qualify as an exceptional academic, or unrequited love, or the trauma of physical harassment; the psychological aspects can be unending.

Therefore, before quick conclusions of labeling such people as criminals, it is very important to hold a knowledge of the "why".

The answers may be difficult to address but it'll also open a more understanding and logical portal of approaching the problem. 
Therefore, on this day and every day to come, it goes out as a humble request to all people to wake up and face the darker corners of their mind and resolve the rotten sentiments that are safely tucked under the blanket of denial. Only then can we all find a way that diverges from the path of self-destruction due to subsequent drug abuse. 
On the contrary, there is always hope for a better tomorrow, a productive life and a future that might look a lot more brighter without the euphoric bliss of drugs. Therefore, live and prosper and understand that problems are to be solved and met with solutions, not forgotten and ignored and stiffled by artificially synthesized chemical compounds. The human life is always more valuable and cherishable than that.

title: Kabir Singh- was it worth it to be viral?
body:
\u2022Disclaimer: We do not concern ourselves with reviewing the film, rather, we want to throw light on how certain scenes, interpretations and dialogues in "Kabir Singh" went viral momentarily.

Kabir Singh. Just a mere name? No. It's a fictional character which, currently, is the talk of the town. A Bollywood film starring Shahid Kapoor and Kiara Advani as Kabir and Preethi, respectively, it is perhaps the most talked about film in 2019, being mired in various controversies as well. Moreover, it's the remake of the equally popular Tollywood film, titled Arjun Reddy, that released a year ago. While, Kabir Singh released a week ago and is earning hefty amounts of moolah at the box office, let's delve into the reality and know the exact reasons that popularized the film and made \u201cKabir Singh\u201d a household name.

1) Many North Indians had indulged in watching Arjun Reddy, in Hindi-dub, in 2018 during its release. The original film, having few tinges of realism, succeeded in attracting North Indians too. They liked it and yearned for a Bollywood-remake, till June, 2019.

2) Movie buffs these days tend to like aggressive and psychedelic characters more. Moreover, they liked Shahid Kapoor in films like Kaminey, Haider and Udta Punjab. Ergo, what's there to detest Kabir Singh?

3) Films based on college-life, regardless the plausibility, have attracted college-goers, since time immemorial. That's a reason in itself.

4) No sooner did the film get to see the light of the day than its boat started sinking into the unfathomable ocean of controversies. The mixed reviews that the film already received had a certain sector of the audience point out the vehemence exhibited on a na\u00efve woman like \u201cPreethi\u201d and the maid servant of Kabir, by Kabir himself! These incidents instigated \u201cmemers\u201d. And the outcome? Tons and tons of memes on social media! Obviously, Kabir Singh gained utmost popularity.

5) Lastly, the soulful and symphonious numbers in the album. (Sad songs have always been among the favourites!)

One week's passed since its release. Mostly, negative publicity made it viral. Mixed reviews. Mixed ratings. However, in B-town, every filmmaker wants to rule the box-office, which Sandeep Reddy Venga surely is doing, and would continue to do so for at least two weeks more. All hail commercial films!

What do you think is the aptest reason for Kabir Singh to go viral to such an inexplicable extent? Let us know in the \u201ccomments\u201d section.

title: Schmutz
body:
\u300b Word: Schmutz.
\u300b Origin: Yiddish.
\u300b Meaning: A kind of unholy dirt, which may not necessarily be physical and is mostly imaginary but is certainly present.

Keeping clean is important in every religion, custom and tradition. Before sitting down to a meal, we wash our hands. But do we need to do the same after having the meal? Even though we had not touched the food with our hands and our hands are as clean as they could be! In certain traditions, you certainly do, because after having your food your hands are smeared in a kind of grime, that may or may not be visible to the eye. It is just there. Possibly invented by germaphobes of prehistoric times, it\u2019s a kind of dirt that is just there, regardless of the fact, whether you can see it or not. Thus, the requirement of an extra handwashing, just to be on the safe side. In hindi we have the term 'juttha' and in bengali we call it 'Ettho.' In Judaism it is 'schmutz.' The only way to be rid of it is following your hand wash with a short prayer and lo! Your hands are spic and span! Although this had almost nothing to do with physical cleanliness, as it takes place after your hands are already clean.

title: Loneliness
body:
Loneliness?

What do you know of it?

You prate about loneliness but do you not realise that one is never alone?

We are equitably accompanied by the uncertainty of the future and the burden of the past; those we've loved, those who loved us and whom we did not love. Regrets, desires, bitterness and sweetness. Always, always with us!

Alas, if only in this loneliness, this ghoul-haunted wilderness, we could know, but for a moment, real solitude, real silence. Maybe then the idea of loneliness would not seem so unlikely. Infact, we might find solace in being forlorn, before we are dragged back into the abysses of expectations, responsibilities and the judgemental spheres of everyone's mind.

title: #NationalDoctorsDay
body:
The 1st of July harbours an undeniable significance as it marks the National Doctor's Day in honor of the former Chief Minister of West Bengal, Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy. 
In the past few days, the doctors have been quite the eye candy for the media because of various unresolved issues between the professionals and the government. For once, the entire nation was subjected to the opinions and the views of doctors; the ones who have always stayed behind the curtains and helped out humanity with tireless hours of work and compassion.

It is regardless to say that a healthy and functioning society is always on the maps because of them. Mostly, being a doctor is not only a profession. It's a state of being that comes beyond fat textbooks of Anatomy and Physiology. It's the unbound desire to help mankind, to reduce ailings, to relieve people from pain, to evade death, and above all to enlighten this world with new specks of light and hope. Irrespective of caste, creed, religion, day, month, or weather, they are found to stand by their Hippocratic Oath to honor their profession and dignity.

Though the commemoration of a special day does not matter much, since the commoners of the society always find themselves grateful towards the heroes without the capes, it is yet a necessity to observe such a day in order to convey the selfless social workers that they are important for the people of the society, and we as human beings will always be obliged for their undeterred services towards the well being of mankind.

title: Of semester-breaks and how to utilise them to the fullest...
body:
Hola amigos!! Hope you are thoroughly enjoying your summer break and having a good time away from the monotonous class schedules. As much as we want to lay back on our couches having a gala time watching our favourite series, it is equally important to add some value to these breaks. Amidst all the hustle and bustle that goes on in almost all engineering colleges throughout the semesters, these month long breaks are the time that a student gets for himself/herself, to nurture his/her own extra curriculars or explore some new arenas of their field of studies.

The fresh fourth years are mandated to intern at some organization during the summer break. Though there isn't any such uptight rule for the juniors, it is advisable that they do not indulge very much into a lazy and idle vacation. The thought of staying back at home and hanging out with loved ones might seem lucrative but a little bit of constructive utilization of the time would be beneficial. The world out there regards our CVs as our first impression. Hence it should be made sure that it is enriched, and this is the best time to work on it. We should avail the break to nurture our academical and non academical skills that would help us in the long run. The piled up assignments, lab work, internals during the semesters doesn't really allow us to work on ourselves for our own betterment.

So balance work and play, enjoy the break and at the same time get involved in constructive affairs. Enjoy enrich and avail the break for the best of purposes.

title: Shubh Rath Yatra!
body:
One of the most resplendent of the innumerable Hindu festivals, celebrated round the year, Ratha Yatra is the grand culmination of a series of celebrations spread across the months of summer and the monsoon. Akshayya Tritiya tithi marks the beginning of the construction of the Rathas(chariots) for the ceremonial journey and sojourn of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra and Subhadra at the Gundicha temple for a week. On the full-moon day of the month of Jyestha (May-June) in the Snana Yatra, the Bathing Festival, when the three deities move in colourful processions to a platform in the outer enclosure of the temple, the Snana Vedi, the bathing platform, where they bathe with one hundred and eight pitchers of perfumed water drawn from a temple well, annually.

After the ritual bath, the deities assume the special elephant form, recalling the legend of the Lord's affection for a devotee, whom He proved that He was in fact another manifestation of Lord Ganesha. At the end of the Snana Yatra day, the holy triad, supposedly afflicted with fever, do not return to their pedestal in the sanctum. They stay away from the public view for a period of fifteen days, called Anasara, after which they appear in their Navayauvana Vesha, literally a renewed youth, on the new moon day of the Month of Ashadha.

During this fortnight the icons get a fresh coat of painting which gets washed out on the day of the Bathing Festival. During this period the Sevakas, the temple servants, also symbolically convalesce with the deities and eat only fruits and other restricted diet. Cloth paintings, representing the deities called Anasara Pati, are displayed beyond the enclosers hiding the deities for the devotees to see and worship. Finally comes the Ratha Yatra on the second day of the bright fortnight of the month Of Ashadha when the three deities, come out of the temple in a spectacular procession called pahandi. The deities, colossal wooden statues, adorned with giant floral crowns, called Tahias, are literally pulled, pushed and dragged in rhythmic movement to the accompaniment of the beat of cymbals, drums and chanting of their names in chorus by devotees in frenzied ecstasy. After all the deities are seated in their respective chariots starts the Chhera Pamhara the ritual sweeping of the chariots with a golden broom by the Gajapati King of Puri,the foremost servant of God, the Adya sevaka of Lord Jagannath. The King comes from his palace on a richly decorated palanquin.

The most exciting part of the Rath yatra is the pulling of chariots by a plethora of people who lay their hands on the sturdy ropes and drag the massive structures along the Bada-Danda, the grand road. The Chariot of Balabhadra moves first, followed by those of Subhadra and Jagannath.

The return of the chariots takes place in the same order as in the rath yatra. Balabhadra's chariot moves first, followed by those of Subhadra and Jagannath. On the next day, the three deities, are attired in costumes of glittering gold and are worshipped by thousands of devotees.

The three Chariots of Balabhadra,Subhadra and Jagannath are constructed each year with Sal wood, customarily brought from the ex-princely State of Dasapalla, by a specialist team of carpenters having hereditary rights for this. Carpenters excelling at woodcarving still produce these chariots for the car festival, and also carve ornate images of deities upon them. While on the other hand applique work can be seen during processions of the deities in their various ritual outings.

In West Bengal, Rath Yatra is celebrated with almost matchable grandeur of that in Puri. Temples of Lord Krishna are thronged by His devotees where Kirtans are sung with utmost devotion. Children decorate and pull small chariots, having idols of the three deities, on the footpaths, in observance of this day. In all, there's happiness everywhere and in every heart!

In conclusion, The HIT Times wishes all the readers a Shubh Rath Yatra; Jai Jagannath!

title: #TikTok
body:
Everyone requires a medium of entertainment in life- be it reading preferent books or an article, or watching fave movies with family and loved ones- it could be anything. Many find gaming apps on cellphones entertaining and end up being glued to them for hours- that's still fine. However, what isn't fine is the usage of certain apps, which, when used in the name of procrastination, could lead to untoward predicaments. One of the most popular of these is TikTok, the video-making app, which some people find \u201centertaining\u201d.

It all started 3 years ago and spread almost like an epidemic- towards the end of 2017. Almost everyone on earth was cognized of its presence in the Play Store. The unnecessary hype made more people download it and, what was next? It became intensely viral in India, in a jiff!

It was still fine until the onset of 2018, when Indians were helplessly hooked onto TikTok, making videos- some being too cringeworthy to watch. Thus, they ended up procrastinating and harming themselves in ways unimaginable.

Regrettably, the TikTok trend has reached the hospital wards too!

The gaucherie crossed all its limit recently, when a group of \u201cnurses\u201d, working in a neonatal care unit, at a hospital in Odisha, were found making videos on TikTok, while the new-born babies were left unattended!
In one of the viral videos, the nurses were seen dancing to the tunes of Bollywood songs. In another, a nurse even posed with a new born baby in her arms. Most of the videos were recorded with bed and stretchers in the background- slow claps for the act of shame and jejunity!

However, as the video of them swooning to Bollywood numbers went viral, instead of condemning it, they ignored it as they've been doing since ages. Actions were supposed to be taken, however, as nothing happened to the babies, no action was taken to throw them out of the hospital for an act of negligence like that. What if something dreadful had happened to the new-borns? Then who'd have been answerable for the happenings?

Although, a few months ago, Supreme Court had banned the usage of the app, it lifted the ban eventually. Since then, people have started using it with all their passion and dedication! May God bless them and make them realize what dire conditions they've put themselves into...

title: Book Review
description: Sapiens : A Brief History of Humankind
body:
Sapiens : A Brief History of Humankind review 


'Sapiens : A Brief History Of Humankind' by Yuval Noah Harari is a non-fiction book first published in Hebrew in 2011, later published in English in 2014. It aims to understand "the ways in which biology and history have defined us and enhanced our understanding of what it means to be 'human.'" - as per the book itself. For barely over four and half a hundred pages, it's a lofty goal to set. 

The book begins even before the beginning of humankind, and takes the reader on a journey through the 4 major landmarks in human evolution - the cognitive revolution, the agricultural revolution, the unification of mankind, and the modern society. Rather long anthropogenetic processes merged with cognitive improvements, allowing the capacity to jump from the material to the abstract, leading to creation of complex imaginary structures that exist only in our collective imagination. These structures then evolved, creating unprecedented and powerful abstractions like gods, money and LLCs. This whole process is put under the historian's microscope for careful examination. 

It should be noted that the author himself is a professor at the Department of History, Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

Despite a serious subject, the book is neither dense nor boring. The writing and pacing is reminiscent more of a mystery novel than a research paper. The points made are accessible for even a novice and the research behind  them do not manifest tediously in the text at any point. The writing style is that of a storyteller, not sterile at all. Simply put, the book is easy to read and interesting. As a result, it has been received very well by the mass and has made its way to many domestic conversations, a place most non-fiction books fail to reach. Many have called it a publishing phenomenon and a turning-point for the genre. 

Being a book written for the mass market and being, consequently, reasonably sized means that while the array of subjects covered by the book is impressive, the depth of information presented is  definitely not. And while the book succeeded at getting accolades and awards aplenty, critics and experts on the subject have made it abundantly clear that the book is meant to be served as infotainment, not an academic compendium. Some have even said that it is not credible source of information and should not be touted as such.

So, is it worth a read? Well, if you are not an expert on anthropogenesis and sociology,  I believe this book will educate you a lot. And even if you're are an expert, you will still be able to get some value from a new perspective. After all, it is not only a popular science book, but also rather engaging, well written story.

title: World Population Day
body:
Before we dive head-first into discussing the concerning issues of the world population, let us know a little about how the World Population Day came into existence. On July 11th 1989, the Governing Council of the United Nations Development Programme established World Population Day, to raise awareness on global population issues. It was to highlight the challenges and opportunities of population growth and its impact on our planet's sustainability, heavy urbanization, availability of health care and youth empowerment. Envisaged as an annual event, it was inspired by the public interest in Five Billion Day on July 11, 1987-approximately the date on which the world\u2019s population reached five billion people.

Currently, the population of the world is about 7.7 billion people and growing at a rate of around 1.07% per year. Therefore, in order to support 11 billion people by 2100, we must change the way we use the world\u2019s resources. The world economy must grow but if we don\u2019t radically change the way we consume the planet, we will be heading for the end of our consumer society and standard of living as we know it.

At current trends, the planet cannot sustain twice as many people and a 26 times larger economy that will be needed to support additional people. According to the United Nations, there is need for a new industrial revolution where economic wealth goes hand-in-hand with environmental and social sustainability.

The challenge awaits us, and hopefully we are up for it. Otherwise future generations will face war, famine, massive migration, and genocide of ethnic and religious groups.
