title: Pelinti
body:
>>Word: Pelinti
>>Origin: Buli, Ghana.
>>Literal meaning: The painful experience of moving hot food around in your mouth but not quite being able to spit it out.

When it comes to delicious food and devoted foodies like us...the only thing that stands between us, is the uncomfortable moment before the food can actually hug our taste buds. Some of us try our best to cut those moments short in the following way: We hardly wait for the burning hot, freshly cooked food to cool down. Like, come on! What worse could happen than Robert Pattinson being cast as the new Batman? And as we pop in a mouthful and get our tongue seared off immediately, by the heat; that, my friends, is where the real pain begins.

The food is too good to be spat out. So, all you do is roll the food about in your mouth till the temperature somehow recedes and it becomes somewhat chewable. It's no small feat! You just survived a Pelinti! Congratulations!

title: Beauty of Nature
body:
Ugliness pervades our culture. We see the hatred of cultures, the destruction of our world, the sadness that affects our society day after day. Sometimes all we can think is negative. Where does positive vibe even enter our frame of mind? The truth is yes, our society is shrewd. However, let us not forget the good things that God has placed before us. Let us remember the Lord still reigns in ultimate authority.

A primary way God nourishes our souls with his loving presence is through the beauty of nature. The moon and stars remind us that God\u2019s light and love shine on us even in the dark. Nature reveals to us God\u2019s beauty, glory, power, wisdom and presence. This is why we\u2019re drawn to spend time in the beauty of nature and to enjoy animals. To take a walk on a beautiful day, play with your dog in the grass, or hold your cat are reliable ways for many people to connect with God\u2019s loving presence. God\u2019s creation contains an astonishing abundance in and variety of beauty that constantly surprises and delights us. Every individual tree is a work of art, yet trees come in an immense variety of sizes, colors, and shapes. Each day we\u2019re barraged not just by beautiful sights of cedars, oaks, and firs, but by sundry smells of wildflowers and ripening fruit, or the sweet sounds of songbirds and rustling wind. The deeper we explore our world, the more beauty we find. Because of all the sins, we tend to focus so much on the negative aspects of the world that we fail to see the beauty that is in front of us. Sometimes it is blissful to sit back and think about how wonderful our world is. Let us embrace the splendour of God even it\u2019s a little cracked.

title: The saga of the rendition of the world cup will continue...
body:
"Let the sun go down on you like King Harold at the battle of Hastings \u2014 fighting gloriously. Maybe a loser but what a loser! Greater in defeat than the conqueror. "
- Zora Neale Hurston

The 14th of July marked the end of the 13th edition of the ICC Cricket World Cup. But, for Indian fanatics, their world cup was over when the Indian team got knocked out in one of the most edge-of-the-seat thriller Semi-finals. Though they were unable to bring the trophy to our country, they emerged successful in winning hearts with their spectacular performances in almost every match. The team finished atop the table. The team showed a brilliant game throughout the tournament and the fans never stepped back to shower them with love and support.

During the semi-finals, we were all caught in a wonderful, agonizing sense of expectations, but, alas! All our expectations met an unexpected hit when the team lost its last hope. The defeat literally made the fans cry. Some used the Indian flags, which they had wrapped around themselves to wipe their tears. Disappointed fans left the stadium with a heavy heart, unable to believe that their team lost. While most fans accepted this defeat, others were seen creating a ruckus and committing hooliganism. Perpetrating such acts for the sake of grabbing public attention won't see any outcome. Does harming ourselves really help us get yet another try at the World cup? Well, no, not even at the cost of someone's life. A true fan doesn't indulge in such infantile acts rather he waits to come back and support his team with full glee and joy the next time around.

The saga of the rendition of the world cup will continue. Let the critics say what they have to. Let the board decide where they went wrong. Until then, we fans will do what we've done since always- that is to love and support our team unconditionally no matter the outcome.

title: Advent of Online Streaming Platforms- a boon or a bane?
body:
With the youth taking over on the population graph of the era, a number of old school customs are found to be replaced by new more envigorating ones. One such custom that has undergone a vast makeover in the past year is the consumption of television or entertainment as you may say. Gone are the days of supernatural flies, saans bahu ka mega wars and the projection of incompetent men with the sole purpose of taking on extramarital affairs just to potray the disappointment of women in marriage. The advent of lucrative internet packages in the market followed by online streaming portals like Amazon Prime, Hotstar, Netflix, Hoichoi etc has essentially paralyzed the older ways. 
Apart from that, the radical thinking population of the country has exhibited promising consumption of entertainment with intelligent and practical content. Shows like Game of Thrones, Stranger Things, Sacred Games have essentially taken the market by storm. Besides, with the increasing work pressure and tiresome routines what more do we want other than a good bath, a cozy couch, and a television portal with movies and series that we can watch anytime and continue to watch anywhere in case our interests remain peaked. 
Therefore, when you're done being the victim of the judgmental glare of your boss/professors or when you're feeling too lazy to go out for parties or maybe when the world seems less invitating, put on your lazy belts, locate a comfortable spot and find your worries melt away while you give away to the guilty pleasure of online streaming and chilling.

title: Happy Birthday Daniel Radcliffe!
body:
Potterheads! Today is one of our glory days...because, on this very day, 30 years ago, was born a child, who was destined to bring the character of 'Harry Potter' to life! Its none other than Daniel Radcliffe's 30th Birthday!

Daniel Radcliffe overshined the stars when he first appeared as Potter, in 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone' in 2001, being a 12 year-old. Fans watched him grow up as Harry through eight films released over the course of a decade until the final film, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2, released in 2011 when Radcliffe was 22 years old. But put aside his signature character as Harry, how well do you know the English actor? From 'The Simpsons' to his connection to Charles Dickens, here are five interesting facts about him, as he turns 30 today.

1. Daniel Radcliffe wanted to act since he was 5 years old and he made his screen debut at the age of 10 in BBC One's TV adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel 'David Copperfield', portraying the titular character as a young boy.

2. 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' (2001) was not Daniel Radcliffe's first film. He made his Hollywood debut in 'The Tailor of Panama', a 2001 film based on John le Carr\u00e9's 1996 spy novel.

3. Daniel Radcliffe is a huge fan of cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar and he cherishes an autograph he got from the batting legend after the Lord's test in July 2007. Owing to his love for cricket, Daniel aspired to play the game for England.

4. He suffers from dyspraxia or developmental coordination disorder. It is a condition that affects your brain's ability to communicate with your body, making common motor skills difficult. Daniel's condition is mild, but he has expressed trouble with small tasks like tying shoelaces and writing.

5. Besides his film debut, his first non-Harry Potter film is 'December Boys' 2007 and first post-Harry Potter film is 'The Woman in Black' in 2012, 'Kill Your Darlings' 2013, 'Horns,' a must-watch, in 2014, 'Victor Frankenstein' in 2015, and 'Swiss Army Man', Now You See Me 2, and Imperium in 2016. He has tried to shed his 'Harry Potter' image along the way by featuring on Broadway and Indie films. Other than movies, he has voiced characters on 'The Simpsons'. He guest starred as Edmund in 'Treehouse of Horror XXI' (2010) and as 'Diggs' in an episode by the same name in 2014.

title: FaceApp- is it worth using?
body:
Got bored with youth and want to see how you\u2019d look 50 years later? Well, \u201cFaceApp\u201d is there for you to do the needful! Developed by a Russian company named Wireless Lab, \u201cFaceApp\u201d uses Artificial Intelligence to generate highly realistic transformations of faces in photographs. The app can not only transform a face to make it look older but can also change gender.

Unless you ain\u2019t a social media fanatic or have been living underwater, you\u2019ve definitely come across various people posting a pair of photos, one of the present and another of the future. Eventually, the \u201chashtags\u201d such as #FaceAppChallenge and #FaceAppIsTheFuture viralled and almost everyone in every corner of the world began using it for fun! Moreover, the ageing filter became the most popular app, with Drake, Hilary Duff, Gordon Ramsay and LeBron James, among a number of celebrities, showcasing their future faces on social media.

While the app has taken the world by storm, last week, the app was in the headlines for all the wrong reasons, with keen-eyed observers pointing out that the app's terms of use give its Russian parent company a very broad, global and lifelong licence to use the images. In short, once you sign up and use the app, the company can do pretty much whatever it likes with your photos. It could plaster a wrinkled version of your face across a billboard, website or the side of a skyscraper, and you would have no legal recourse.

Of course, as experts have correctly pointed out, this is extremely unlikely to happen. Russia's only interest in your photo data would be for facial recognition software development. Wireless Lab has also publicly stated that most photos are deleted within 48 hours of upload and no information is sent to Russia, but rather is stored temporarily on the company's American servers.

So, is \u201cFaceApp\u201d really worth using?

\u201cFaceApp\u201d is undeniably fun, and is currently the most popular free app in Australia, ahead of Instagram and YouTube. Downloads of the app to US iPhones have increased by 561 percent in the past month. Any playful app that spreads joy can be a good thing. It is crucial, however, that users know what they are signing up for, otherwise many of their legal rights will vanish and their legal exposure will be extraordinary.

As if wrinkled skin and grey hair weren't bad enough!

title: Scraping of Article 370 and 35A
body:
The past couple of days has been synonymous to a rollercoaster ride for the Indian Government. Beginning from the launch of Chandrayan 2 to the abrogation of Article 370, the Modi government truly has emerged victorious in gaining public appraisal and an administrative milestone. The tenure also witnessed the abolition of the Three Talakh system putting an end to the fallacious practice of irresponsible divorce. While the public sector of India has had various views on the decisions being taken, the majority has emerged out to be on the positive side of the coast.

One of the biggest reforms that's going to make it's way to the pages of history is the annulment of Article 370. The Article 370 equipped the state to have a different Constitution, followed by the acquisition of a state flag and autonomy over the internal administration of the state. Previously under the article of 35A, the residents of Jammu and Kashmir were subjected to a set of laws that greatly varied from those that were implemented for the rest of the Indian citizens. Taking into consideration these separate laws, they included the domain of citizenship, ownership of property and fundamental rights among a plethora of others. 
On the 6th of August, the Indian Constitution underwent a noteworthy change under the Presidential rule of Ram Nath Kovind, which revoked the 1954 order and extended all the provisions of the Indian constituent to be applicable to Jammu and Kashmir, while also declaring them Union Territories.

For a prolonged period of time the rebellions in the area had been a major concern for the government, and has finally found addressal after a lengthy period of time. Since we are no holders of Political Science degrees, it becomes difficult for a layman to understand the overall implications of the order. Since there always exists two sides of a coin, this too may include both negative and positive aspects. But, owing to the merit and administrative experience of the experts behind this decision, we as Indian citizens hope for the best and for a better tomorrow for the newly formed Union Territories with a wide array of prospects ready to be explored.

title: Fl\u00e2ner
body:
>> Word: Fl\u00e2ner
>> Origin: French
>> Literal meaning: The art of leisurely strolling the streets of Paris without any goal or destination simply for the pleasure of soaking up the city's beauty.

The usage of the word shouldn't be restricted to the natives of Paris, rather it can be generalized for all the \u201cwanderlusts\u201d out there. Many refer \u201cFl\u00e2ner\u201d as wandering or loitering. True that the reference is, these aimless pedestrians are known as "fl\u00e2neurs."

The earth has a number of picturesque entities to offer- flora, fauna, valleys, high-commanding mountains and hills. However, they are being ravaged to build offices and apartments. Even the remotest of areas, which were once known for their scenic drives, are being converted into industrial belts, thus annihilating nature from its roots. What most of the wanderlusts want to perceive is nature, rather than marvellous buildings. However, what they get to perceive is the latter. If this continues, in the long run, the concept of \u201cFl\u00e2ner\u201d will die, and \u201cfl\u00e2neurs\u201d will cease to exist. Notwithstanding the fact that there still exist lush green valleys to comfort the eyes of a \u201cfl\u00e2neur\u201d, but who'd guarantee their permanent existence?

Nevertheless, are you a \u201cfl\u00e2neur\u201d?

title: Eid Murabak!
body:
Neither the flesh nor the blood (of the sacrificed animal) reaches Allah; It is your piety that reaches Him "-The Holy Qur'an.

"Eid-ul-Adha" or "Eid-ul-azha" also known as the festival of sacrifice is the second of two Islamic holidays celebrated globally. The day is celebrated to mark the willingness of Ibrahim to sacrifice his son as obedience to god. But, before he could sacrifice his son, God provided a lamb to sacrifice instead. In remembrance of this intercession, an animal is sacrificed ritually and divided into three parts. The parts are then distributed amongst the poor and needy, kept for home and are given to relatives. Moreover, this day also marks the end of the annual Hajj to Mecca.

This day is considered to be the holiest festival for the followers of Islam. A sense of felicity encapsulates the ambiance as the day breaks. People tend to plunge themselves into the devotion and celebration of the festival. The day is witnessed by feasting on seasonal delicacies and relishing sumptuous meals. Finally, a goat is sacrificed in commemoration of the past events. The roots of sacrificing a goat or a sheep lie in the fact that they played a pivotal role in the life of humans in the olden days contributing to rearing and other purposes. The festival isn't just meant for sacrifices, rather it is meant to make humans learn to subdue their desires and selfishness, thus enabling humans to hinder their ability to fulfill their responsibility as a Muslim.

We, The HIT Times, extend our earnest wishes on the juncture of this Eid-ul-Adha. May the deity fulfills everyone's wishes and help every individual grow to be a better individual and prosper in his dreams.

Eid Mubarak!

title: Slipping Away...
body:
Let your psyche slip away.
Feel the waves of wind wash over you.
Under the melting sun,
Peruse the clouds which keep soaking in,
Reflecting all the pinks and blues.
Over the blooming hill, echoing and reverberating,
with the noise of chirps and crickets.
Listen to the trickling of the slow water,
over the smoothened rocks, 
somewhere amidst the thicket.

Feel a warm joy brush your face;
With your eyes closed,
Enjoy the radiating warmth
And the soft crackling of a log fire.

Or sit and admire the shimmering spray;
Of a lonely waterfall, smoothly crashing into the water, of an undiscovered lake.
Sunlight waltzing through its vapour;
Rainbows bouncing across every droplet.

Listen to the pitter patter of the rain, 
against a tin roof,
Inside a warm cabin,
drifting off to sleep.
Soon to wake up to the chorus of the morning birds
and the blissful sun peaking in through the canopies.

Bask in it, 
let your workaholic psyche slip away...

Picture courtesy : Shiladitya Khatua (17/BT/11)

title: The Pro-Hosteler Guide
body:
Stepping into the life of a hosteler, for the first time, can be tough. It takes more than a while to adjust to this novu lifestyle and it can take a toll on you. But like everything else in life, the experience of living in a hostel is one of its kinds, and having some tips for hostel life can always come in handy. You can thank us later...

1. Smuggle in Home-made Food As Often As You Can!

Whenever you visit home, make sure you get yourself some home-cooked meals because it should not come as a surprise that food in the hostel mess sucks big time! This is one of the cardinal tips for hostel life, and one that will earn you many friends as well!

2. Share And Get Your Share Back (With Interest).

People in the hostel will take your stuff, whether you like it or not. There isn't going to be a prosecution. No trials, no uneasiness, and poof!...Your shampoo vanishes from the face of existence. Accepting this is one hard, painful and unfair rule is what takes time. But remember this slogan, the more you share, the more you can borrow! If there is anything you need to know about hostel life, it is that sharing is GETTING BACK YOUR SHARE, DOUBLY!

3. Learn To Say \u201cNo!\u201d

This is technically the most important lesson, so, learn it well. It will be easier to say yes to everything and everyone, initially, to get along with people, but soon it will start affecting the rest of your life. While you might be getting worked up about how to make hostel life interesting, do understand that it should not come at the cost of your piece of mind. Understand that it is okay to agree with everything or stay up late just because everyone else is. Refusing to lend your expensive earphones to the most irresponsible person does not make you arrogant or stuck-up. If anything, it makes you more confident in life.

4. Adopt Subtle Techniques To Avoid People...

It is quite normal to get a little annoyed with people around you when you live with them 24x7. Instead of expressing that emotion through your words and expressions, try to avoid them for a while using subtle techniques like plugging in your earphones when you see them approaching, pretending to be sleeping or reading something. Chances are in a few days you will be over that feeling and things can go back to normal without them ever finding out!

5. (psst) Keep Some Money Stowed Away...

You never know where you end up spending money when living on your own, especially in a hostel, when you can\u2019t keep a track of every small coin you spend on yourself or others. And before you know it, you are left with an empty wallet. Try to take out some money in the beginning of the month and hide it away in your almirah, for a rainy day. This is one of those tips for hostel life that you will always thank us for, and you'd better...

6. Hang Out With Your Roommates At Least Once A Week!

It is SO important to get on well with your rookies - after all, you are going to spend a lot of time doing absolutely nothing with them. So make sure you and your roommates make plans or do something together at least once a week. It could be as simple as watching a movie or as complicated as prepping for doomsday, just make sure you do it! Trust us, this is pivotal for you to adjust in hostel!

7. Be Friendly With The Hostel Guards/ Warden/ Cook.

They are the ones who will give you the most perks during your hostel life - be it an extra piece of chicken or a late entry (for girls, especially) or permission to stay away for the weekend, they can make everything easier for you. Be sweet and strike up small talk whenever you can, it will take you a long way! Let us just say that of all our tips for hostel life, this one is essential for your survival!

8. Test The Bathroom Before You Step In!!!!!

Very. Very. Important.

Honestly, you don\u2019t want to be stuck in a cubicle with no water and it always happens at the worst time too! This is practically survival 101 when it comes to how live in college hostel! Check the showers, the drainage and...THE bathroom lights...

9. Get Up-to-date With All the latest streaming TV series.

You\u2019ll need this ultimate piece of knowledge to strike up a good conversation with basically anybody in your hostel. This will also give you long hours of life-changing conversations and future binge-buddies! Of all our tips for hostel life, this one is definitely the most fun!

10. Learn Basic Life Chores...

It\u2019s high time to learn basic adulting, guys! Washing your clothes and dishes, cleaning up your room once in a while - you will need to learn all of this on your own. But don\u2019t freak out, once you see everyone around you fumbling with the same things, you\u2019ll know it will all be fine!

11. Practice Sleeping In Noise, literally...!

Nope, no one will lower the volume for you around here, sadly, and if you are one of those people who need absolute silence to fall asleep then you are in for a lot of sleepless nights. The best way to adjust is to practice sleeping with music playing or the TV on before you move into your hostel to acclimatize your sleep cycle to what lies ahead!

12. Train Your Nose!

More than often , you will envy the noseless Lord Voldemort and find yourself living with people who don\u2019t care much about hygiene or are just plain lazy! While you can\u2019t badger your hostel mates all the time to clean up after them, you sure can train your nose to avoid the 'smells'! Trust us, this is your initiation into how to live in college hostel! And the billion dollar advice, keep a room freshner in handy.

13. Make The Most Of Your Electric Kettle.

The electric kettle is going to be your faithful little Dobby, not only by boiling milk and water, but also can make you life-saving maggie, boiled eggs, and even scrambled eggs!

14. Befriend Locals.

Now this is one of those essential tips for hostel life that will help you get through your BTech course! Befriend the local pupils and you can unlock all the insider information on cool hangout spots, cafes, and the best part, you get to indulge in home-cooked food every once in a while!

15. Lastly, be a good student and do nothing but study.

Kidding! XD

Anyway,
Despite all its shortcomings, hostel life is really fun and thrilling... make sure you enjoy all of it and make the most out of it! The HIT Times wishes you to experience the best moments of your lifetime in this college!

title: Picture Thursday: Nainital
body:
Located at an altitude of  2084 metres lies the exquisite resort township, the gem of Uttarakhand, Nainital. Set at the foothill of Kumaon ranges of Himalayas, this breathtakingly beautiful hill station is a perfect blend of serene lakes and scenic mountains which attracts tourists not only from all over India but also the entire world. The hill town offers an enthralling picturesque that lures all the nature lovers who are looking forward to a refreshing break away from the mundane plains. The captivating Naini Lake (Tal meaning lake) provides an enchanting yet poised experience to the visitors. The picture below beautifully capturing the mesmerizing charm of the \u201cQueen of Lakes\u201d is a little proof. Other places to pay a visit includes the Nainital zoo,Naina peak, Naina Devi temple, the Govind Ballabh Pant Mall, the Raj Bhavan and the Eco Cave Park which is the latest attraction for the younger crowd. With a refreshing weather, sparkling lake, captivating peaks and alluring tourist spots Nainital definitely promises a worthwhile experience to all the tourists and visitors.

title: Letter to the Freshers
body:
\u2022Letter To The Fresher\u2022

Dear Fresher, 
As you step into the premises of a college, the clock of your entire life resets. On a positive note, we are elated to witness the sky-high enthusiasm among all the freshers. Amongst you would be many who were aspiring for IIT's and NIT's but have to settle for HIT instead, or there would be some who took a year or two off and still ended up here. As of now, what matters is that you stand at the verge of a new journey, a voyage filled with gags and gasps, anticipation, with ups and downs, and with sweet n sour life experiences. 
A college is a place that will help you grow as an individual with self-esteem. It'll help you prosper but only when you're ready to invest yourself in it. College is all about thriving and having an insatiable thirst for knowledge, a knowledge that isn't just restricted to course books but rather the one implemented practically. But, engineering isn't served on a silver platter. It comes at the cost of unlikely experiences. There would be days when you would feel elated, others will make you feel dejected which might lead to questioning your very existence. There would be days when you would encounter a flock of perturbing species, have a fight with your roommates, will meet college deadlines, will run short on attendance and lastly, will somehow manage to surpass the examinations. Lately, you'll come to know that all the memes on engineering students which you came across while scrolling down your newsfeed weren't just pun intended but rather the fluctuating situation of a B-Tech undergrad. But, as the years will succeed you'll get to know that engineering life is much beyond to what it is shown through social media. 
A four-year course will go in the bimgurl of an eye and the one having the constant determination to make something good out of everything will emerge victoriously. You'll succeed once you let the faith in you rise from the veils and fear of failures. Let your inner self strive for perfection. Be brave, be curious and ingenious. May at the end of your four-year you bask in the glory and leave footprints behind inscribed on the premises of Haldia Institute Of Technology. 
Last but not least, college is like a multilayered gift. The more you unveil it, the closer you reach to bear its fruit. Like peacock's feathers, it's time for you to outshine others. 

With due regards and best wishes,
The HIT Times

title: Rakshabandhan
body:
Originally, Rakshabandhan was an idea instilled with the motive of inculcating solidarity amongst Indian men and women, that sprouted during the desperate times of the Freedom Movement against the British rule. The brain behind the festival was Rabindranath Tagore, who meticulously foresighted the establishment of an unbreakable bond through this practice and eventually turned it into reality.

Today the festival is of significance mostly in the Hindu culture that consists of a sister tying a talisman or a rakhi around the wrists of her brother in prayer of his good health and fortune. But with modern days approaching, the day just doesn't celebrate the relation between a sister and a brother, but it celebrates the kinship between siblings in general as well.

With birth, we acquire the love, the affection and the guidance of our parents. We receive a selfless shelter under their protective shade as we thrive to become the human beings that we are. But often in this journey, quite a large number of people are blessed with siblings, and they are the ones that teach us the most essential lessons of life- the ability to compromise, adjust, development of patience, the value of sharing and most importantly how to break the rules without getting caught. They are the first best friends that we make, the first partner in crime that we acquire, the first person to know about our first crush, the first shoulder to lean on during rough days and the first pillar of support we run to. It's the bittersweet relationship where we love to hate each other yet cannot live without the constant Tom and Jerry chase. So on this day of Rakshabandhan, here's a big thank you to all the brothers and sisters for lying about bunked tuitions, for saving us from those terrible beatings, for covering for all the mischief, for being a comrade in all the criminal activities, for lending a hand of support even when we were too afraid to ask and above all for teaching us how to love during times when all we wanted to do was give you a chokeslam. The relation between siblings is too beautifully chaotic yet real, consuming yet comforting, raging yet soothing, ruthless yet compassionate, selfish yet selfless. So, celebrating this wonderfully arranged array of contradictions, The HIT Times wishes everyone a very Happy Rakshabandhan and we hope that the day is enriched by the envigorating process of memory making with lots of laughter and fun and joy.

title: A beginner's guide to the food joints in and around HIT
body:
One can't survive on earth without food, clothes and shelter; food is the primary aspect for survival. India is known for its spices that are used in preparing various delicacies in various occasions, for treating the taste buds. Can the millennials imagine life without having lunch or dinner at a restaurant, at least once in a week? The answer outrightly is a NO. 

Whoever is or has been a part of Haldia Institute of Technology would always colligate it with the bunch of \u201ctheks\u201d just outside the campus. \u201cFried maggi\u201d of various types, tea, \u201cluchi-aloo ki subzi\u201d and a lot more are always available at these \u201ctheks\u201d. However, won't life be monotonous without devouring the various Indian Cuisines? Of course! 

To allay this monotonicity, there are multiple restaurants, just a few distance away from the institute, including the most popular \u201cAala Restaurant\u201d, \u201cAqsa Restaurant\u201d and \u201cHarroze Restaurant\u201d. There's one of the most sought after food corner with the name \u201cHangout\u201d, located in the C block of City Centre, Haldia, where you can hang out with your peer group to break the wearisome constancy of the hostel-college-hostel routine. 

As far as the college premises are concerned, there are \u201cNew Garden Restaurant\u201d, \u201cShankhachil\u201d and \u201cGungchil\u201d to offer you with scrumptious snacks, soft/energy drinks, fruits and meals as well.

We, from The HIT Times, could straight off ensure that you would get whatever food you'd like to enjoy, at ease. Also, you'll be elated to the fullest once you get into the immense world of good food, enclosed in the small town of Haldia.

title: Picture Thursday
body:
Kullu, Himachal Pradesh

Snuggled down in the lap of the magnificent Himalayas, Kullu is an echt source of satisfaction in Himachal Pradesh. Situated at an altitude of 1278m and spread out on the banks of River Beas, Kullu is a nature lover's paradise. As a gateway to the popular destination of Manali, it is a cool escapade for the tired souls. 

Known for its temples, Kullu Valley, a broad open valley, has panoramic views and majestic hills covered with Deodar and Pine trees and sprawling apple orchards. The course of the Beas river presents a succession of glory, clads with forests of deodar, towering above trees of pine on the bumpy ridges. Kullu Valley is sandwiched between the Pir Panjal, Lower Himalayan and Great Himalayan Ranges. 

Kullu has few ancestral temples like the Raghunath Temple and Jagannath Devi Temple. Apart from temples, some fascinating spots in the city are Pandoh Dam and Chandrakhani Pass. The prime time to visit Kullu is in summers, between April and June and also during the Dussehra festival. One must excogitate of paying a visit to such a winsome sight.

title: Viral Corner
body:
Even as the country and world fight the global pandemic, the Ministry of Home Affairs came up with a lockdown relaxation guideline, starting from the 20th of April. The subcontinent, having 13,495 total cases according to the world meter, is in a better shape compared to its European counterparts. Services including- Health Services (including AYUSH), Agricultural activities, Movement of cargo, Public Utilities, Supply of Essential Goods, Commercial & Private establishments, Financial Institutions, Social Sector, Online teaching distance learning, MNREGA works, Construction Activities, Central and State Government Offices, with exceptions to most of the above mentioned categories and also all the employees are encouraged to follow the corona prevention guidelines. For example, Educational, Coaching Institutions, Training will remain closed but will operate through online teaching. Teaching should be made through maximum use of Doordarshan (DD) & other educational channels. All facilities in supply of essential goods including manufacturing, retail and wholesale of such goods through local stores, large stores or e-Commerce
Kirana Shops, Single Shops & Ration Shops dealing with food and groceries, fruits and vegetables, hygiene items, dairy and milk, poultry, meat and fish, animal feed and fodder

These establishments should ensure strict social distancing with no restriction on timing of opening and closure. However, the relaxations during Lockdown 2.0 will be applicable in areas where the Coronavirus has been prevented from emerging or where the hotspots have been contained. Although most responsible citizens are practicing social distancing there have been instances of people flunking rules and gathering in public places. The police throughout the country have done a whole lot from using force to songs and little programs to encourage people to stay home.

title: D\u00e9paysement
body:
>> Word: D\u00e9paysement
>> Meaning: the feeling\u00a0of not being at home, in a foreign or different place, can be either a good or a bad feeling.
>> Origin: French

Since the premises of Haldia Institute of Technology is bustling with the enthusiasm, adrenaline and millions of dreams harbored by another batch of fresher, here's a piece that finds you in all your moments of uncertainty. 
The campus of HIT is a true potrayal of the phrase Unity in Diversity. Though situated in West Bengal, the college administers admission to students hailing from different parts of the country. Each fragment comes with a unique story, a unique personality, and a unique character. Often, amidst this chaos a lot of people lose the person that they are. They try to evolve into someone that they're not meant to be. But, it's college. That too a residential one! Who wouldn't want to fit in? Some enjoy this phase of radical change and some detest it with all the atoms in their body. Some turn this into one big adventure spree but others are still longing for the comfort of their home. A steaming hot meal and the constant protection of the mamma bear. The changes are so vast that at times it riddles you with certain emotions. This, my friend is d\u00e9paysement.
 It might not be as amazing as you thought but it also ain't as bad as you anticipated. So hug this maddening confusion tight and enjoy the rollercoaster ride that you just began, cause it's all about to get messier, funnier and unforgettable.

title: What's In A Sea Shore?
body: The sea is one of God's blessed gifts to mankind. A sea is an amalgamation of vapors, currents, breezes, beauty, tides, and tonnes of salt, each created pertaining to its own motive. Promenading along the beach, make an effort to look beyond the horizon. Witness the sea, the sea that's calm one moment, choppy the next, briny and aggressive, relentless yet silent. Standing onshore, when the territorial waters wash off one's feet, don't be just elated rather observe and learn. The hurling waves, coming in from the far distance, gleaming and sparkling, resembling the constant motion of the sea instructs us to keep moving and always thriving for better aspects in our lives. Some days these tides are low with minuscule elevations while a few days they tend to grow high and majestic. Our lives are somewhat comparable, resembling this analog of constant ups and downs. It is necessary for us to have those days in our lives as they impart us with lessons that remain attached to us throughout our life-span. Every time you lose hope, life will present you with its form of serenity and vibrancy. The breeze will fetch vigor, while the saltiness will prepare you for the unexpected bitter parts in life and the beauty will teach you to adore. If God can create foreshore sand to stand against the mighty waves, then think of yourself as the sand and stand against the rage of the sea. Like the sea leaves its saltiness behind and comes back to us with the sweeter part, the alimental and pious form, learn to snub the hurdles that lie in your path. The day you'll learn will be the day you'll succeed!

title: Book Review: Before That Night by Violet Dukes
body:
Name of the Book: Before That Night
Author: Violet Duke
Our Rating: 4.5/5.0
Recommended: Absolutely!

Before that night, Addison Milan had been a college dropout, secretly raising her two young siblings in a beat-up minivan she\u2019d bought with her first semester\u2019s tuition refund\u2014the only money her addict mother hadn\u2019t taken off with when she\u2019d abandoned them the year prior.
Before that night, Caine Spencer had been just a rough, gruff cop sent to check out the phoned-in claims of suspected child neglect involving the same woman he\u2019d met a month ago when she\u2019d first served him the city\u2019s worst diner coffee...which he\u2019d been drinking daily ever since.
Before that night, Addison would never have thought the man she\u2019d been fighting hard not to fall for\u2014her only friend in her new shadow of a life\u2014would be in a position to rip her family apart.
Before that night, Caine would never have believed any woman could make him fall head over heels, let alone make him feel so damn compelled to look the other way when it came to his job.

Then, that one perfect night changed everything.

The story (Book 1) registers the destiny-altering events that take place seven years prior to "Every Night without you" (Book 2), Caine & Addison\u2019s emotional story of love, sacrifice, and the lengths one will run\u2014and chase\u2014when their past threatens their future.
"Before That Night" is one of the most intriguing books of its genre, i.e., Romance. The book has entertained the readers since the past few years as it is read by people of every age, which is why it is widely recommended by one and all!

title: Monday Hues
Grammarism
body:
The essence of any good literature is it's grammar. Since most of us are not yet aware of the minute mistakes that evade our eye, here's a helping hand. 
The difference between it's and its: 
'It's' refers to the expression of it is.
E.g.- It's  a beautiful dress.
On the other hand its refers to the possessive if it. 
E.g.- I know the song but I can't remember its name. 
Hope today's insight will help improve your grammar a bit more and definitely keep the grammar Nazis at bay. So stay tuned for more such revelations each week.

title: Shubh Janmashtami!
body:
Krishna Janmashtami or Janmashtami or Gokulashtami is a Hindu festival celebrated widely across the country every year to mark the birth of Lord Krishna. Krishna, who is also one of the eights avatar of Lord Vishnu was born on the eighth day of Krishna Paksha as a son to Devaki and Vasudeva. He was brought up in nandavrajam to live with his foster mother Yashoda and foster father Nanda. Being brought up in a Yadav family he was very fond of eating "Makhana" which he used to steal from his mother's kitchen. This gave him the name of "Natkhat Nand Lal". Lord Krishna is considered to be a major deity in Hinduism. He is also said to be the omniscient incarnation of Vishnu who was born with a purpose to free the world from evil. As a result, he was the one to kill his evil maternal uncle Kansa. Furthermore, he played a crucial role in the great war at Kurukshetra predominately known as Mahabharat. Being a charioteer to Arjuna he imparted him with the lessons of the holy Bhagavad Gita. He preached about Karma and the theory of Bhakti.

This year Janmashtami falls on 23rd August 2019. The day is marked by various celebrations across the country in order to please Lord Krishna. One of the most prominent celebration is the " Dahi Handi". Mathura and Vrindavan being the two most important places where Lord Krishna is said to have lived his childhood, celebrates the festival of Janmashtami with great fervor and enthusiasm.

We, The HIT Times, wishes everyone an auspicious Janmashtami. May Lord Krishna fulfill everyone with the knowledge to contemplate between good and evil. May he shower everyone with abundance love, prosperity, felicity and peace.

title: #PrayForAmazonia
body:
The Amazon rainforest is the largest rainforest on Earth. It creates 20 percent of the oxygen in Earth\u2019s atmosphere.
The rainforest is home to 40 percent of the worlds tropical forest and holds 20 percent of the worlds freshwater supply. It is also home to 10 percent of the world\u2019s species and 40,000 plant species and around 3000 varieties of edible fruits.
Further, the Amazon rainforest is also the natural habitat of 430 species of mammals and millions of insect species.
Sadly, the lungs of our Earth, is at the risk of getting burned out completely. The rainforest, has been burning for over 16 days, resulting in a major loss of trees and biodiversity. It will get completely burned out if its not extinguished soon.
Global outrage tore through social media, with #PrayforAmazonia as the world's top trending topic on Twitter on Wednesday.
- Cause:
According to environmentalists, 99 percent of the forest fires are a result of human actions, either on purpose or by accident. Farmers and ranchers use fire generally to clear the land for further utilisation. This year's fires also fit perfectly into the established seasonal agricultural pattern. This time is the most suitable to burn because the vegetation is dry. Farmers generally wait for the dry season to start burning and clearing areas so that their cattle can graze, However, the peak of the dry season is yet to come in September.
Environmentalists blame Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro for the forest fires. When Bolsonaro was running for president, he had promised to restore Brazil's economy by exploring the economic potential of the Amazon rainforest. As per environmentalists, Bolsonaro has encouraged the farmers and ranchers to exploit and burn the rainforest like never before.
The UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres also expressed deep concern over the blazing fire in the Amazon rainforest.
- Impact:
The fire in Brazil\u2019s Amazon rainforest has been burning at the highest rate. "There have been around 72,843 fires in Brazil in 2019 itself, with more than half in the Amazon rainforest. This shows an 80 percent increase in fires during the same period in 2018."
According to scientists, "the Amazon rainforest fire could deliver a huge blow to the global fight against climate change. The fire will not only result in a major loss of trees and partiulate matter and toxic gases such as carbon monoxide, nitrogen oxides and non-methane organic compounds into the atmosphere."
Amazon rainforest is considered to be as the planet\u2019s lungs as it contributes about 20 percent of the earth\u2019s oxygen, is vital to slow down global warming. The rainforest is currently home to uncountable species of fauna and flora. While the immediate impact of the fire would be changes in the heating of the regional atmosphere, in the long term it is expected to lead to a potential decline in natural carbon.
- Action taken:
Bolivia has contracted its Boeing 747 \u2018Supertanker,' the largest air tanker, to help put out the Amazon rainforest fire. The supertanker is expected to be put in operations from August 23. The announcement was made by Bolivia\u2019s President Evo Morales on August 21, 2019. The Boeing 747 \u2018Supertanker\u2019 has the capacity to carry more water than any other aircraft in the world.
It seemed, the Earth was also willing to help when the sky broke into rainfall, answering a thousand prayers from all around the Globe.

title: R.I.P. Arun Jaitley
body:
Arun Jaitley, a judicial luminary, an Indian politician, an attorney, and the former Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs of the Government of India, for the tenure of 2014-19, passed away at the age of 66, at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi on the afternoon of 24th August. The sad demise of an iconic personality has left the nation and other prominent leaders in tears. He was admitted at AIIMS on August 6th. Being on a life-support system, he was unable to sustain and finally gave in. Netizens flooded the social media with condolences on this untimely demise of a prominent leader like him.
Born on 28th December 1952, he joined as a political member of Bhartiya Janta Party in 1991. Until 1999, he became the spokesperson for the party. From 2009 to 2014, he served as the leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha. He was known for his high intellectual skills and perspicacity. He led the enactment of bankruptcy code and the Goods and Service Tax(GST). He stepped down as the Finance Minister in January 2019 and withdrew his name from the 2019 Lok Sabha elections due to his illness. Besides his political career, he was a lawyer by profession.
He would be cremated tomorrow afternoon at the Nigambodh Ghat, New Delhi. We extend our earnest condolences on this mournful demise of Sri Arun Jaitley Ji. May his soul rest in peace. May the deity fetch strength to his family to cope up with the terrible loss.

title: Tartle
body:
>> Word: Tartle
>> Origin: Scottish
>> Literal Meaning: The act of hesitating while introducing someone because you've forgotten their name.
A common Scottish term to insert at the awkward moment when you temporarily forget someone's name. Useful to avoid that occasional embarrassment.
Steve: Hi, Susan! 
Susan: Hi . . . uh ! Sorry, I "tartled" there for a moment.
This has obviously happened to each and every one of us at some or the other point of time. Met someone, talked to them, but the next time you met them, BLANK.
That humiliation that you have to bear with while not being able to recall someone\u2019s name, having tartled is surely something we want to avoid. The only thing worse than letting someone know that you've forgotten their name is to call them by someone else's name. I hope no one makes a blunder as such! That would be a different level of abashment.

title: Stepping into the Horizon
body:
"The earth's crust has not yet stopped heaving and plunging under our feet. Mountain ranges are still being thrust upon the horizon. Granites are still growing under the continental masses. Nor has the organic world ceased to produce new buds at the tips of its countless branches."~Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

Discovering quiet trails is seemingly adventurous, yet it remains a challenge to most. It so may happen that your innate leadership reflexes won't allow you to follow the obvious remarks set by the pacemakers. For instance, it's not always mandatory to be a part of the herd. Walking along the lane, selecting the appropriate path, setting and achieving new goals is what all humans seek and thrive for. But, sometimes we are too afraid to incite the urge within ourself. Seldom we make our mind to not indulge ourselves into any such practices. The reason being the eminent hopes and aspirations of parents and the societal pressure. Somewhere along the way, we forget to be the person we all were supposed to be. With the passage of time we limit ourselves, we terminate to think out of the box, we become sluggish and we slowly creep our way out of the hurdles. As a consequence, it coerces us to be amongst those lethargic sloths whose moments are minimal. But, in spite of appearance, we all know that we have a beaver in us who could keep us intact and vigorous. So who are we putting an act for? There is always a flow of constant flux within us. Don't be shy to wrangle with your own self. Don't hesitate to be the lion among the sheep. Life is like a faucet and the water dripping out of it is like the opportunities mixed with the bitter impurities. Think of yourself as the cauldron and bask in those opportunities and as you'll foray into the future you will leave behind those bitter parts and emerge to be a victorious person.

title: Happy Ganesh Chaturthi
body:
When the entire India sulks in the monsoonal waves, the Mighty Vinayaka comes to impart delight, delectation and to gift fervor grips to everyone. A festival where preparations begin months in advance. The stage's set, the houses are bedaubed with fairy lights and the entire ambiance is set to dwell in the religious zeal of Vinayaka. Such is the grandeur of Ganesh Chaturthi.

Ganesh Chaturthi, also known as Vinayaka Chaturthi or Vinayaka Chavithi is a major festival that marks the birth of Lord Ganesh. Every year the festival falls in the month of August or September. This year, September 2 marked the commencement of this 10-day long festival. People across the country worship the deity by installing clay idols either at their home or at elaborate pandals. The devotees tend to immerse themselves in chanting hymns, prayers, and fasting, as in order to bring good fortune and health. Ganesha is said to be the god of a new beginning, the remover of obstacles, and the god of wisdom and intelligence.

While the celebration and festivities encircle the entire country, the states of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu to name a few, celebrates the festival with a nonpareil magnificence. The grand celebration at these places is a sight to behold and can spellbind anyone into its unmatched charm. The celebration is brought to a halt by immersing the idol in water and requesting "Bappa" to come over again the next year.

We, The HIT Times, extend our devoirs on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi. May Vinayaka bestow everyone with good health, fortune, wisdom, and prosperity! Ganapati Bappa Moraiya!

title: Time is precious
body:
If you don't like the road you're walking on, start paving another one- the one with more light and less dark moments. Rise above your own storms, from behind the closed and darkest clouds; the sunshine will glow brighter than ever. Don't forget that every shadow, no matter how deep inside you, is still threatened by the morning light shining inside your silver spirit. You'll only regret the choices you made, ergo, don't allow yourself to be mocked down by the dreadful minds and soulless beings. Life is farce- it takes away sadness to know what happiness is. To appreciate it is silence and to live without it is absence. You might've failed over and over again, torn apart by your solemn failures. But that's the road to success. Value time and life, for they are precious.

P.C. Soham Majumder
(18/BT/014)

title: Sickeningly Binary
body:
If you could write your life
In a poetry,
Would you go for a sonnet rife
Or a mockery?
Will the day be sunny and bright
Or just cloudy?
Will sunflowers face the daylight
Or wilt morosely?

How is life so sickeningly binary?
Ashes may rain but roses may bloom;
The multimillionaire business suit is but a kind of livery.
Did your old happy passions not have enough room?
Ask yourself, what is making you live so lifelessly?
Remember your happy moments, your loved ones.
Life may just come and go, binarily.
people who value you, would never leave you, voluntarily;
For the ones who will, remember, lost souls would never return by any effort.
Family is, family was,
there never was or will be a 'because'.

Tears or smile,
You got to face it all.
Spring may beguile,
But Autumn makes it fall.
Your dreams may shatter,
But you will get up and stand tall,
Life may be binary, but there is a lot;
Want to give up or fight back, that's your call.

P.C : Nasim Molla (16/BT/19)

title: Muharram
body:
\u201cNo one could have seen my father's smile when the month of Muharram came. Sadness was increasing in his face until the tenth day, after which, it would be a day of grief and weeping for him.\u201d - Anonymous

The month of Muharram marks the beginning of the Islamic Calendar and is one of the four sacred months of the year during which warfare is forbidden. Although it marks the first Islamic month, the tenth day of Muharram is also known for being a period of mourning where the Shia Muslim community commemorates the martyrdom of Imam Hussein, the son of Hazrat Ali and the grandson of Prophet Muhammad.

Considered one of the most significant festivals celebrated by the Muslim community, many Shias observe this day by participating in processions and self-flagellation. Mourners use sharp objects such as knives or chains, which have blades attached to them, and other weapons in acts of self flagellation while chanting 'Ya Hussain' loudly. Sunni Muslims, on the contrary, observe this day with a fast that lasts from sunrise to sunset. They also hold gatherings to remember the sacrifices of Imam Hussain and attend special prayers in mosques.

On a concluding note, we, from The HIT Times, wish for the well-being of you and your family. May Allah shower you with gifts of love, bravery, wisdom, contentment, health and patience. Happy New Year!

title: Hindi Diwas
body:

Being the official language of India, \u201cHindi\u201d is spoken, by one and all, in every job sector and institute. There might be numerous local languages in a country as diverse as India. However, Hindi has been unanimously chosen as a language of communication across the country.

14th September is celebrated as \u201cHindi Diwas\u201d since 1949. It is a matter of pride for all the Indian citizens for, on this day in 1949, \u201cHindi\u201d was recognised as the official language of communication, to instill nationalistic feelings in Indian hearts. It is heartily celebrated, especially in schools, where various essay and poem writing, and elocution competitions are held, in Hindi. Speeches are also delivered to acquaint the students with the importance of \u201cHindi Diwas\u201d. Some prolific Hindi writers and poets such as Kabir, Munshi Premchand, Mahadevi Verma, Shrilal Shukla, to name a few, are remembered and their works are read out in classes.

We, at The HIT Times, wish all its readers a Happy Hindi Diwas and urge them not to forget that-

\u201c\u0939\u093f\u0902\u0926\u0940 \u0935\u093e\u0932\u0947 \u092a\u093f\u091b\u0921\u093c\u0947 \u0928\u0939\u0940\u0902 \u0939\u094b\u0924\u0947!

title: Happy Engineers' Day
body:
Engineers' Day in India is celebrated on 15th September as a tribute to the greatest Indian engineer and Bharat Ratna Sir Mokshagundam Vishweshvaraya (popularly known as Sir MV). Engineering is the use of scientific principles to innovate, build and create. From designing to constructing a new world, from further connecting it to various corners of the world to illuminating it with power supply, engineers play a pivotal role. But the undeniable contributions of an engineer are not just limited to the above aspects for they pave the way for the development of the entire world by putting their mettle to work in various other fields. They are blessed with a constant determination and passion with superfluous zeal and zest to make good out of everything. They pave the way for the future. "Engineering For Change" is the theme for Engineers Day 2019.
We, at The HIT Times, extend our warm wishes to all the industrious engineers, who have put in their dedicated efforts and numerous hours for the welfare of the society. Furthermore, we would also like to wish the ones who are on the itinerary to become future Engineers. Happy Engineers' Day!

title: World Ozone Day
body:
The ozone layer is the layer of protection around the earth's surface, which protects us from the harmful UV rays. The \u2018world ozone day\u2019 came into existence after the Montreal Protocol was signed on the same day it is celebrated, that is, 16th of September, in the year 1987. The protocol is basically an international treaty passed by the United Nations general assembly to protect the ozone layer from substances which causes its depletion. These include man-made chemicals constituting of chlorine and bromine.The chief ozone-depleting substances include chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), carbon tetrachloride, hydrochlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs) and methyl chloroform. Halons, sometimes known as brominated fluorocarbons, also contribute mightily to ozone depletion. ODS substances have a lifetime of about 100 years.

The theme of World Ozone Day 2019 is '32 years and Healing'. This year's theme celebrates three decades of remarkable international cooperation to protect the Ozone Layer and the climate under the Montreal Protocol. The main aim of this day was to propose and execute measures to protect the ozone layer and also educate people about its importance. Over the past decade, the ozone layer has recovered at a rate of 1-3%. Even at the protected rates, Northern hemisphere and mid-latitude ozone will heal completely by the 2030. The Southern Hemisphere will follow in 2050 closely accompanied by the Polar Regions in 2060. If not, then there will surely be a surge in skin cancer, respiratory problems, eyesight problems and a lot more. However, as of now, the measures taken to protect it has been mildly successful especially in the developed nations, with the developing nations not far behind. For example, India, which became a signatory member of the protocol in 19th June 1992, abides by all the measures of the protocol such as to ban the use of chloro fluorocarbons, hydrocarbons and other toxic components in air conditioning systems, refrigerators, etc.Therefore, it is our duty as sincere inhabitants of the planet to help contribute to the recovery of the ozone layer and enable our future generations to lead a healthier and more prosperous life.

title: Gazing at life
body:
On a gloomy day, he sits quietly under the bright radiant sun. Gazing at the lush green meadows, he discovers chroma and vividness amidst this blaring world. He was struck with wonder for he had never visualized looking at something with such precision. Well, what exactly was he looking at? Was it a splendid and exquisite scenery, or was it a lake filled with trouts? It was rather a garden ornamented with fancy ferns, and flowers rich in the color of coral and shades of lavender. One may ponder as to why he introspected so much? Exploring oneself through the intricacies of life is like a four-leaf clover, which has always been hard to trace. A garden isn't just a picturesque image to behold, but the pictorial color it offers, detecting even the infinitesimal blossom helps us grow and develop from within. This inner-development and knowing ourselves of who we truly are is Self-introspection. Self-introspection helps us know our purpose, values, goals, and beliefs. But, it is something that comes at a cost which not all can fulfill. A day would come when it won't be a case of "he/she" but rather a case of "you". We are all tranquil and non-agitated. We've all got the brushes of our lives in our hand, and what to paint on the canvas depends on us. And, that would come from learning and growing continuously, digging into blind spots, constant self-questioning, and listening to our innate gut feelings.

Pic Credit: Vaibhav Kumar(18/CSE/025)

title: Vishwakarma Puja
body:
Lord Vishwakarma is considered to be the divine architect, the creator of the world. This Hindu festival is most prominent in industrial and architectural sectors. Craftsmen, artisans, carpenters \u2014 they worship their tools and machines in the name of the Lord, by not using them while doing so.

Engineering colleges witness a grand celebration of the festival. The machineries are shut down for the day, students usually get a holiday to mark the reverence of this auspicious occasion. One of the biggest attractions of this Puja is the tradition of flying kites. The origin and significance mainly deal with the simple machinery of a kite, the manja. Kite flying battles are common, however, unfortunately enough, they\u2019re very rare in the modern-day scenario.

Grand feasts are organized as a part of this celebration. Idols and statues of the Lord are made and devotees worship them. This celebration is mainly held in the month of September, in most of the states of India. Therefore, The HIT Times would like to wish everyone a Happy Vishwakarma Puja and wish luck to all the engineers, so that they use their tools for good and bring more prosperity to the world.

title: Book Review
body:
Name of the book: Looking for Alaska
Author: John Green
Rating: 4.5/5.0
Recommended: Yes.

"Francois Rabelais. He was a poet. And his last words were "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." That's why I'm going. So I don't have to wait until I die to start seeking a Great Perhaps."
__Miles ( From 'Looking for Alaska')
 
Very fresh and real ' Looking for Alaska' is the debut novel of John Green. This novel is one of those kind, which piles on one's self reflection and holds the reader till the end. Even though on surface, the book might come off as a little ' immature coming-of-age, boy-meets-girl' piece, in unfolded reading it's much more than that.

The best part about this book is that the plot cooked here doesn't follow any particular receipe. The rawness and brutality in Green's writing, draws a very honest light on adolescence and complexities of the youth life. The book has two segmented parts, both carefully parted and imgurled.

The protagonist, a 16 year old curious Miles 'Pudge' Halter leaves Florida to attend a new school at Alabama. There in his befriended group, he meets the beautiful, funny but emotionally wounded Alaska and their story jets off from there.
The first half deals with their adjustment to life and the developing attachments. While the later segment is about Alaska's sudden death, how it affects them all and unveiling the mystery behind it.

All in all, the book binds the young age components well, with fair share of bets, pranks, parties and hangout sessions. This might not be an extreme and emotionally connecting read, but nonetheless one is bound to get attached to the characters. A well plotted, carefully crafted and openly written work by Green in his first attempt and definitely deserves a read. Anyone who has loved ' The Fault in Our Stars' by him, should give this one a go.

title: Book Review
body:
Book Series: The Infernal Devices
Author: Cassandra Clare
Rating: 4/5
Recommended: Yes

The Infernal Devices is the prequel to The Mortal Instruments series by Cassandra Clare. The trilogy features Clockwork Angel as the first book, followed by Clockwork Prince, and the final installment is Clockwork Princess. The books were published after The Mortal Instruments were, and even though it's the prequel, it's adviced to read it in that order to avoid spoilers.

The novels revolve around the 16-year old orphan Theresa 'Tessa' Gray, who goes to London in search of her brother Nathaniel. In a world of Shadowhunters and Downworlders, she tries to fit in and rediscover herself. The events of the books are highly engaging with plot twists and new characters keeping the readers hooked. It deals with deadly supernatural creatures, including warlocks and warewolves, and Tessa's journey to unveil the darkest secrets of her family. Character sub-plots provide helpful insight to the main story, and Cassandra displays a breathtaking connection eventually, when everything falls into place. Characters like Magnus Bane also appear in the sequel of the series, The Mortal Instruments.

Along with the graphic sword fights and descriptive deaths, the author introduces a love triangle that tugs at the strings of the hearts of the readers. Tessa falls in love with William 'Will' Herondale and James 'Jem' Carstairs, two Shadowhunters of the London Institute. Throughout the series the romance is kept alive and blooming; however you'll have to read it yourself to find out the ending. 

It's a stunning series, only three books long, perfect for a short ride down the feels lane. If you're into young adult fiction, this is just the book for you.

title: World Rose Day
description: WORLD ROSE DAY WELFARE OF CANCER PATIENTS
body:
September 22 is observed as Rose Day that marks the hope for cancer patients and their caregivers. In the memory of a 12 year old Melinda Rose from Canada who was diagnosed with Askin Tumor, a rare form of Blood Cancer, this day brings awareness to all cancer patients that they can face this disease with strong willpower and spirit. Her doctors predicted that she won't be able to live more than a few weeks, but she lived for six months and made her life meaningful and inspiring to many other cancer patients.  
 
Alertness about cancer is important, not only for supporting the patients, but also for preventing it. Awareness programs on the Rose Day also make normal people aware of the importance of being cautious about cancer. Rose Day brings comfort to cancer patients with handmade rosesroses, cards and gifts from known and unknown people around the globe. It's the time to make a self - awareness as well as adapting a healthy lifestyle

title: Circuitrix Workshop!
body: On 19th and 20th October 2019, the circuitrix workshop was organized by the IEEE HIT Students' Branch in the premises of Haldia Institute of Technology. The workshop witnessed the active participation of the students who were filled with exuberance to embrace their grey cells. The students were given basic knowledge about the circuits and breadboard components. They were supplied with their own kits, one in each group. They were then asked to make their own circuits, which responded to the stimuli of sound and glowed accordingly, which they dubbed as DJ light. The apprentices were guided at every step by the seniors from IEEE. The participants were relished after the completion of the workshop and termed it as a fruitful session. Here's an insight into the same!

title: Book Review
body:
Name of the book: - Artemis Fowl
Author: - Eoin Colfer

 \u201cIf I win, I'm a prodigy. If I lose, then I'm crazy. That's the way history is written.\u201d 
- Artemis Fowl the second

What would happen if a juvenile genius with one of the highest recorded IQ starts believing in the fairy folk? And not stopping there, what would happen if he thinks of kidnapping one for a heavy ransom?
BAM! Artemis Fowl is the kind of book that keeps you hooked till the end. There are plot twists within plot twists, a fair amount of planning, and the story flows at a good pace. If we had to recommend a book to make teenagers know about an antihero, we would recommend this. Artemis Fowl isn\u2019t just your typical mastermind; to know what we are trying to say, you will have to dig into the book.
What works as an ace in the hole about the book is that the protagonist isn\u2019t the classical chosen one. Instead, he builds up his plans neatly, one on top of another while the fairies try to outsmart him. Think about Ocean\u2019s 11, but with fairies this time. Sometimes the plans fail, and sometimes they don\u2019t. Up till the end, you\u2019ll just be guessing about Artemis\u2019 mental ability; is he really a genius or just a lunatic?
The way Colfer develops the characters is a little complex, and that is what makes this fun to read. Artemis is way deeper and complex than your regular middle-grade hero. Couple this up with a fun and colourful underworld full of intelligent centaurs, gnomes and other supernatural things, and you'll get a fun read that is bound to keep you entertained for hours.
This book is a must-read for the youngest readers (although it is thrilling enough to compel the older audience too). The violence is not over the top and feels cartoonish sometimes. As the series goes on, the plot becomes darker, but nonetheless, Colfer does his best to make it family-friendly. All in all, Artemis Fowl is one book which can be read in one go. And if this isn\u2019t enough, there are sequels too. So, be ready for hours of a good, catchy thriller, all because a genius started to believe in the fairies.

So, is Artemis a genius? Or just a lunatic? Read this book to find out!!

title: Picture Thursday:Amritsar
body:
Picture Thursday:Amritsar 
 
Composed of two words \u0a05\u0a70\u0a2e\u0a3f\u0a4d\u0a24 (Amrit) + \u0a38\u0a30(sar) meaning \u201cThe pool of ambrosial nectar\u201d, Amritsar is the holiest adobe of sikhs throuhghout the world. It is also known as \u201cGuru ki nagri\u201d, meaning the kingdom of God. Having such a great historical, religious and traditional significance, it is a perfect tourist destination for tourists across the globe.  
The mornings, in this beautiful city starts with spritual prayers in the Gurudwaras.This city has many historical gurudwaras, the most famous among them is \u0a39\u0a30\u0a3f\u0a2e\u0a70\u0a26\u0a30 \u0a38\u0a3e\u0a39\u0a3f\u0a2c a or The Golden Temple. This temple is famous all around the world for its historical significance along with it's architecture, which is beautiful beyond imagination and leaves everyone spell bound. The central shrine of this temple is entirely made up of gold and is surrounded by a pond from all sides which makes the temple look heavenly especially during the night.The temple is so famous that the people have to stand several hours in queue to get an entry to the central shrine.This shrine also serves free food to more than a hundred thousand people each day without any discrimination of cast or religion in the form of  \u2019\u2018Langar\u2019\u2019. 
The Jallianwala Bagh is at a walking distance from the temple and the lush green parks and the bullet marks of the historical massacre makes one nostalgic. A trip to the Wagah Border is also a must. Other places to visit include Maharaja Ranjit singh Mueseum, Durgiana Temple and Khadur Sahib among others. 
Although there are many historical places to visit in Amritsar but the true beauty of this city could be seen only in its crowded Bazars, where one can interact with the local people and can witness the amazing hospitality of the inhabitants as well as get to know about their rich cultural heritage. In these markets one can enjoy the local punjabi cuisines, buy traditional punjabi clothes and enjoy the local folk dance, all at  the same time. 
With such a rich cultural history, mouth watering street food, historical monuments and not to mention the friendly locals, Amritsar is undoubtedly a coveted tourist destination to visit and anyone who has set foot in this city feels inclined to visit it again and again.

title: Workshop on ANA DIGITRIX
body: The ISA and ISOI HIT Students' Branch organized a two-day workshop on "ANA DIGITRIX" on 19th and 20th October 2019. The student members from the department of AEIE put together their effort behind the workshop. Numerous students came together to grasp knowledge on the subjects of Resistors, Capacitors, Diode, Integrated Circuits, and Breadboards. The participants were also given an insight into the dimension of electronics and practical applications of sensors. Meanwhile, they were also made aware of various logic gates and they got hands-on-experience by designing a code lock circuit. Lastly, the designing of a musical light circuit incited the zest among them and kept them on their toes. The session was concluded with a feedback form. Here's a sneak peek!
