title: Book Review
description: Book Review : The silence of the Lambs
body:
The Silence of the Lambs

 \u201cNothing happened to me, Officer Starling. I happened. You can't reduce me to a set of influences.\u201d  ~Hannibal Lecter.  

Ratings: 3.7/5            
    
Who has not heard about \u2018Hannibal the cannibal\u2019, undoubtedly the most notorious and sought-after fictional villain of the 20th century with numerous book and movie adaptations about and around him? He is seen in a pivotal role in the book \u201cThe silence of the lambs\u201d by Thomas Harris after the previous two installments about the raw villain, Red Dragon, and Black Death. What makes this one more interesting is the presence of two sociopaths instead of just one, one being the aforementioned psychiatrist and the other is the serial killer on the loose, with some major, mommy issues and a thirst for literally wearing someone else\u2019s skin. Though he is no Norman Bates, Buffalo Bill is no better, kidnapping and killing all female victims for their skin, with which he intends to make a dress for himself. On the other side, we have young FBI agent Sterling, who is tasked to get information about the killer from Doctor Hannibal Lecter, from his jail cell, which comes at a very personal cost indeed. The killer in the novel seems to be an amalgamation of a few real life serial killers, like Ed Gein, who used to make \u2018ornaments\u2019 and other household items from the skin of the corpses. Another inspiration for the character might have been Ted Bundy, America's most notorious serial.   

Undoubtedly, one of the most nail biting thrillers of modern times, this book upholds a rather interesting quote by Dean Koontz, \u201cEvil is no faceless stranger, living in a distant neighborhood. Evil has a wholesome, hometown face, with merry eyes and an open smile. Evil walks among us, wearing a mask that looks like all our faces.\u201d Which is proved time and again in how buffalo bill seduced unsuspecting women or how a cannibal was a celebrated and successful doctor. Other themes include mental health awareness, gender roles and manipulation. In the end, this book is definitely recommended even if one has watched the motion picture. Nothing can beat that immaculate climax and the ultimate fate of Hannibal and Sterling as well to some extent. And remember when you do put down the book to go to sleep, sleep deeply and sweetly in the silence of the lambs.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
Agasthyamalai, Tamilnadu

Agasthyamalai, a remarkable mountain, is the highest point in the Western Ghats of India with a height of about 1868 meters. A rich biosphere reserve at this area is a glory which attracts the visitors all the more. The perennial Thamirabarani River emerges from the eastern side of the range and flows into the Tirunelveli district of Tamil Nadu. 

A place fit for trekking and a pilgrimage centre for devotees of the Hindu sage Agasthya, this location carries all natural elegance and goodness with it. The ferocious wind and those flashes of lightening, all of this illuminates gnarled trees and brings out the sense of pride within us. Certainly, prayers at such a position will please the Lord Agasthya. 

Treat for the eyes, the Agasthyamalai hills are one of the greatest crafts of nature. The view of Western Ghats differs from place to place, and forms a bewildering terrain. The serene atmosphere portrays an appealing landscape which is a virtuous instance of paying a visit here.

title: Picture Thursday
body:
Sprawling in the upper Himalayas, Uttarkashi clutches within itself varying geographic territory ranging from snow free valleys and outer hills to the high peaks with enduring snow and glaciers. On their sloping hills, a chain of meagre populated settlements lies bestrewed with terrace cultivation.

Uttarkashi was officially declared a district on February 24, 1960. It sprawls in the extreme north-west corner of the Uttarakhand over an area of 8016 sq. kms. in the rugged terrain of the majestic Himalayas. On its north, the state of Himachal Pradesh and the territory of Tibet are located and the district of Chamoli lies in the east.

Most of the terrain is hilly that offers an outstanding panorama of this city, and is popularly known as Devbhumi, which can be literally translated to \u2018Land of the Gods'. Pilgrims from all around the country flock to this region, owing to its religious heritage.

There are numerous temples found in Uttarkashi that one can visit during their trip to the place and the most famous one among these is that of Lord Vishwanath. This is the largest temple in the region, and the most frequented one as well. There are several smaller temples in Uttarkashi as well that have their own significance.

title: 24th Foundation Day
body: Haldia Institute Of Technology, the first private engineering college in West Bengal, completed its 24 years of establishment on 25th September 2019. In the year 1996, the first stepping stone towards achieving something great was established. The stone which has now developed into the mighty four pillars with 38 acres of lands, numerous alumni, and a wide array of teaching and non-teaching staff, along with apprentices. Ever since its inception, the premises of the institution have put in dedicated efforts in imparting the students with perception and learning which in turn has helped them become successful leaders. Today, as the celebration and festivities reach the zenith, the campus seems to dwell in the hues of magnificence and glory. We've all created and cherished many memories in the past 23 years and wish to add many more in the years to come. Therefore, at the end of the day, The HIT Times wishes the highly esteemed institution and all the people behind its success, a Happy Foundation Day!

title: Picture Thursday
body:
Shillong, Meghalaya: Shillong is a hill station in Meghalaya situated at an average altitude of 4,908 feet above sea level. It is a perfect blend of old world and modern charm. Be ready to be surrounded by picturesque lakes, green mountains and the serene, calm and tranquil mountain air, blowing through your hair. Among the major tourist attractions are Umiam lake, Elephant falls and Lady Hydari Park. There are others like Laitlum Canyons which is a less explored but one of the most picturesque tourist and trekking destinations in Shillong. Shillong Peak offers a 360-degree bird\u2019s-eye view of the distant hills, waterfalls, Shillong city, and plains of Bangladesh.

Perfect place for those who come here to unwind and be one with nature. Boating facilities are available in most of the numerous lakes of Shillong and they are quite the ride. For the ones looking for some adventure or a forest safari, Mawphlang Sacred Forest is sure to resonate with such nature lovers. 

Lastly, if you are looking to collect a few souvenirs home, the famous police bazaar of Shillong is just the place to find it. A lot of the Khasi heritage influenced items are sold here at  reasonable rates.

title: Viral Corner
body:
"A caged bird can still sing" 
                                              -Stan Swamy

July 6th (of this year marked) a black day for the entire Indian population when the 84-year-old Jesuit priest and a staunch defender of the Adivasi rights breathed his last breath in a hospital in Bandra, Mumbai. At the time of his death, Stanislaus Lourduswamy, popularly known as Father Stan Swamy, was still in judicial custody, charged under the anti-terror law, the Unlawful Activities  Prevention Act, 1967, insinuating that he had some ties with the Maoist forces. The NIA had arrested Swamy from Ranchi on October 7 last year on the allegations that he was a convenor of Persecuted Prisoners Solidarity Committee (PPSC), which it claimed was a frontal organization of CPI (Maoists). 

Father Stan, in his defense, had denied all allegations of Maoist imgurls stating that he had never been to Bhima Koregaon in the first place. "I would just add that what is happening to me is not unique. Many activists, lawyers, writers, journalists, student leaders, poets, intellectuals and others who stand for the rights of Adivasis, Dalits and the marginalized and express their dissent to the ruling powers of the country are being targeted," he had said in a quiet, unwavering voice in a video which was recorded two days before the NIA showed up at his doorstep. 

Father Stan Swamy was the oldest to be arrested in the Bhima Koregaon case. His repeated pleas for bail were turned down even as he was afflicted with severe Parkinson's disease and his health considerably deteriorated when he contracted the deadly  Covid-19 virus. In his letter to his Jesuit colleague from Taloja central jail, he had written, " A caged bird can still sing." And there is no doubt that his song will not cease even after his death. Instead, it will continue to ring true in the face of injustice.

title: Copa America 2021
body:
In what was one of the most highly anticipated matches of recent times, Argentina led by Lionel Messi defeated Brazil 1-0 in a very tightly contested match, to lift the Copa America trophy.
Argentina's winning goal came in at the 22nd minute when Rodrigo de Paul gave a long pass to the veteran striker Angel Di Maria and he lobbed the ball past the Brazillian goalkeeper. It was only the third goal conceded by Brazil in the tournament. Brazil launched several fierce attacks but was effectively silenced by a rock-solid Argentinian defence. Angel Di Maria was adjudged the man of the match for his incredible performance.
This victory ended Argentina's 28-year wait for a major trophy and ended Brazil's unbeaten home record that stretched back more than 2,500 days. Argentina's win, in particular, was particular a special triumph for their captain Lionel Messi, who finally added the first international trophy to his list of innumerable accolades. 
Messi finished the tournament\u2019s joint-top goalscorer with four goals and top assist provider with five assists and was elected joint-best player along with Neymar, while the Argentinian goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez was elected the best goalkeeper of the tournament.
This victory saw Argentina level with Uruguay as the joint all-time leading winners with 15 titles.

title: MONDAY HUES
body:
Those sanguine eyes narrate a tale that we often fail to comprehend. A tale full of struggle and a tale full of hope. 
It's a tale of valor and determination. It teaches us to overcome adversities. In this chaotic and callous world, where everyone has become pretentious, this smile proves to be that guiding light and a ray of hope in this unending darkness. In a place where everyone keeps whining and is self-absorbed, this smile proves to be a remedy that heals those wounds. Those Curious eyes, always ready to learn something new, this is what hope is all about. Despite those leaned shoulders and having lost his hands, he proudly earns his bread with that smile on his face, this is what determination is, and this is what we need to learn.
But as you know life is neither fair nor we can expect it to be. So there will be moments of darkness and moments of excruciating pain. There will be moments of emptiness where you won't be able to feel your soul. There will also be some phases where you will be vulnerable to an extent you couldn't have possibly imagined, but eventually, you will get through.
Life is a ride of mixed emotions. There will be moments of utter joy but there will also be those moments that will try to tear you apart and how you react in these scenarios is gonna define you. So chin up and carry on because courage isn\u2019t having the strength to go on \u2013 it is going on when you don\u2019t have strength.

title: Subho Mahalaya
body:
If you are born into a Bengali family, then no article, song or movie is needed to understand the intricately sewn relation between a Bengali and mahalaya and how our senses become heightened when we listen to the soulful voice of Birendra Krishna Bhadra at the wee hours of the morning, telling the story of goddess of power herself. This auspicious day marks the end of pithri paksha and the beginning of Devi paksha. This is the day when the Devi is believed to have descended upon the earth while she welcomes her daughter in the warmest way, with clear blue skies and kash-phool underneath the various hues of white and blue, mixed with the scent of shiuli-phool, homecoming and lots of love.

Another thing that is closely related to mahalaya is Mahishasura Mardini- a collection of shlokas telling the story of the victory of goddess Durga over the evil Mahishashura. Listening to this program on the radio is as important a tradition as any other related to Durga Puja. Mahalaya marks the beginning of the Puja and this program, even after numerous television shows and enactments is as special and auspicious as it was when it was released the first time. The Mahishashura Mardini shloka is intimately associated with this day. The story of the buffalo king who was defiant of even the gods and tried to control the entire universe. With a blessing from the universe creator Brahma himself, that no man can defeat him, he became unstoppable. Until goddess Durga, a woman defeated him. The legend talks about \u2018nari shakti\u2019, and how no one is ever all-powerful.

Mahalaya not only signifies the homecoming of goddess Durga but of friends and family as well. The cousins from abroad, the friends from their colleges afar, all come back, just like the goddess. Starting from your neighbor next door to the celebrities we follow on Instagram, everyone is sending out the good wishes and good thoughts on Subho mahalaya. Tarpan is also performed on this day to pay respect to the ancestors and a small Puja is performed is not only a day or a tithi, but it\u2019s also an emotion, and when one hears the hymns of \u2018 Roopam dehi jayam dehi yasho dehi dwisho jahi\u2019, we know it\u2019s time to come home. Ma Durga is coming home, everyone is coming home.

title: Review - Metal Gear Rising
body:
Name of the game: Metal Gear Rising - REVENGEANCE

Can you run it?
This game is designed to take a chunk out of your GPU, so better be prepared lest your gaming rig will become an air fryer. The basic requirements are
\u2022 OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1/Windows 8 (64-bit versions)
\u2022 Processor: Intel Core i5 2400
\u2022 Graphics: NVidia GeForce GTS 450 or AMD Radeon HD 5670
\u2022 System Memory: 2 GB RAM
\u2022 Storage: 25 GB Hard drive space
\u2022 DirectX 9 Compatible Graphics Card

Synopsis:
Witness the high octane action as the metal ninja Raiden embarks on a mission to save the world from an evil lurking within the government.  

Gameplay analysis:
The hack and slash it is, the game delivers BIG. Parrying system dedicated to timing, slo-mo blade mode, or the jump slash mechanics, the game has it all. There are parts where it basks in full glory, the blade mode and Jack the Ripper mode being some of them. The former sets the character in a bullet-time mode so you can skewer the enemy with a thousand cuts with your 'hf blade' and the latter, as the name suggests, is a deranged mode where everything is larger than life.

While the zandatsu is inventive, the lock-on system is not, being useful in one on one battles, the lock-on fails in groups as they move too quickly to even get locked on, making it utterly useless.
The gameplay never feels forced and flows beautifully, the true essence being in the swords slashing with bodies. This creates a different type of aesthetic that most games fail to achieve, being a win-win for the game.

Story Analysis:
It seems that developers focused too much on 'hack and slash', compromising on the story part. Not the usual storyline, but nothing worth mentioning either, crisp and short cutscenes are what make it even more gritty. Most of the flashbacks being over in less than a minute or two is what keeps the game going.
Being a bit lenient with the story paved the way for characters development, especially Jetstream Sam. The climax, yes, it could have been crisper and feels stretched at times but hey, we aren't complaining. After all, who wouldn\u2019t love to pound a 1000 tonne mega-machine whilst delivering a lecture on politics and war.
All in all, the story front is a bit lackluster compared to the game\u2019s essence, but it does what a story needs to \u2013 provide an incentive to continue the game and see through its bitter end.

TL;DR:
Swinging the blade of Raiden, aka Jack the Ripper will make you realize the true potential of a sword. Refined mechanics and graphics ahead of their time will make your game a pleasing affair, besides, there is very little room for flaws when a cyborg cuts almost everything with his blade. Just put up with the requirements and strap in for a show that is worth many times its price and has incredible replay value.

title: Spider Man Back In MCU
description: Spider man rejoins MCU with the strike of a new deal
body:
One thing that has always been enamoring to humans are the superheroes. The cliche of them fighting against evil, wear attractive costumes, have superhuman strengths and god-like powers provides us enough reason to idolize and love them. Be them in comic books, television screens, meme templates or on a PVR screen. One of those many superheroes is the character of Spider-Man. A comic book character that first appeared in 1962 and was introduced on big screens in 2002. Since then numerous movies and animated shows were aired.

Through the years we've seen the character being played by different star-casts. The spiderman trilogy had a different cast and the amazing spiderman series stared a different cast. This was a result of the conflicts between Sony Pictures Entertainment and its partnership franchise. In February 2015, good news came with the announcement of the inclusion of Spiderman in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Until then the MCU had already set its root deep within the ground and was a force to reckon with. The announcement by Sony and Disney was like icing on the cake for the Marvel fanatics. Spiderman then appeared in five MCU movies and went on to become the ruler of every fanatic hearts. The father-son bond between Ironman and Spiderman won everyone's heart. We all thought that the character would become the new leader of the Avengers. But, eventually, Sony broke its contract with Disney and SpiderMan was descended from MCU. This came as a heartbreak to all the fans. Netizens flooded social media with hashtags of bringing Spiderman back in the MCU.

In response, the grief didn't last long. On September 27, 2019, Spiderman was brought back in the MCU with the strike of the new deal between the franchises. We are all thrilled to see how the journey of Spiderman will unfold in the years to come.

title: Fuubutsushi
body:
\u300bWord: Fuubutsushi
\u300bOrigin: Japan
\u300bLiteral Meaning: The things \u2013 feelings, scents, images \u2013 that evoke memories or anticipation for a particular season.

Yellowing leaves for fall, snowy mountain tops for winter, blooming flowers for spring and sunburns for summer...Sometimes all these little things can get our heart racing with delight and anticipation for a particular season, especially when we live in a tropical country like India with six distinct seasons. They are like touching a port key that immediately transfers us to a wormhole of memories of any season.

Be it the nitrogenous smell of earth moistened by the virgin drop of rains or the invigorating smell of "shiuli" buds, before pujo. The seasons appeal to us in their own ways, using our sense organs and leave us gushing with inexplicable emotions for some or no apparent reason. Believe it or not, Fuubutsushi gets us all, one way or another, and when it does, welcome the season as warmly as you can, because... you dont have another option.

title: Happiness Comes From Within!
body:
"Joy is a decision, a really brave one, about how you are going to respond to life."
~Wess Stafford

Look around. What do you see? A sea of smiling faces? An ocean of happiness floating around? An unending chain of laughter echoing around. But are they all genuinely happy? Real happiness comes from a sense of peace residing within the mind. Little acts of kindness every day can bring in happiness too. Woman, not only the best of God's creations but also the source of all power in the universe, her gentle acts of kindness, her bright radiating smile can brighten up the whole surrounding. This amazing work of art is not only a great manifestation of human emotions but also of the innocence a woman holds in herself. The poverty-ridden condition of the lady here doesn't stop her from brightening up the frame with her smile. She is happier than many of us; she is happy with whatever the Almighty has provided her with and her genuine smile says it all, thus proving the old saying- "Happiness comes from within." true again.

title: Durga Puja and its celebration across various states!
description: Durga puja and how it's prevalent in various states
body:
One of the most famous Indian festivals, Durga Puja or Dussehra, is celebrated in the honor of Goddess Durga during the period of Navratri. Durga Puja celebrates the victory of Goddess Durga over the demon king Mahisasura. The culturally diverse population of India acknowledges this festival elegantly in individual ways, varying from place to place.

Devotees celebrate the Navratri festival in Gujarat by observing fasts and performing the famous traditional dance Garba. Tamilians worship the three Goddesses: Durga, Saraswati, and Lakshmi during the last three days of the Navratri. Daily jagrans are held in temples during the nine holy nights in Punjab. In Maharashtra, the mulgis and manus hit the celebration grounds in festive Garba and dandiya sticks to sway on the beats of foot-thumping music. Apart from offering special worship to the Goddess in holy shrines, the locals set up a temporary altar of the deity and recite the scripture Durga Saptshati. Grand pandals are set up in different themes every year in West Bengal to enshrine beautiful idols of Goddesses.

The celebrations end with Vijay Dashami, the tenth day of Dussehra, when amid loud chants and drum beats, idols are carried in huge processions to local rivers, where they are immersed. The message of Durga Puja is to burn the evil within ourselves and follow the path of virtue and goodness.

We, at The HIT Times, wish for the good health and fortune of everyone. May this Durga Puja bring home glee and joy, and gift fervor grip to one and all.

title: Gandhi Jayanti!
body:
With the break of the dawn, the Raj Ghat in Delhi immerses in garlands and florals as the country comes together to pay homage to the Father of the Nation-Mahatma Gandhi.

2nd October is celebrated as Gandhi Jayanti across the nation as the day marks the birth anniversary of Gandhiji. Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi or better known as Mahatama Gandhi was born on 2nd October 1869 in Porbandar, Gujarat. He began his life working as a lawyer but, his acute fear of public speaking made him flee from the court. Later, he overcame his fear and turned it into an advantage for himself and for the nation as well. He then began a life that went on to inspire millions. He first developed his proficiency at leadership while in South Africa where he campaigned for civil rights of the countrymen. At the age of 45, he came to India and inspired peasants, farmers and urban laborers to protest again high-taxes. It took no time for the people to identify him as their leader. People believed that his path of Non-Violence would help them gain Swaraj. He was able to help his country and countrymen gain independence from the Britishers. He met his demise on 30th January 1948 when he was shot dead by Nathuram Godse. Today, he is revered as one of the most transformative and inspirational figures around the world. He is known for his unwavering campaign and promotion of Non-Violence. The day is also celebrated as the International Day of Non-Violence.

Today, on his 150th Birth Anniversary, The HIT Times celebrates the man who inspired millions to follow his path and changed the world for better.

title: A Young adults' POV of Durga Puja
description: Durga puja through the eyes of a young adult
body:
"Ashchhe Bochhor Abar Hobe \u2013 A young adults' POV of Durga Puja":

Asshiner sharodo praate,
The festival of lights, happiness and love unfolds.
The unparalleled feeling of homecoming in the hearts of mothers
The beginning of many stories untold.

From streets to pandals, the young love goes unchanged.
This celebration of mohishashur bodh, an excuse
Just to see her in that red saree, his Durga.
The crowded pandals, just to get a tad bit close to her.
Looking up at the golden dancing lights adorning the streets,
To see her smile, the heart flutters with \u2018if only\u2019s.

As the sky melts into the night, so does her being,
Seeing him in front of Durga, praying \u2013
With the sleeves of his green Punjabi rolled down to his elbows.
From Maddox to Badamtala and everything in between,
Tied in the safe haven of his arms, against the taxi window.

The dhunuchi naach and the dhaanker awaj just a distant lull,
Reminiscing under the night sky; the dull burn from drinking too much slowly fading-
The memories keep getting stronger, she\u2019s no longer-
But a distant ashthami of a certain Durga pujo.

The city comes alive, as laughter and arati mingle,
As conches are blown, as bells jingle.
The world sees a festival, we see an emotion.
Of coming together and even breaking apart,
Of late-night pandal hopping and hogging down food, maybe a bit too much.
Of dancing to the rhythms of kaashful and palmful shiuli.
From mahalaya to bishorjon, we see it all.
Prothom prem, notun jama, and ek cup chaa-
Constant being the \u2018joy\u2019 of Dugga ma.

title: JOYSTICK JUNKIES
body:
Name of the game: Bulletstorm

Can you run it?

The minimum recommended requirements are:
\u2022 OS: Windows 7 (with SP1) or Windows 8/8.1.
\u2022 Processor: Processor Intel Core 2 Duo, AMD Athlon X2, or equivalent, running at 1.6 GHz or  greater
\u2022 Graphics: DirectX 9.0c compatible, 512MB of VRAM; NVIDIA GeForce GTX260, or ATI Radeon 4870
\u2022 Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible Sound Card with Latest Drivers
\u2022 System Memory: 2 GB RAM
\u2022 Storage: 9 GB Hard drive space



Synopsis:

The juggling story of an interplanetary pirate, once a Dead Echo leader, who sets out on the path of revenge seeking solstice for the sins he and his comrades committed at the order of their masked self righteous commander.


Gameplay analysis:

The environment of the game is dynamic; charging from space into an armada, crashing trains and helicopters or hanging vertically on the walls of a skyscraper with mind boggling hi-tech boots, it never gets old. 
The weapons are all the good old recipes, but with a new topping served as the cybernetic electronic leash, allowing you to pull your enemies, thrash them, butcher them make a voodoo doll out of them\u2026all to your liking. And yeah, the enemies are quite more falvoured than the weapons; mutants, Vikings, big daddies and all sorts of twisted crampups you would wish to crush.


Story Analysis:

The story\u2019s fun, although not as much as the crisped crushing methods, but its good enough.
The protagonist, Grayson Hunt, starts as a Dead echo member under General Victor Sarrano\u2019s command, where the backdrop of the story is set. 
Then the story moves on to the infamous pirates and their last desperate gasp in an attempt to kill their beloved general, which for them, was a slight chance of redemption for all the innocent souls they butchered.
It has its fair share of mysteries and suspense, all set in calculated moments to make it a real hitter.


TL;DR:

We all dream to experience a pirate\u2019s life. Well, this interplanetary pirate takes it up a notch with his abilities, the cyborg and the mutated environments he ventures into.
Once you get the leash in your hands, you won\u2019t quit till your hands will start saying, "no more."

title: Review - Rainbow 6 Seige
body:
Name of the game: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege
\u00a0
Can you play it?
The minimum requirements for you to begin with are:

Operating System: 64-bit Windows 7 SP1 / Windows 8 / Windows 8.1 / Windows 10
Processor: Intel Core i3 560 @ 3.3 GHz or AMD Phenom II X4 945 @ 3.0 GHz *
RAM: 6 GB
Video card: Nvidia GeForce GTX 460 or AMD Radeon HD5770 (1024 MB VRAM)
Hard Drive: 85.5 GB
DirectX:\u00a0 11
\u00a0
Synopsis:
Join SIX and his elite multinational task force in their quest to take down the White Mask.

Gameplay analysis:
Siege is unexpectedly bent towards a unique pseudo-realism. A steady stream of new maps and operators has slowly transformed it into a much deeper competitive game. it's still a 5v5 dance of attack and defense on 15 compact but complex maps that stretch across multiple stories, littered with destructible walls and floors that can either be fortified or blasted to let you make your own doors and open up new sightlines. Each round of a match starts with a frantic race as one side sets up their defenses and the other hunts for intel with remote-controlled drones. Once the recon is over, the race begins.
There's the PvE terrorist hunt mode and the single-player situations for a good warm-up before PvP but it's a bit disappointing that either mode does not expand much as everything else around it grows.
\u00a0
Story Analysis:
There is not much of a story in the first place, an essential set-up of a terrorist assault.\u00a0
Clich\u00e9 marks the beginning when it labels all the players as an elite group assembled from around the globe to save the day. Six's declaration of chasing down the enemies and protecting the country against terrorism looks promising after their success in the chemical attack on Bartlett University mission.\u00a0
With everything taken into account, the story isn't that much engaged with the game as the center moves more toward the ongoing interaction than the story.\u00a0

Tl;dr :
Siege's destructibility, diverse gadgetry, mind games, and big map pool earns it the title of an excellent tactical FPS. Challenge yourself with some snappy aims and room full of C4 traps in\u00a0 PvE Terrorist Hunt mode. A 5v5 shooter, tons of explosions, and an objective to secure. So why keep waiting, join the fields now.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
Jakhoo hill
Location: Shimla, Himachal Pradesh

Located at 2,455m from the sea level and 200km higher than the central ridge of Shimla. Jakhoo hills is the highest point in the city. The hill is one of the main attractions of the city Shimla. It is a thirty-minute trek up the hill, the trek is actually a very pleasurable experience for many city dwellers with its peace and tranquility. The crisp and clean mountain air at the summit, surrounded by the alpine trees is very much worth the trek. The temple at the summit, which is flat and wide is another attraction as well. The temple is colorfully painted and images of Lord Hanuman adorn the walls of the temple. The temple dedicated to Lord hanuman and is home to a lot of monkeys and very rightly so. However, these little creatures are quite the nuisances to the tourists and trekkers, trying to snatch away anything from food to shiny objects. From the summit, the view is great as well, with the Shivalik mountain range in the north and the city Shimla in the west. Overall this place is a pleasurable and memorable experience for every tourist and more so if one is a mountain lover. The calm curves of the trail, the sound of the hill and it\u2019s animal inhabitants make it for a must-visit.

title: The Bihar Flood
body:
Bihar, the 3\u02b3\u1d48 most populous state of the country is facing the fury of nature yet again as the retreating monsoon has caused chaos in many parts of the state resulting in heavy flood throughout the state. More than 15 districts of the state has been hit by the flood causing huge loss of life and property.

Many districts in the state have been entirely flooded with water causing transportation and communication breakdown. A number of residential societies are still under water while thousands of people reportedly remain stranded indoors. Schools and colleges also remain closed.

The flood has raised many health concerns for the natives over the last few days resulting from carcasses of animals that have given rise to many diseases causing microorganisms. Moreover, the stagnant water is also home to disease-causing mosquitoes which pose a serious threat to the health of the people residing in the affected areas. In many areas the electricity supply has also been cut off due to the flood, causing a lot of trouble to the locals.

Till now more than 55 people have lost their lives in this flood but the government is continuously organizing rescue operations owing to which more than ten thousand people have been evacuated safely to the relief camps across the state. Moreover, the central government has organized helicopters for the rescue operations and for supplying food items and items of clothing to the people affected by the flood. The water is also being continuously pumped out of the residential areas so as to prevent the outbreak of any disease. The center has announced a fund of \u20b9400 crores to Bihar as assistance to overcome this disastrous calamity.

SDRF, NDRF, and many other aid agencies are working day and night to bring the situation under control. So let us all pray for our brothers and sisters from Bihar and extend a hand of help to all those affected.

title: Word Worth Million!
body:
\u300bWord: Esperto
\u300bPronunciation: e- sp\u00e8r- to
\u300bOrigin: Portugal
\u300bLiteral Meaning: Expert, Experienced


Riddles studded every mile.
Frailing doesn't help so,
easing up she gave the smile;
said \u201cnot everyone\u2019s an esperto.\u201d
Delicacy her maneuver,
scarlet feral her soul.
No time to be a rover,
destined to reach the goal.


The meaning of this particular word is almost predictable, because of the way it is pronounced. This term applies to a very admirable category of people, as the word roughly translates to "expert". Sharp, quick-witted, intuitive and anything genius can fit right into the spectrum of this word.

In modern culture, many have retorted to the simpler version of it, accenting it as \u2018experto.\u2019 The word can be played into negative shade as well, but mostly is used in the brighter light.

Now that we are all done talking about it, let\u2019s go and find out what we are individually 'esperto' at.

title: The Green Taxi Initiative!
body:
\u201cTo plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.\u201d~Audrey Hepburn

Raging streets, rustling crowds horns bellowing and suddenly from afar appears this Yellow Cab with this bountiful lushness... everyone stares in awe!

As our second grade environmental science taught us, when it comes to planting trees the mantra is \u201cthe more the merrier. As mundane as it might seem, planting saplings is way more economic and yielding in the long run than developing these solar panels and hybrid cars. There is always room for change and improvement given there\u2019s will.

How refreshing it is to see this cab take such an innovative shot on car planting. With each attempt to boost the greenery, we buy a little more time to fight these climate changes. This little sward that we come across in the snap is actually HOPE. Hope that there is room for change, hope that people are still willing and that we will survive. The benefits of planting will shrivel if we wait, so let's start now.

title: Vijay Dashmi!
body:
Every time the heinous rose to power the virtuous have come to defend this world from its vile and menaces. Good and evil are complementary forces to themselves, one more domineering over the other.

The advent of the wicked always comes with consequential self-destruction. With Satan came St. Michel, for Kansa we had Krishna, Rama won over Ravana and Goddess Durga defeated Mahishasura. According to ancient Indian mythology, every year this time in calendar marks the grand celebration of Durga Puja/Dussehra. The festival portrays the valuation of \u2018good over evil.\u2019

This celebration is a reminder of the existence of righteous and just and gives us veracious hopes and believes in humanity and collective good inspires us to self reflect and win over our own shadows.

We, The HIT Times, wish everyone a very happy and prosperous Dussehra and Shubho Bijaya.

title: Super M
body:
Super M:
On October 4th, the k pop industry saw the emergence of a new group which was not new.
Confusing as it sounds, Super M is the group consisting of the members from previous existing groups which were under the label of one of the biggest k pop labels, the SM Entertainment. To put it in a less confusing way, Super M is a supergroup. Supergroups are nothing new. In older days, it was often seen that members from different rock bands would come together to create new dynamics and find out other possible alternatives to the existing music industry, and it was time this trend found its way into the kpop industry.
Super M consists of members from Exo (Byun Baekhyun and Kai), NCT (Taeyong, Ten, Mark and Lucas) and SHinee (Lee Taemin), which are all established idols in the Kpop industry.
The group was announced back on August 7, 2019, at Capitol Congress. CMG chairman and CEO Steve Barnett, Caroline president Jacqueline Saturn, and SM founder Soo-Man Lee were all on hand to share words about the announcement. The group which was announced as \u201cThe Avengers of Kpop\u201d were introduced in crisp and futuristic visuals, with the youngest member Mark rocking a big pair of clear sunglasses. "We're maintaining their groups, their solo careers, and on top of this, we have this 'Avengers' group to pull them together. There's already an Iron-Man, a Thor, etc; and just like how the Avengers can have their own successful movies, there is a different kind of energy when they are together as The Avengers. We are now creating that as a point of business. We want to create a synergy between their groups, them as solo acts, and the Super M group to create a big wave in this K-pop industry." Quoted Chris Lee, A&R executive at Super M. Intensive advertising was done, with visuals (both individual and group) introduced on various social platforms. Teasers of each individual member, a dance routine accompanied by group teasers.
Super M dropped their eponymous ep on October 4th, with their lead title \u201cJopping\u201d garnering over 17 million views days after release, even going trending in India.
Truly, there were some hitches during their premiere with the hashtag \u2018#supermdisbandmentparty\u2019 trending on twitter but all is well that ends well. When performing at Capitol Records, they truly showed that they were a force to be reckoned with, their stage presence, singing, dancing, and visuals being top-notch.
Super M have debuted on a very big scale, showing us that when the established idols, each having their own loyal fandom come together. The result is something far more exciting.

title: Monologue of a rough soul
body:
\u2667Monologue of a rough soul.\u2667

Why do I feel like I belong in places which I know I\u2019m not supposed to?

Like in the nooks and crannies of the truth, in the slits of reality,

I sit in peace though such an odd, unsettling disturbance I am.

It\u2019s only among the odd, among the shadows, that I feel at ease to just be me.

I was not moulded for fancy things. I belong in the dirt of pain and loss. That's my comfort zone.

I\u2019m no big shot. Tux and shiny shoes won't make me look any greater.
The finer things are just wasted on me.

I just want to be left alone, to not pretend to fit in, but to succeed in the mess I am and I love to be.

title: Nobel Prize 2019
body:
In order to mark and celebrate the service to mankind, the Nobel Prize is awarded to renowned personalities for their contribution to the Nobel fields. The noble prize is awarded to laureates irrespective of him/her being an internationally known figure or a person plucked from obscurity. On a yearly basis, the Nobel prize is awarded in the fields of Physics, Chemistry, Literature, Physiology or Medicine, Economics and Peace. A sense of triumph stretched across the country as Indian-origin Abhijeet Banerjee won the Nobel Prize in Economics for work on Global Poverty. Alongside Banerjee, his wife Esther Duflo and Michael Kremer shared the prize.

Abhijeet Banerjee completed his education from the University of Calcutta, Jawaharlal Nehru University and then went on to receive a Ph.D. degree from Harvard University. The joint effort by the three laureates was "The experimental approach to alleviate global poverty". The Indian-American economist is currently a professor at Massachusetts Institute of Technology along with his wife Duflo. Esther Duflo became the second female winner and the youngest ever. Duflo has also served as an advisor to former US President Barack Obama. Michael Kremer, a professor at Harvard University, conducted pioneering work with Kenyan School during the 1990s. This effort was further developed by Duflo and Banerjee. Their combined effort on how to raise vaccination rates and education standards touched millions of hearts across the globe. They received worldwide recognition and were praised for this.

We congratulate Banerjee, Duflo, and Kremer along with all other laureates' on winning the Nobel prize in their respective fields and on attaining a life-changing honor. We thank them for their benevolent service to mankind.

title: JOYSTICK JUNKIES
body:
#JoystickJunkies

Name of the game: Resident Evil 6
 
Can you run it?

The minimum recommended requirements are:
\u2022         OS: Windows 7 (with SP1) or Windows 8/8.1.
\u2022         Processor: Intel CoreTM2 Duo 2.4 Ghz or AMD AthlonTM X2 2.8 Ghz
\u2022         Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8800GTS
\u2022         Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible Sound Card with Latest Drivers
\u2022         System Memory: 2 GB RAM
\u2022         Storage: 16 GB Hard drive space
 
Synopsis: 
The weak have succumbed to the virus; those left are still being snatched into it, turning them into the walking dead. Continue the hunt; for thou shall keep the last flames of humanity\u2019s hope burning, included with a sparkling storyline, multiple perspectives and crashing moves.

Gameplay analysis:
Fighting zombies is fun, but the fun erupts even further when you have a choice to dive into it with your choice of skills, that to not just one but four of them. Either be the bold front-facing soldier or the shadow lurking sneaky fox, it\u2019s all included in the choice for protagonists.
The game also provides partners for some of them which either you could control or let the AI handle it, or just to take it up a notch even let your friend join you in on the story.
The weapons are cool, but the melee shots and punches are crazy good, and don\u2019t even ask about the roundhouse kick! The game also allows you to shoot while sliding and move way more dynamically.
And to fit the insanity of the fight, the enemies give you no time to even catch your breath. The new addition, J\u2019avo, beasts with intelligence, planning their attacks, restoring health. They possess it all.

Story Analysis:
The fun begins right from the start of the game, leading the player into the controls and the severities. And then the story unfolds with one protagonist as the main centre while the other three create their own adventures. In time the protagonists cross paths with each other, where things finally turn out in victory for the player.
The main plot is related to the dead Albert Wesker\u2019s son, Jake Muller, who joins DSO working along with Sherry Birkin to find the vaccine for the new C-virus. Their journey is interfered with by Ada, the main element of surprise in the game, who captures them for some time.
Later saved by Chris Redfield and Piers Nivans, Jake and Sherry continue their fight against the virus. 

TL;DR:
The dead frighten everyone, and the best way to counter your demons is to face them. And there is nothing better than Resident Evil\u2019s zombies to have enormous fun while smashing your fear and your demons together. Get into the hunt and be serious about it, because even one scratch on your skin and who knows, you might be among the walking dead.

title: Grammarism!
body:
The usage of proper grammar in English is the first and most crucial thing to do, while speaking or otherwise. Though there aren\u2019t any hard and fast rule to always follow in English grammar, here\u2019s something that might be of help.
The difference between affect and effect might seem dicy, but, is rather an easy one.

1.Affect: Affect is used as a verb in a sentence. It is used to signify impact or influence on something.For example,The BP oil spill adversely affected marine wildlife in the Gulf of Mexico and surrounding areas.
2.Effect: This is used as a noun in a sentence. It is used to signify the end result or outcome. For example- After the BP oil spill, the government effected [i.e., brought about, executed] sweeping environmental regulation. Effect with an E stands for end result.

title: The Difference in Childhood, Now and Then
body:
The difference in Childhood, Now and Then

I remember the days when we used to play sports on the streets during our childhood days and were set far away from modern technologies. We had no cell phones or tablets to play with. Rather, we used to play with our favorite set of toys and managed to get time to play on the streets and parks too. But, these days, it seems as if the parks are left abandoned, and the streets are screeching to the children.

Kids have no time to teach us about the small and big hands of the clock. They now have cellular phones and devices that tell them the time. I consider technology is not really a necessity for a child. The overall development of a child has been affected adversely due to this. Parents presume it's quite safe to use cell phones and other electronic gadgets in order to get rid of their child's troubles.

Earlier, children wouldn't be complaining about much. Perhaps, the main thing that sets our childhood apart is that, while we may have done some of the same things, those memories live inside our minds and in countless photo albums stored in our parents\u2019 living room, not on social media.

Pic Courtesy: The Internet

title: Hagibis Ruckus!
body:
Typhoon Hagibis:

Over a course of a few weeks, Japan was torn across by the deadly typhoon Hagibis, which struck the country in the first week of October 2019.

It proved to be fatal, affecting the economy and lives of thousands of people. As per local records, 77 were confirmed dead, and 10 were missing, with a property loss of around $9 billion. Hagibis caused widespread damage across Japan, particularly in the Kant\u014d region.

The nineteenth named typhoon, Hagibis developed over a tropical wave, located a couple of hundred miles north of the Marshall Islands around the first week of October. It was a very large and powerful cyclone, that was considered the largest to hit the Kanto region after Ida hit back in 1958. Hagibis added to the losses of Flexis that hit Japan just a month prior.

Hagibis brought along with it heavy rain and winds, flooded rivers, collapsed dikes, and numerous landslides. More than 20 rivers in central and northeastern Japan had burst their banks, flooding more than 1,000 homes in cities, towns, and villages.

More than 100,000 rescue workers are still combing through flooded and damaged areas of central Japan after it was struck by Hagibis.
Climate studies suggest japan could see more frequent and stronger typhoons in the future, due in large part to warming seas as a result of human-caused global warming. The losses were unusually high this time, considering Japan is one of the most well-prepared countries regarding natural disasters. Hagibis will go down the history as a multibillion-dollar disaster.

title: Word Worth Million!
body:
Word: Verboten
Origin: German
Pronunciation: ver/bo/ten
Meaning: Forbidden, Barred

A word with connotations of excessive strictness or authoritarianism, derived from perceptions of Germany, especially under the German Empire and National Socialism.
It is often used to describe the things that people strongly disapprove of or the things that are not often talked about. The word generally appertains to all the malicious things which are commonly considered to be a taboo by the general people.

Where the sun shines brightly and everything seems so fine,
Where all are smiling and no one seems to whine.

Where the women fought for the country and sacrificed their lives,
Where they keep their pace with men and fight the odds to survive.

Where everyone talks of gender equality but its real meaning is forgotten,
There still exist corners in our country where the rights of women are still verboten.

title: Walking Down The Path Of Contentment!
body: Far from the maddening crowd, there lies a land with the fiery sky and the serene waters. Life as we know it, is a mayhem of events, of moments, floating around and crashing onto one another. And in this chaos of intricately knit beauty and madness, we are defined by those fleeting moments. Often, as human beings we like to wallow in our pool of self pity and sorrow, or immerse into the quicksand of fear, or paralyze ourselves with the horror of the unknown and the overthinking that quickly follows when faced with events of harsh magnitude; the truth being, our reality lies in the space between the black and white. What we fail to realize is that it is the uncertainty, the bittersweet wait of the very next moment, that gives our existence the much desired meaning, which we spent an eternity trying to find. And in this maze of wavering actuality, we are defined by the choices that we make. If it's the red horned rascal that wins or the one dressed in white, dripping with innocence. Nonetheless, as the most evolved species of the universe, we do find out if we are capable of making a choice to meet our peace and through it walk down the path of contentment or we let ourselves drown in our insecurities again and again. But, at the end of the day, when our bodies finally meet the comforts of a cozy bed and the familiarity of a rebel mind, we realize that there exist no wrong roads, for we are only human- a struggling spirit caught in the eternal play of the fiery sky and the serene waters.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
Picture Thursday: Mussorie

With a captivating view in the backdrop of the Himalayas, the lush green aura engulfing the entire town, the forested ridges and slopes stretching down the valley, and the sense of romanticism that breathes along with this place, such is the unwinding paradise of Mussorie. 

Mussorie lies in the Indian state of Uttarakhand which resides in the foothills of the mighty Himalayan range. With home to rich and diverse flora and fauna, one will find themselves walking amidst the giant pine and oak trees that gets enveloped with mist and appear greener during the monsoon. Mussorie has its own cultural heritage that has remained unagitated in the breeze of modernized trends. 

The ridge of Mussorie offers plentiful spots that would dwell any traveler with its beauty, serenity and tranquility. Kempty Falls, Red Tibetan Scenic Point, the camel black cemetery, the Mussorie library all have their own significance with some dating and maintaining their aura since the colonial period. Besides providing pleasing views for wanderlust, Mussorie also is an educational and training hub. Dehradun, the state's capital is well connected with Mussorie and houses some of the finest educational institutions of North India and a pioneering administration academy LBSNAA significantly adds to the charm of Mussorie. 

If you are willing to attune yourself with a brisking climate, cascading showers, inhale the refreshing and energetic mountain mist, go on trekking and capture moments into the frame then this place surely needs to be on your "To-Visit" list. We hope your travel to Mussorie doesn't bother your pocket way too much and if it does then we wish you luck to grasp in every penny you can to see this place not just in pictures but with your bare eyes.

title: Viral Corner
body:
A simple parking row between police personnel and lawyers on Saturday had escalated leading to violence and arson at the Tis Hazari Court complex. At least 20 police personnel and several lawyers were injured and many vehicles were damaged in the incident. This dispute led to atleast 20 policemen and several advocates being injured.
The immediate provocation for the protest was an on-duty policeman being thrashed by advocates outside the Saket Court on Monday. When the policeman was leaving the spot, a man also hit his bike with his helmet. Since that incident the police personnel started protesting against the lawyers wearing black armbands and chanting slogans for justice. They also moved an application in the Delhi High Court against the guilty lawyers.
Similarly, the lawyers also went on a strike and staged a protest demanding action against police personnel involved in the Tis Hazari incident which saw the police personnel firing bullets leading to serious injury of a few advocates. The advocates also moved an application in the court against the police personnel demanding justice.
 While the Delhi High Court also expressed anguish over this situation and issued the statement stating "they (police and lawyers) are but two faces of the coin of justice, and it is essential, for the rule of law to prevail, that they work in close proximity and harmony. Any dissonance, or friction, between them, is deleterious to peace and harmony, and destructive of public interest, in the long run.In our view, therefore, it would be advisable, in this case, that a joint meeting, of responsible representatives of the advocates and the police establishment be convened, who should make a sincere effort to meet and sort out their differences amicably and peacefully."

title: Picture Thursday
body:
Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh

Situated at an altitude of 1,475 meters above sea level, Dharamshala lies on the scenic stretch of land of Kangra Valley making tourists spellbound for its spectacular beauty. Often cited as the "Little Lhasa of India", Dharamshala is popularly known as the holy residence of the exiled Tibetan monk Dalai Lama. With the backdrop of the breathtaking Dhauladhar ranges, it is one of the most tranquil destinations with a perfect blend of natural beauty and culture. Surrounded by thick cedar trees and the snow capped peaks which decorates the landscape, this place looks unreal.

The city of Dharamshala is divided into two parts, the lower division is the Dharamsala town whereas the upper division is known as Mcleodganj. The two different parts of the city have something different to offer. As a tourist, it offers you the opportunity to unwind and take in the beauty of the surroundings.

There are many places to visit in Dharamshala including the famous Tsuglagkhang Complex, which is the official home of the Dalai Lama and is also the largest Tibetan temple outside Tibet. The other must visit places include Bhagsunag Falls, Kangra Art Museum, Gyuto Monastery, Chamunda Devi Temple, and the Gyuto Monastery among others. During the Cricket season, you can also enjoy the cricket match in the highest and most beautiful Cricket stadium in India.

Blessed with spectacular scenes of nature, the calm and serene hill stations proudly boasts strong Buddhist influences with many quaint old monasteries located here. Once you\u2019ve restored your spiritual energy, enjoy a picturesque stroll to Bhagsu Waterfall or climb the hill to Triund to bask in stunning views of the Himalayas. You can visit temples, enjoy sightseeing, visit the waterfall, shop for souvenirs and arts & crafts, seek blessings at the monasteries and temples & enjoy the various Tibetan dishes.

So, plan to visit this beautiful place and relax, unwind, chill out and celebrate the serenity surrounding you.

title: Windows of the soul:
body:
Wind swims with elegance,
Sky plays hide n seek with the ground,
And the hilltops kiss the stunning greenland with a passion yet to be seen,
And I, a mere visitor, a tiny spectator,
In total awe!

As we are inching towards the end of the semester, we are all psyching up. It is also that time of the year when nagging new resolutions would be everyone's cup of tea, people would swear off alcohol for the umpteenth time and would spike about the gym. Alike, everyone, we jot down our plans that we will merely indulge into. We commit to arbitrary actions that don't yield the desired outcome. Where do we lag? It's the approach. We do commit to the actions related to it but, we forget to adapt the lifestyle changes that it brings. We forget to orchestrate our thought process around an exclusive thing. But, that isn't our fault. We as human beings have a conscience that goes beyond any measurement. At a certain point in our life, we desire for this and the next day we desire something else. We become overly optimistic. We all need to remember that everything needs proper planning and furthermore the way it is implemented. Instead of aspiring and committing to actions we need to set achievable goals defined over a limited period of time. And then walking down a path with the lifestyle changes would enable us to be what we desire. Well, being at a place like this would give you an opportunity to reflect on your past, and the year that lies ahead. Moreover, it will provide you with the visualization to reflect on your path and will enable you to maintain a direction in your life.

title: Guru Nanak Jayanti!
body:
Guru Nanak Jayanti or Gurpurab (\u0a17\u0a41\u0a30\u0a2a\u0a41\u0a30\u0a2c) is the most sacred festival of Sikhs all around the world. Gurupurab marks the birth anniversary of the founder of Sikhism, Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji, and it falls every year on a full moon day known as Kartik Purnima according to the Hindu lunar calendar.

This festival is celebrated for a total of 3 days with Guru Granth Sahib (the primary holy book of Sikhs) being read continuously for 48 hours prior to the actual day and this recitation of the holy book is known as "Akhand Path(\u0a05\u0a16\u0a70\u0a21 \u0a2a\u0a3e\u0a20)". This is the biggest festival for the Sikhs and is celebrated by the Sikh community all around the world with great zeal and enthusiasm.

On this day, people go to the Gurudwaras and pray for the well being of their family members. On this day people organize "Langars (\u0a32\u0a70\u0a17\u0a30)" to provide free food to anyone that comes to the Gurdwaras. To commemorate the birth of their first guru, followers begin their day with Prabhat Pheri (an early morning procession). All through the day, devotees chant and sing hymns. A special prayer is organized at sunset and is known as \u2018Rehrasi\u2019. People also wear new clothes on this auspicious occasion and enjoy many mouth-watering dishes. They donate food and clothes to the needy people on this day following the teachings and principles of Guru Nanak Dev Ji.

In the evening people light up their houses with candles and lightings and listen to "Gurbani". They even burn crackers to celebrate this occasion and exchange sweets and greet each other on this auspicious day.
This year marks the 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji. So let us all follow his principles and live our life on the values of honesty, equality, and helpfulness to make our lives meaningful and create a difference.

In the end, The HIT Times wishes you all a very happy Guru Nanak Jayanti.

title: Happy Children's Day
body:
Children's Day is celebrated in India as a tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru, who was born on November 14, 1889. He was lovingly called Chacha Nehru or simply Chachaji, owing to his love for children. This day is marked by the distribution of chocolates and gifts among children, while schools organize various events to commemorate the birth anniversary of Chachaji.

It is also a common practice to distribute gifts like clothes, toys, and books to orphan children on this day. Before 1964, India celebrated Children's Day on 20th November, which was observed as the Universal Children's Day by the United Nations but after Jawaharlal Nehru\u2019s death, in 1964, it was decided en mass\u00e9, to celebrate his birthday as \u2018Bal Diwas\u2019 in the country due to his love and affection towards children.

Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru once said "The children of today will make the India of tomorrow. The way we bring them up will determine the future of the country". Keen on the development and education of children in the country, Pandit Nehru oversaw the establishment of some of the most prominent educational institutions in India. His vision for the development of youth played a major role in the setting up of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences, or AIIMS, and the Indian Institutes of Technology. He even initiated the establishment of the Indian Institutes of Management.

Apart from his role as a freedom fighter and politician, Pandit Nehru has left behind a legacy of education and development of children in the country. It\u2019s a pity, we HITians are no longer children, with respect to our age...but we shall always be kids, in our heart of hearts. This day is dedicated to that child in all of us, who learns the workings of the world, with better understanding and grows with every new experience in their life.

Therefore, child or not, the HIT Times wishes you all a Happy Children\u2019s Day!

title: Book Review: Doctor Sleep
body:
Book Name: Doctor sleep 
Author: Stephen King 

\u201cWhat happened to the kid from The Shining?\u201d is something that King was asked in every interview ever since the superb success of the 1974 book \u201cThe Shining\u201d.
Finally, in 2013 he came out with the much-awaited sequel to the book, named \u201cDoctor Sleep\u201d.

There is hardly anything that King cannot make the readers afraid of, from the actual monsters like vampires to clowns, adolescent girls to faithful family dogs, crazed fans and little children, there is nothing outside the spectrum of King\u2019s horror. And now, with the latest installment, the book not only follows the adult life of Danny Torrance but also a branch of old people driving around in RVs or motor homes and having children for dinner, literally. Not just any child, but the ones who \u201cshine\u201d, yes Danny still \u201cshines\u201d not as he used to, thanks to the years of drug and alcohol abuse. But now he has better control over his powers and also the \u2018Overlook demons\u2019, those who now mostly reside in memory. This group of old people called \u2018True Knot\u2019 headed by a woman called Rose to find and torture child psychics to death so they can eat their shining. (They call it "steam"; it's their only nourishment.) Another major character of this story is Abra Stone who is a 13 years old girl who has the best \u2018shine\u2019 Danny has ever come across.

We start with Danny attending an AA meeting in New Hampshire and taking up a job as a night porter in the local hospice, with a cat as his companion. He uses his \u2018shine\u2019 to help his patients ease their pain in their last moments accompanied by a cat, giving him the name \u201cDoctor Sleep\u201d. The book then focuses on the meeting between Danny and Abra who communicate first via their shine and then meet in person. Abra then tells Danny about the true knot and their true intentions, and we embark on a journey of the triumph of good over evil. The characterization of the book is obviously very nicely done, though you may not necessarily find them in their shoes, you will surely relate to their dilemmas and predicaments. The climax of the book takes us to the same place where the Overlook once stood, which surely was a touch of nostalgia for the readers.
 
As King himself said in the author\u2019s note that sequels are never as good as the original and \u201cnothing can live up to the memory of a gold scare.\u201d, personally I feel the same. Doctor Sleep is very different from \u201cThe Shining\u201d, which does not necessarily mean it\u2019s bad, but surely after finishing this book, you will want to pick up \u201cThe Shining\u201d once again. To relive the horror, to relive the glory.

title: Book Review
description: Book Review : Artemis Fowl: The time paradox
body:
Name of the Book: - Artemis Fowl : The Time Paradox 
Author: - Eoin Colfer
Rating: - 4.7/5.0
Recommended: - Yes!!!
What do you do, when your own younger self is out for your blood?
Eoin Colfer shocks one and everyone in this journey of the young criminal mastermind known as Artemis fowl. He cries, he laughs, he tricks, he gets tricked and much more to boot.

When her mother gets diagnosed with a rare form of fairy disease that has a cure in a species whose last surviving member was \u2013 wait for it, sold by Artemis to a group of extremists for money, it is all on the shoulders of Holly Short and the older Artemis to stop the younger one from selling it.

While each and every book of the fowl series is fantastic in its own right, this one stands out the most, because hey, you get to compare the older Artemis with the younger version. And when even he says, \u201cWas I this ruthless?\u201d, you know it's not going to be your average cat and mouse chase; for both of them are essentially the one person known as Artemis Fowl the second.

The narrative is crisp and to the point, with the author never straying too much into the side stories, nor losing the sight of the end. It is a rollercoaster of all sorts, exactly what you would expect from an Artemis Fowl book.

The twists and turns in this one may not be for the first timers, but it sure will be a treat for the loyal fans of the series, as the criminal mastermind once again faces his old nemesis, the one who nearly had him killed in the second book, Opal Koboi.

How the little Koboi fits in all of this is what forms the crux of the story, and as a good antagonist should be, she is ruthless and calculative right down to the core.

So sit down tight for this epic right, for you have read many time travelling stories before this, but we can assure you that you will feel thoroughly satisfied when you will turn the final page.
Oh, and did we mention Mulch Diggums? Yes, he returns too.

title: Word Worth Millions - Forelsket
body:
WORD :- Forelsket

PART OF SPEECH :- Adjective

PRONUNCIATION - Fo-rel-sket

ORIGIN :- Norwegian

DEFINITION :- A euphoric feeling experienced when you start falling in love.

EXAMPLE :- 

On a misty and foggy night,
I want to see you in the moonlight.

I'm pretty sure you still glow like gold,
For there are still some feelings which are untold.

Unfortunately, I'm lost in a world you can't reach,
Just go at the window and you could find a glimpse of me.

Looking at the constellation of stars,
Just remember the beautiful bond of ours.

Amidst the stars, seeing how the sun loves the moon,
It feels like forelsket, remembering the days,
When we used to enjoy the melodious tune,
In the calm hours of June.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
\u201cCalcutta is so beautiful, wherever you place a camera, you get a vision\u201d. ___ Pradeep Sarkar
Standing tall, in a vast expanse of green, the sensational white marble beauty, Victoria Memorial claims its spot as one of the most majestic and splendid monuments of the nation. When in City of Joy, one should definitely pay a visit to this magnifique monument. This epitome of elegance embodies and reflects the brilliant Indo Saracenic architectural style, giving us a peek of the historic era. The central attraction to this grand structure is definitely the five tons, sixteen foot bronze \u2018Angel of Victory\u2019 mounted on ball bearing on the dome of the memorial. The building treasures excellent collections of paintings, literary works, textiles, weapons, noteworthy artifacts and other precious antiques. This location is also popular for holding grand exhibitions and events. In contrast with Kolkata\u2019s night sky, the beautiful light and sound show Son- et- Lumiere is a must watch for the visitors. Lastly, the Victoria Memorial Garden is an open Museum displaying the colossal statues and sculptures. A glorious model of Queen Victoria welcomes the tourists right through the entrance into the avenue. The garden is an easy destination for the morning walkers and perfect for casual strolls. Thus, this classic monument simply hits new heights of appeal with every visit, as one never has enough of exploring this gorgeous edifice.

title: Picture Thursday
body:
Majuli, Assam

Located on the pristine river Brahmaputra in Assam, Majuli is the world's largest inhabited river island. Majuli is a lush green environment-friendly, surrounded with verdant valleys, vibrant meadows, dense forests, and misty mountains, an indispensable natural landmark in the north-eastern state of India. Formed by the Brahmaputra river in the south and the Kherkutia Xuti, an anabranch of the Brahmaputra, joined by the Subansiri River in the north, Majuli island is accessible by ferries from the city of Jorhat. The island is about 300\u2013400 kilometers east from the state's largest city \u2014Guwahati. It was formed due to course changes by the river Brahmaputra and its tributaries, mainly the Lohit.

Majuli, which means, the land between two parallel rivers has a profuse and heterogeneous agrarian tradition. Making you feel at peace with nature, it is home to many migratory birds. Majuli had an area of 880 sq km in 1991 but due to soil erosion, it has now reduced to 340 sq km. Majuli has been the cultural capital of the Assamese civilization since the 16th century. Beyond the shadow of a doubt, this place is a rich blend of soothing natural splendour, zealous culture, and fascinating history. 

There are plenty of tourist places in Majuli Island to explore for travellers. Winter offers a very cool climate which would enable you to enjoy the natural vistas without much ado. One can spend some amazing time on this island visiting these alluring attractions. Among all the major attractions around the Majuli Island, exploring the Satras will definitely be a soul-enriching experience. Apart from these, you can opt to relax at Tengapania, where you will be amid nature and away from the hustle of city life. The locals here will welcome you open-heartedly. You can also spend a day with them and indulge in local village activities. Take part in making handmade products, such as pottery, tribal masks, etc., and take them back home as souvenirs.

title: Grammarism
body:
Pun is one of the most remarkable play of words which adds fun to the concerned speech. It's a witty, humorous way of stating something\u2014 usually a word or a phrase\u2014by conveying two meanings at the same time of the same word.

For instance, "I was wondering when the sun was going to rise, then it dawned on me." the word 'dawn' here conveys two meanings at the same time \u2014 the realisation, and the literal dawn of the sun. They are often used in headlines in newspapers and articles to make it look more catchy. For instance, TOI once covered an article regarding a leopard which got its head stuck in a pot. They titled it as "leopard hooked to pot, but not stoned." The very evident meanings of the word 'pot' can be interpreted quite easily. The implementation of puns in a sentence can be very tricky and may turn out to be very (p)ungraceful if not taken care of the usage.

title: Book Review
body:
Name of the book: Speak
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson
Rating: 4.2/5.0
Recommended: Absolutely!
\u201cWhen people don't Express themselves they die one piece at a time.\u201d
______ by Laurie Halse Anderson,
From Speak.
What would you do if you woke up to a facade every morning, knowing that there is absolutely nothing you can do about it? How would you ever express your emotions if you\u2019re void of your voice, if you\u2019re suddenly unable to Speak?
All of these start when Melinda Sordino, a student from freshman year busts down a summer-end party by calling cops, but can\u2019t explain her actions. Typical school culture follows up and affects Melinda\u2019s life , as students of Merryweather High start ignoring her in mass. Gradually she becomes grown of her own silence and stops talking altogether.
The concealed reality behind her silence is way more disturbing than anyone's standard perception. This story follows around Melinda on her journey to finding her voice of power again and focuses on how she uses art as an escape from the horrid of this hypocritical society.
This Laurie Halse Anderson novel takes a deep dig at the ironical, typical and hypocritical \u201chigh school culture\u201d and society in general. The realistic characters make it an easy read and the portrayal of the narrative makes it even more relatable and emotionally connecting. The story line deals with a sensitive issue of sexual assault which demands justice. The writer takes us through an insightful ride where we witness how our protagonist voices herself as well as harnesses the courage to represent many others alike who are still enduring the grimaces of it all.
It is one of the most expressive books in its own league, purely inspired by our author\u2019s own terrifying experience ____ a lesson on how to deal with post traumatic stress and fight back. A must read for the ones who want to explore and introspect a teen rape victim\u2019s soulful journey and learn from it.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
"People are trapped in history and history is trapped in them."  ~James Baldwin

Located around 60 km to the southwest of Kolkata, in the Mahishadal administration is the Mahishadal Rajbari, home to the Gargs of the Mahishadal Raj. It consists of two palaces, a courthouse, a ghat, a large Navratna temple among various other things. A property that was on the verge of decay is now being renovated and opened to visitors. An ideal place for the history buffs to explore, Mahishadal Rajbari is a place that oozes regal in every aspect.

The word Rajbari means \u201cKing\u2019s House\u201d. And it really is one, with the things from the era of the kings being preserved carefully inside the house, it is truly a bewitching sight. The broken piano, the raised bed, the humongous fans all look surreal and sometimes a bit scary too. If you are a fan of historical things or are just an explorer, we would suggest you to visit  Mahishadal Rajbari and give your inner explorer a satisfaction of having explored something exquisite.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
"Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow."
                                                              - Anita Desai

Situated at the foothills of Trikuta mountains, 42 km away from the city of Jammu is the little town of Katra. In addition to its exceptional scenic beauty, the place also serves as base camp for the pilgrims and tourists of Vaishno Devi.

Even though a small town, Katra is of high significance as it serves as the cave shrine of Vaishno Devi. For visiting the holy shrine, one has to register at Katra before starting the trek. A new ropeway system has recently been installed from Vaishno Devi to Bhairon Baba Mandir; which reduces and limits the journey to just three minutes, given that it can carry approximately eight hundred people per hour. Some of the other major tourist spot other than the topographical marvel of Katra itself are, Nau Devi cave temple, Baba Dhansar, Shivkhori and Jhajjar Kotli.

The city has thriving tourism as it has every basic facility to offer; ranging from abundance of hotels and restaurants to the engaging ' bazaar' (market area) stacked full of souvenirs, dry fruits, regional raiment, etc. It also has an efficient transport system and is well connected by roads, state highways and also railways. 

The overall tourism sector in the region offers a delightful experience that heal souls and proffer beauteous reminiscence on divine memories.
