title: Book Review
body:
Name of the book: Pachinko
Author:  Min Jin Lee
Genre:\u00a0Historical Fiction

\u201cYou are very brave, Noa. Much, much braver than me. Living every day in the presence of those who refuse to acknowledge your humanity takes great courage.\u201d  
Isak to Noa(in Pachinko.)

This novel from Lee is a captivating tale of a Korean family based in Japan. The plot is stringed out as a narrative of multiple character's lives in the same timeline. This story spans around a hundred years, in Korea at the beginning of the 20th century and goes on to end in Tokyo and Yokohama. Thus, this novel is a beautiful long read and touches a very personal string through the portrayals of the struggles of people in a foreign land.

A Korean woman called Sunja faces severe wrath of the society when she falls pregnant to a married man. The story follows up with Sunja's struggle for survival and her self discovery through this entire journey. However, things take a turn, when another man kindly offers her an escape from this situation by a proposition to move-in with him in Japan. But things do not get better, as even there she is exposed to social injustices and prejudices that presides for the by the Korean immigrants in Japan.
The story later proceeds to compare the norms and forms of these prejudices a generation apart as it further narrates the story of her sons. Only this time these young men find strength and courage to combat and overcome these obstacles.

Lee builds on the plot with relevant as well as some overlooked history of the huge Korean community present in Japan and are referred to as\u00a0zainichi, a pseudo slang term for these Korean immigrants. The piece portrays all human emotions very naturally and Shame and guilt are the underlying tones of most of the pages in this book. Thus anyone looking for some very gripping and beautifully melancholic historical fiction, this one is absolutely the right pick for you.

title: National Youth Day
body:
National Youth Day is celebrated every year on 12th January to commemorate the birthday of Swami Vivekananda.The main objective behind the celebration is to propagate the philosophy and the ideals of Swami Vivekananda for which he lived and worked.
National Youth Day is celebrated to create awareness among the youth, reminding them of their duties towards the society and the country. It is a day to educate people about their rights and responsibilities. The main objective behind this celebration is to motivate the youth to follow the ideals and principles of Swami Vivekananda so as to inspire them to give their maximum contribution towards building the future of our nation.
National Youth Day is celebrated throughout the country with great zeal and enthusiasm. Several functions are organized in schools and colleges across the country. Various conventions, seminars, and recitation events are organized throughout the country to inspire the Indian youth. Several competitions are organized outside the country as well to promote education, trust and awareness among the youths.

\u201cArise! Awake! and stop not until the goal is reached.\u201d
- Swami Vivekananda 

So on this National Youth Day let us all follow this principle of Swami Vivekananda  to give our best towards the development of our country and not stop contributing till our goal of making this country a fully developed nation comes true.
The HIT Times wishes you all a very happy National Youth Day.

title: Makar Sankranti
body:
Makar Sankranti is one of the religious festivals observed each year during the month of January. It is dedicated to the deity Surya, marking the first day of the sun's transit into Makara. It is celebrated in many parts of the Indian subcontinent with some regional variations. The festivities associated with Makar Sankranti are known by various names, such as Maghi by North Indian Hindus, Pedda Pandaga in Maharashtra and Western parts of India and Magh Bihu in Northeastern states. 

Makar Sankranti is recognized with social festivities such as colorful decorations, kite flying, bonfires, and feasts. On this occasion, many devotees take a holy dip in sacred rivers, especially the Ganga, the Yamuna, and the Godavari, while offering prayers to the Sun along with chanting hymns which is said to absolute past sins. A shared cultural practice found amongst Hindus of various parts of India is making sticky, bound sweets particularly from sesame and a sugar base such as jaggery. This festival signifies a period of socializing and families enjoying each other's company, and celebrating around bonfires. 

We, The HIT Times, wish every one of you a very Happy Makar Sankranti. May you soar high with success just like your kites this Makar Sankranti.

title: Army Day
body:
"If death strikes before I prove my blood, I swear I'll kill death." ~Captain Manoj Kumar Pandey ( PVC 1/11 Gorkha Rifles)
  
The term ' Indian Army' screams undoubtedly of all kinds of nationalistic emotions that resides in the heart of the 1.3 billion people inhabiting this country. Greatest and immortal are the souls who have sacrificed their mortality for the protection of our nation. World's 4th largest and powerful military that is our Indian Defence Forces have successfully operated in some of the toughest battlefields; and while at that, have always ensured us utmost safety. 

This one profession is no easy job as it requires supreme devotion for the country and the ability to adapt and combat each and every circumstantial change in life. Leaving out the comfort of family and home, a soldier has to endure and attune making 'life or death' decisions and act upon them. Once a soldier is always a soldier, in life and death; and their actions demand respect. 

As we all know, all heroes don't need capes. Selflessly and staunchly they serve today without any expectation of and from tomorrow. Living every moment surrounded by camouflaged perils and still not fearing neither caring for life takes superlative courage and boldness. Thus, someone once said, "Some goals are so worthy, it's glorious even to fail." 

To all such heroic and honorable brave warriors and survivors, The HIT Times acknowledges and salutes your efforts and wishes you a hearty and Happy Indian Army Day.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
The Konark Sun Temple 

The Konark Sun Temple is a 17th-century sculpture, located in the state of Odisha. It was originally built in the 13th century to resemble the gigantic chariot of the Lord Sun. It is a World Heritage Site and attracts thousands of tourists every year. 

The chariot had twelve ornamented wheels pulled by seven hours, only six of which stand today. The temple is now mostly in ruins and a collection of its sculptures is housed in the Sun Temple Museum, which is run by the Archeological Survey of India.

Even though the site is mostly in ruins, its exquisite sculpturing and designs remain unparalleled. The audience hall still stands and comprises majority of the ruins. However, the roof of the dance hall has fallen off. The alignment of the temple is along the East-West direction. The Sun Temple is one of the few spots of attraction in the town of Konark, along with the Chandrabagha beach.

title: Monday Hues
body:
Blissfully blessed and bound

by the divine demiurge,

the mortals thrive so sound,

in a steady sustained surge.

In such troubled ceaseless rush,

a moment is hard to spare.

Still in a briefly paused gush,

and the nature doting stare;

at the vivid scenic vision,

one can find the true treasure.

Creation in hued depiction,

gives the rover no closure.

Hidden in the natural cribs,

from rushing streams to a knoll,

live sublimely unique beings,

like the tiny Black Hooded Oriole.

title: Book Review: The Third Reich
body:
Name of the book- The Third Reich

Name of the author- Roberto Bolano

"Happy are those who own nothing." ~Roberto Bolano, The Third Reich

On a vacation with his girlfriend, Ingeborg, the German war games champion Udo Berger returns to a small town on the Costa Brava where he spent the summers of his childhood. Soon they meet another vacationing German couple, Charly and Hanna, who introduce them to a band of locals\u2014the Wolf, the Lamb, and El Quemado\u2014and to the darker side of life in a resort town.

In the beginning, the story of the book seems so simple that one can only wonder what the turning point will be. Udo, accompanied by his fiancee Ingeborg, is at a turning point in his life, he intends to devote himself fully to his passion, the wargames. Many characters come to disturb the life of the couple, including the boat rental that seems to live on the beach and will prove a formidable opponent on the plateau for Udo. Little by little, the relations between them will become more complex and the hero will be very lonely. Whether it's the Spaniards, Udo's opponent, the burnt man, the bosses of the hotel or the annoying another German couple on vacation, all the people who intervene in the life of the couple do it in a theatrical way. 

Late one night, Charly disappears without a trace, and Udo\u2019s well-ordered life is thrown into upheaval; while Ingeborg and Hanna return to their lives in Germany, he refuses to leave the hotel and keep searching for Charlie. Roberto Bolano juggles between reality and fantasy, the city seems to be only the scenery of the trap that closes on Udo. His relations with Germany, which are limited to brief telephone conversations with his best friend Conrad, tend to look a bit artificial. The simple holiday narrative goes from tanning chronicles to a man's fear for his life. The moist and agonizing atmosphere settles progressively well. The choice of the title of the novel that takes the name of the game disputed between the hero and the burnt suggests that the legacy of the second world war is at the heart of the novel. 

At his best Bolano somehow manages to create bizarrely ominous and scary scenarios out of apparently very little. This is another clever and compelling attack on toxic people struggling to accommodate them and the oblique means of different types of necessary war. The real genius of Bolano here is his managing to weave all kinds of large themes into a novel that can easily be read as a straight thriller. Written in 1989 and found among Roberto Bola\u00f1o\u2019s papers after his death, The Third Reich is a stunning exploration of memory and violence. Reading this quick, visceral novel, we see a world-class writer coming into his own.

title: Word Worth Millions - Verschlimmbessern
body:
Word: Verschlimmbessern(v)

Pronunciation: Vash-lim-base-ern

Origin: German

Meaning: To make something worse while trying to improve it

An unrehearsed play 
Is what life is,
There's limited time and plot 
With unending possibilities.

Sometimes it is hard to choose 
The right from wrong, 
The probabilities may lie unknown 
Even in the brightest morn.

We may crash, fail and 
Even verschlimmbessern our life, 
But that is not the dead end
If the heart still pumps with all its might.

Time flows with memories 
Carving the mark of experience;
The more tempered it is, 
The higher its expense.

title: Happy Republic Day!
body:
26th of January is celebrated as the Republic Day in India, to honour the date on which the Constitution of India came into effect.

After the country's independence, there was no permanent constitution; its laws were based on the modified colonial Government of India Act 1935. A draft constitution was prepared by the committee and submitted to the Constituent Assembly on 4 November 1947. After numerous consultations, deliberations and modifications, the Assembly signed the documents on 24th of January, 1947. Two days later, on 26th January, the Constitution came into effect throughout the nation.

The main Republic Day celebrations take place in the capital city of Delhi, in the presence of the President and other dignitaries, including the Prime Minister. Ceremonious parades take place on the Rajpath, as a tribute to India \u2013 its rich cultural heritage and unity. The whole country takes part in the celebration by hoisting flags, playing patriotic songs and arranging various functions, to honour the martyrs and heroes of the Indian freedom movements.

The HIT Times wishes everyone a Happy Republic Day, a day of remembrances and celebrations of the country.

title: Happy Saraswati Puja!
body:
Saraswati puja is celebrated on the 5th day of the \u2018Magh\u2019 or Vasant Ritu. Also known as \u2018Vasant Panchami\u2019, this auspicious day marks the beginning of spring season and end of winter. The day of the puja is as colourful as the season of spring, with yellow being the dominating colour, most women drape in a yellow saree mostly and the men too dress up in traditional clothes to offer puja to the goddess of knowledge, wisdom, music, art, and learning. Saraswati being the goddess of beauty as well is generally decorated with white and yellow flowers, which makes the whole festival more tranquil and peaceful. In many places this day is considered holy for reaping the first mustard crops of the season as well as to mark the beginning of a little one\u2019s education, that is, the young ones write their first words, preferably on a banana leaf. One of the reasons why the Vasant Panchami is chosen for this puja is, according to Hindu mythology, the goddess Saraswati was born on this day. Also, since she is a personification of creativeness, there is creative and holy energy associated with this day.

We believe if you were to ask someone, especially a student why this puja is so special and different than all the other ones, you might get a variety of answers but a mandatory visit to their school or college would be a given. The gaining of wisdom or knowledge may not be very apparent from the puja but the \u2018puspannjali\u2019 to the goddess at the wee hours of the morning in a sixteen yard or a kurta, followed by the \u2018bhog\u2019 and the meeting of old and new friends is very intricately woven with this festival of wisdom and knowledge. Team The HIT times wishes everyone a very happy Saraswati puja.

title: Martyrs Day
body:
As the sun illuminates this morning sky and pierces through the foggy ambiance, the Raj Ghat at Delhi immerses in floral coronals as the nation comes together to pay homage to the father of the nation- Mahatama Gandhi. It isn't a story anew. A ceremonial process that is being carried out since the past 72 years is witnessed by the Prime Minister, the President, and the Defense Minister who lay a wreath on the cremated statue at Raj Ghat while the Armed Forces personnel and Inter-services Contingent of the country give an honorable salute to the martyrs. Besides Gandhiji, the nation also pays homage to the brave warriors of our freedom struggle who without a reconsideration sacrificed themselves for the welfare and progress of the country. People around the country observe silence for 2 minutes in order to pray for the peace of the departed souls.

On 30th January 1948, Nathuram Godse murdered Mahatma Gandhi as a vengeance for the country's partition. If we dive deep into it, we can find instances in the form of records, archives, and political statements. Gandhiji was a man who believed in the principles of Non-Violence and Satyagraha. Being an epitome of peace and moral principles people abided by him and believed that his motives and principles can gain them independence. Today, while we commemorate the assassination of Gandhiji, let's recall his ethical principles and salute to our brave fighters for presenting us to live in an independent country without the banners or chains of slavery.

title: TechBytes - RIP PEPPER, Fired once and for all
body:
July this year saw Japanese MNC SoftBank Group Corp. announcing that they were putting the production of their unofficial mascot PEPPER, the humanoid AI robot on hold. First announced in 2014, PEPPER boasted technologies that enabled it to hold conversations and act on the information gained, provide service to customers, and of course, weave through the hordes effectively. Capable of voice modulation and even face recognition, PEPPER was thought to be a massive leap in the field of humanoid AI.

But all came crashing down when it got deployed in the workforce. After failing to match the employer\u2019s expectations, it was fired from almost all the places it was sent to, leading to an eventual halt on the units themselves.

First hired by NISSEI ECO CO. for chanting sutras or scriptures to mourners at funerals, the bot broke down in the test run, raising doubts in the employers about its actual efficiency, leading to its eventual termination of the contract. But this was just the start of mayhem.

Fired soon after being installed in Scottish grocery chain Margiotta\u2019s flagship Edinburgh store,as it redirected every customer towards the alcohol section whenever they inquired about any item.\u00a0

It came as no surprise when it was fired from a Japanese Nursing home organization where it had been installed to be with residents but instead started taking too many \u201cimpromptu breaks.\u201d Just a question \u2013 was it programmed to learn the worst habits first?\u00a0\u00a0
Most recently, it was shown the door when it was cheering for the baseball team at the SoftBank Hawks. The fans claimed that it acted like a creep and it looked more like a military parade in North Korea or China.

There are many more complaints against the social bot being impolite to the customer, drowning itself in the pool, and in the end, as usual, getting fired!!

Robotics expert Professor Noel Sharkey said in one of his interviews, \u201cPepper did a lot to harm genuine robotics research by often giving a false impression of a bright cognitive being that could hold conversations.\u201d\u00a0

The company released an official statement confirming that SoftBank Robotics was restructuring and Pepper production has been halted and he might come back in the future if needed.

title: LHAASO: The Large High Altitude Air Shower Observatory
body:
Ever since the discovery of the telescope in the early 17th century, humanity has been looking towards the skies with a baby\u2019s eyes.
Thus, the LHAASO provides one such methodology that uses small instruments spread over a large area to gather a huge amount of information about cosmic rays.
Ever since their discovery in 1912, cosmic rays have been a deep mystery, mostly because of their unknown origins. Early attempts used telescopes in orbit to detect these rays, but they were not much successful.
Cosmic rays travel at the speed of light and consist of protons and atomic nuclei, which upon interaction with our atmosphere produce a shower of secondary particles. The same effect is seen in the case of gamma rays too.
So to trace back to the origin of these mysterious rays, scientists observe and study the showers carefully. And that is where LHAASO comes in.
Spread over a total area of 360 acres, at a height of 4410 meters above sea level, LHAASO houses three underground observation pools containing around 12 telescopes and multiple Cherenkov radiation detectors. It first started observations in 2019, but recently it discovered something very amazing.
Just a few months ago, scientists observed Peta electronvolt photons or PeV Photons, which means photons that have been accelerated in a particle accelerator such that it gained an energy equivalent to accelerate an electron with an electric potential of 0.8 million billion electronvolts, in simple terms, it\u2019s way too much energy. The source was initially considered to be somewhere in the Crab nebula, but uncertain.
Right after its almost complete installation, LHASSO found almost 12 possible PeV accelerators in the Milky Way, a groundbreaking discovery in the field of Gamma astronomy.
LHAASO has just begun its journey and it surely has a lot more in store for us in the times about to come.

title: Viral Corner
body:
Existing parallely with the Olympic Games, the Paralympics also comes once in every four years. It is a platform where disabled athletes showcase their talents and vie for their shot at  the Olympic glory. This year's Tokyo Paralympics has seen some commendable performances from Indian athletes with their medal haul touching double figures for the first time in the history of India at the Paralympics in Tokyo.

Monday 30th August will be written  in golden letters in the pages of sports history as India snagged five medals in a single day, two golds, two silver and one bronze for which it leapfrogged to 26th position in the medal table. Shooter Avani Lekhara became the first woman to bag a gold medal at the Paralympics. Lekhara had previously sustained spinal cord injuries in a car accident in 2012 but her injury could not subdue the embers of her fighting spirit as she shot a world record equalling total of 249.6 in the final setting a new Paralympic record. "I can't describe this feeling. I'm feeling like I'm on top of the world. It's unexplainable," Lekhara said later, giddy with excitement. The second gold of the day was won by Sumit Antil setting a new world record thrice in one night for the F64 class gold. The 23-year-old hailing from Sonepat in Haryana was involved in a motorbike accident in 2015 where he had tragically lost his left leg below the knee. Despite this setback, he bettered his previous world record of 62.88m effectively five times on the day. His series of throws read: 66.95, 68.08, 65.27, 66.71, 68.55. The silver medals of the day came to the way of veteran Devandra Jhajharia(javelin) and youngster Yogesh Kathuniya(discus) with Sundar Singh Gurjar (javelin) securing a bronze. 

India's winning streak was not done yet as three more medals were secured on the following day-one bronze in shooting by Singhraj Adhana and two in the high jump by defending champion Mariyappan Thangavelu(silver) and Sharad Kumar(bronze).  

Friday 3rd September was nothing short of extraordinary as three more medals paved it's path to India. Avani not satisfied with her gold medal, came out with guns blazing when she claimed a bronze medal at the ongoing Paralympic games. The trailblazer went on to become the first Indian woman to win two Paralympic medals. Praveen Kumar's leap over all odds fetched him a silver medal in the men's high jump T64/T44 event while Harvinder Singh channeled all his steel and grit to snag the first-ever archery bronze medal in a thrilling shoot-off against Kim Min Su of Korea. The following day Indian shooters Manish Narwal and Singhraj Adhana clinched the gold and silver medal respectively in the P4- Mixed 50m Pistol SH 1 final at Asaka Shooting Range.

 The hunt is still on as the 19 year old Avani Lekhara has her gun trained on the next target- the mixed 50m rifle prone SH1 event while Pramod Bhagat and Palak Kohli qualified for the para badminton mixed doubles finals.

title: A fresher's expectations from Haldia Mela:

Celebs, dance, concerts, and music. Sounds fun, no? As if that wasn\u2019t enough, Honey Singh, Badshah are all coming this time. Judging by the roster, we are expecting a harmony between the funky beats, soulful ballads, and hard-hitting raps. Expectations from the mela is at an all-time high, and why not? It isn\u2019t every day that you get to see the stars up close and attend their live concerts for free (unless you want a VVIP pass, which is well, expensive to pay for). A much-needed respite it is, and one thing is for sure, the students will be enjoying it to the fullest.

And it is not just about the concerts, the various food stalls which will have anything ranging from chai to desserts will be a heaven for the foodies and that too at a nominal price. We expect the food to be top-notch. And it is not just about the food, as the name \u201cHaldia Mela\u201d suggests, it will have all the fun elements a fair has, or we expect it has. The various rides which are a thrill to run off to and the mesmerizing smell of brewing tea from the \u201cChai Adda\u201d are surely going to keep everyone up on their toes.

All in all, we are expecting a wholesome entertainment from the Haldia Mela which we will remember for the rest of our lives.

title: Joystick Junkies - Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Future Soldier
body:
Name of the game: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Future Soldier
 
 
Can you run it?
  
 No requirement seems high when you are head over heels for a game. This is one of those that doesn\u2019t ask for much but will certainly reel you in head over heels once you get started.

The minimum recommended requirements are:
\u2022 OS: Windows Vista (SP2) / Windows 7 (SP1) or Windows 8/8.1.
\u2022 Processor: 3.0 GHz Intel Pentium D or 2.2 GHz AMD Athlon X2 4400+
\u2022 Graphics 512 MB DirectX compliant card with Shader Model 4.0 based on Nvidia GeForce   8600 GTS/AMD Radeon HD 4650 
\u2022 Sound: DirectX 11 compliant sound card with Latest Drivers
\u2022 System Memory: 2 GB RAM
\u2022 Storage: 25 GB Hard drive space



Synopsis:

Ghosts don\u2019t exist, and yet every now and then someone spots one, not their existence, just the mysterious events that are left in their trails. 
Survive in the shadows with this crazy tactical shooter experience, sometimes passing up like a cat and at others roaring like a lion, all inside Tom Clancy\u2019s Ghost Recon: Future Soldier. 


Gameplay analysis:

The game\u2019s perfection, right from the terrain and vehicles to civilians and obstacles placed throughout. The objectives assigned are straight that need to be completed by the player mostly as a ghost recon squad member.
With the whole squad assisting, the player can use a drone and the sync shot, timed multi-kill by the whole squad.
The gear and equipment are exactly as the name suggests, all in good future; the best addition being the stealth suit, a perfect partner for a ghost. The fun part is, you are not at the pinnacle in tech, even the enemy black ops have gear just as good as yours.


Story Analysis:

A squad of soldiers is martyred on the field and the culprits are unknown ghosts. And so to chase down ghosts, the ghost squad jumps in. After every step of their success, a bigger fish jumps out of the tank. And so the hunt continues. 
The story is centered around the group called Raven\u2019s Rock, who are trying to gain dominance and become the greatest superpower in the world and the ghosts must move fast to stop this insanity before it destroys everything.
 
 

TL;DR:

You think you can handle a tactical shooter; then this is the right test for your skillset, for you can\u2019t miss because the enemy won\u2019t, and you would be at the last checkpoint even before you know it.
The guns are good and the gear crazy, all you need is a little insanity with the controls and you would be the boss.

title: Viral Corner
body:
The morning of 26th January brought a devastating news to the world of NBA legend, Kobe Bryant's death in an aeroplane crash. Kobe, still being one of the best in the league and lead scorer, this news was an absolute shocker to the basketball lovers. It wasn't just him, the Sikorsky S-76 had a total of nine people on board. Kobe, his 13-year-old daughter, and an emerging basketball sensation, Gianna, ; her 13-year-old teammates Alyssa Altobelli and Payton Chester; their parents Keri and John Altobelli, Sarah Chester; basketball assistant coach Christina Mauser and pilot Ara Zobayan; all suffered the same appalling fate.

The helicopter crashed and caught fire in Calabasas, California, near the intersection of Las Virgenes Road and Willow Glen Street at 9:47 a.m. (17:47 UTC). The crash occurred on a hillside behind the headquarters of the Las Virgenes Municipal Water District. The primary speculation for the cause of this accident are the bad weather conditions and extreme fogginess. However, the case is still under thorough investigation.

Millions mourned in the memory of the champion and the other victims. On 31st Jan the Lakers, Kobe's team, honored him in a pregame ceremony by celebrating his jersey and a speech from LeBron James himself.

This case also brought to light that how uncertain life is and how important it is to cherish every moment without holding back; how essential it is to let your loved ones know how much they mean to you before you lose the last chance to. Life is surely beautiful but also very unpredictable. It is always a blessing to safely make it to home; something which Kobe couldn't. In parting words, we all deeply mourn the loss of such beautiful people and pray for his and the victim's family.

Pic Source: The Internet

title: HALCYON DAYS
body:
Vivid vastness veiling the realm,
shallow voices at times surrender.
Forlorn cries in midnight dream,
where all impassive souls wander.

Lurking strangers down the alley,
potrays no trace of warmth.
Reminiscence of golden glory,
where knights in armor swarm.

Still when passing by the land,
their restless hearts echoe
the sound of soulful sirens and victorious horns that blew.

The sunrise so magnifique,
like a dauntless rising deity
Lushy meadows in the creak,
their anthem screamed unity.

One thousand times they left
it all to win a million hearts.
Still In the end they were all cleft;
got pinned down by the darts.

Lastly when heading to their nest,
by the bridge where the rivet lays;
they recollect of the best of best,
their winsome halcyon days.

Pic Credit: Saransh Neerad
ME Batch(2014-2018)

title: Rose Day
body:
The week that makes all the singles around the world wish the world goes all boom has started, with the first day of this week-long torture being the "Rose Day". As the name suggests, the couples give roses to each other. It may sound exciting, but it is not, while giving roses itself isnt that much of an issue but, the people have went that extra mile to actually categorize the roses. The red one means "lovers" while the yellow/white one means "friends".

So what is the rose day about? Is it about showing affection? NOPE, it is all a scheme by flower shops to sell more flowers. Whats more, they keep more yellow roses than the red ones to make them feel rare to buy. And why rose? Why not lotus? Or jasmine?

Well, the aforementioned question is even more of a mystery than the Bermuda Triangle. So happy rose day, everyone, and make sure to not mix both the red and white/yellow roses together in a bouquet. Rather than making your significant other happy, it'll make them confused which can ultimately lead to a very exhilirating situation with a sad bollywood number playing in background. Keep safe and we hope you last (well, atleast your pocket does) until the valentine's day.

body: Funny Friday

title: Propose Day
body:
It all starts with a single look electrifying your mind and stiffening your body. You start to think about them, you talk to them, the friendship blooms, your feelings grow; and then you confess.

And then you wake up from this sweet dream of yours. Welcome to the second day of the valentine\u2019s week i.e. the \u201cpropose day\u201d. Much like all the days that mean the exact same as they sound, this day is all about proposing your love interest, or at least trying to. Remember what yesterday was? Yes, the rose day, so you gave the rose, heightened your crush\u2019s hopes of being proposed and now you are here pondering on how to propose him/her. So, what is it about the act of proposing that the millennials went that extra mile to dedicate an entire day to this action of proposing? Well, the act of proposing in itself is an action that requires a lot of guts, and it isn\u2019t UPSC exams that you will get another chance the next year. So plan it all out as if you are going to raid the Area 51, lest you want to suffer the same fate as the hero we see in every third rom-com.

Best luck to all out there who want to propose their crushes today, we hope you actually get the confidence to propose after that long planned out day that can even put the date plans of Leonard Leakey Hofstadter to shame. And don\u2019t stammer, go in like a boss and propose like the world is going to end the next moment. Then surrender yourself to the will of God (or to the will of the one you proposed to) and hope for the best.

title: Viral Corner
body:
"A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies" ~George R.R. Martin

The most loved time of the year for all book lovers is here. Saltlake Central Park is all decked up to experience yet another year, the 44th Kolkata International Bookfair. The theme country for this year is Russia. International Kolkata Book Fair initially began in 1976 with only 34 publishers. Eventually, it started to grow. Currently, the fair gets more than 2.5 million footfall every year. Likewise, it became an integral part of Kolkata and its culture. Many youngsters also visit the fair. People not only love to hop every stall, purchase books of their favorite author but also like to enjoy foods. Therefore many publishers prefer to release their books at the Book Fair.

Almost every book-stall will give a minimum 10% discount. Although, if you are familiar with college street, you may think to have a better discount there. Partially true, because some books either will not be available in college street soon or never. Similarly, magazines like Hangla and others give a very lucrative deal, you just can\u2019t miss.
So hurry up get your gang and visit the KIBF from 29th January to 9the February 2020 anytime between 12 PM till 8 PM.

title: Chocolate Day!
body:
So you've given roses and even proposed. What's next? Well, it is something that lifts up the mood of everybody, and no, its not a clown show, it is chocolates. The absolute bliss for the ones who get it, and an absolute nightmare for the pocket of the one who buys it.

We don't think that we need to even describe what chocolate day is, of course, it is the day where people give chocolates to one another. But here is the catch; the chocolates are actually divided into two categories, one being the "friendship chocolate" and the other being the "lover's chocolate". So if you get a chocolate, don't get too hyped about it, maybe its just the friendship chocolate, and nothing else. And why did people even bring friendship into this seven-day long kumbh mela of lovers? Maybe they took "pyaar dosti hai" to heart, who knows.

Speaking about chocolates, the price at which they are sold will really make you wonder if they are made in a gold cauldron or something like that because a bar will cost you anything between 200 to 2000, which is sure to make your monthly budget go up in flames, John Wick style.

So good luck to you (your pocket, more specifically) and we hope your chocolate is a lovers one and it finds its perfect owner.

The match began at sharp 2 p.m. and the ECE department won the toss and elected to field first. As the fielding team and the batsmen took their respective positions on the field the crowd began to cheer and didn't stopped until the end of the match.Batting first, the EE department got off to a very slow start losing early wickets, all praise to the ECE department bowlers who did a very disciplined bowling. After the six overs of the first innings the match was looking one sided but the EE department Batsmen held their nerves and batted wisely and somehow took their team to a defendable total of 78 runs at the loss of 8 wickets in 12 overs but that was not enough as the ECE department batted brilliantly and made 79 runs at the loss of only 3 wickets with 3 overs to spare and won the match comfortably. title: Teddy Day!
body:
The chocolate day is gone; now you are thinking of getting some breathing space but NO. Another one of the \u201cgift giving days\u201d are here, and this time, it is not going to be easy on you or your pocket.

Welcome the \u201cTeddy Day\u201d, the day which, we think, should go down in the history as the \u201cmass extermination of pockets\u201d day. You can buy a Lamborghini if you put enough hard work. BUT, finding a teddy which exactly suits the tastes of your other half is not practically attainable. There isn\u2019t any reason, it simply is impossible. Imagine the love child of inception and interstellar, it is that kind of impossible. They will, most certainly, find a problem with the teddy and if all is okay then the best kind of problem is that \u201cthis does not feel right\u201d. Even Einstein wouldn\u2019t have any idea to which teddy feels right, what will us mere mortals do then? Imagine this, you spend hours to find a good-looking teddy, gift wrap it, then give it to the person it is intended for. You expect a complement, right? But all you see is a face contorted with confusion. And it is then decided that you are a worthless and a useless person who can\u2019t even buy a right teddy.

Just find the person who started this, tie a stone to the body and throw it in the Dead Sea. Rose day is okay. We can even tolerate the chocolate day. But teddy day? TEDDY DAY? About 20,000 teddies get sold everyday, and this quadruples on the teddy day. May god rest the poor souls who bought teddies in peace.
The HIT Times wishes you a happy teddy day, hoping that you found the right teddy to woo your valentine and didn\u2019t get exhausted to the core so much that you actually have to get motivated to get up and gift the teddy you spent so much time and energy buying gets to it\u2019s rightful owner without any hitches.

title: Parallelism
body:
\u201cThe river is one of my favourite metaphors, the symbol of the great flow of Life Itself. The river begins at Source, and returns to Source, unerringly. This happens every single time, without exception. We are no different.\u201d ~Jeffrey R. Anderson

The parallelism between the journey of the river and the journey of life is simply mind-boggling. At the very basic level, we can see how both river and life originate from seemingly nothing but goes onto become what it is, \u2018life\u2019. Since the very beginning of life, life and river or more specifically water were closely dependent. History stood witness of the budding of human settlements on the banks of rivers and how they blossomed into civilisations. Be it Harappa- Mohenjo Daro or the Egyptian civilisation, all were completely dependent on the river it settled around. The river meanders through curves and turns but never stops, no matter how big of a rock(obstacle) comes in its path. It is true for life as well, life always goes on, never stops, yes slows down but never stops. The flow might get disrupted but never stops. The final destination of both is similar as well, the river flows down the terrain to join the ocean and as for life, a life of an individual starts for oneself but in the end, all lives in this world works for the betterment of mankind, so the life of an individual is a river and they join together to form an ocean.

The Ecclesiastes 1:7 from The Holy Bible reads "All streams run to the sea, but the sea is not full; to the place where the streams flow, there they flow again." That is to say that, life on earth is a never-ending cycle, one life may wither away but a new one blooms, just like how one river emptying into the sea does not make it full. Everything is interwoven into a much grander structure, the cycle of life and rivers are all but one.

Pic Credit: Soumyadeep Manna
(19/ECE/32)

The president of the United States of America visited India on his maiden Indian trip from February 24 to February 25. He was accompanied by first lady Melania Trump, daughter Ivanka Trump, son-in-law Jared Kushner and the most important delegates of his administration, including national security advisor Robert O'Brien. 

During his stay, he first visited Ahmedabad where he inaugurated the Mautera stadium, the largest cricket stadium in the world and then went on to address the massive rally there itself. He further went to Agra where he visited the Taj Mahal and then to New Delhi where he held official meetings.
During the visit, Trump addressed several Indian CEO's where he spoke about various trade opportunities for Indians in America. In the meeting he also spoke about the possible strategic business partnerships that the two countries might have in store. He also finalised the defence deals worth $3 billion between the two countries under which 30 military helicopters will be procured from two American defence makers for the Indian armed forces thus finalising a very significant defense partnership before finally leaving for the USA on Tuesday.

title: Book Review: The Bell Jar
body:
Name of the book- The Bell Jar
Author- Sylvia Plath.
Rating- 4.6/5.0
Recommended- Absolutely.
Warning- Deals with mental health issues and can be triggering.

\u201cTo the person in the bell jar, blank and stopped as a dead baby, the world itself is a bad dream.\u201d
~Esther Greenwood (from \u2018The Bell Jar\u2019)

In a world infested of typical social norms, Esther Greenwood is an exception. Set in a backdrop of New York's Life in the 1960s, 'The Bell Jar' by Plath explores various aspects of a working woman; inclusive of dreams, expectations, reality of living, sexuality, mental health and materialistic approach to name a few. This novel is a semi-autobiographical, with a very parallel portrayal of Plath's own life. She committed suicide a month after its first UK publication.

With mental health being one of the most important themes in tow, this book was way ahead of its own generation. Throughout the novel, Esther tries to find out a way to a settling satisfaction in her life, which she time and again fails to achieve. This is a story of a young woman struggling with feelings of alienation and acceptance. Plath refers to these feelings being trapped inside a bell jar.

Even though the plot development is pretty dense, Plath's humoristic way of narration makes it an easy read. The book is full of emotions, conflicts, traumas and character development. Plath delivered a powerful blow to the society on how much it affects an individual in general, on an everyday basis and how tensed up things can get if not treated with care. The book has no dramatic exaggeration and is very relatable on both ends. So, for everyone who has questioned their conflicted inner entity at some point, 'The Bell Jar' is a must-read.

title: Mahashivratri
body:
#MahaShivratri
\u0928\u093e\u0917\u0947\u0928\u094d\u0926\u094d\u0930\u0939\u093e\u0930\u093e\u092f \u0924\u094d\u0930\u093f\u0932\u094b\u091a\u0928\u093e\u092f
\u092d\u0938\u094d\u092e\u093e\u0919\u094d\u0917\u0930\u093e\u0917\u093e\u092f \u092e\u0939\u0947\u0936\u094d\u0935\u0930\u093e\u092f
\u0928\u093f\u0924\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f-\u0936\u0941\u0926\u094d\u0927\u093e\u092f \u0926\u093f\u0917\u092e\u094d\u092c\u0930\u093e\u092f
\u0924\u0938\u094d\u092e\u0948 \u0915\u0930\u093e\u092f \u0928\u092e\u0903 \u0936\u093f\u0935\u093e\u092f

Born from the fire with flames flowing through the veins, donned in smearing and sacred ashes with a garland of cobra around his neck, with the moon as his crown and the holy Ganges emerging through his matted hairs, the immortal meluha sits atop the Kailash and watches his devotees preparing for the festival of Maha Shivratri. There are a lot many speculations behind the auspicious occasion of Shivratri. Some believe that on this day Lord Shiva had union with Parvati while others hypothecate the drinking of poison by Shiva which appeared during the churning of the ocean as a reason to celebrate Shivratri. All we can do is believe in the instances described in Vedas.

 Shiva is an embodiment of sacrifice filled with peace whose name echoes around the horizon. He is said to be the chaos and is often considered to eradicate darkness. His omniscience makes him the conqueror of death. He is said to be the destroyer of the universe and may shower havoc upon earth and heaven when he opens his third eye. 

On this occasion of Shivratri let us extol his virtues and celebrate his cosmic triumphs. Salutations to the lord with the trident as his possession, to the lord who is eternal and divine. Salutations to Lord Shiva, the 'Pashupati', the 'Mahadev', the one above all. May this Shivratri enlighten you all with good health, fortune, courage to fight evil and strive to lift ourselves to new heights.

title: Grammarism
body:
With the concept of global citizenship, comes the need to focus on the basics of the language English; as it is the most broadly spoken language worldwide. Thus strengthening the grammatical aspects of the language is the arena one should strive for. Some minute grammatical errors might be a deal breaker in a conversation. So today we bring you a little piece of advice on the usage of 'into' and 'in to' in the field of application.

As undistinguishable as it sounds, just that one space makes all the difference. For starters, Into\u00a0is a\u00a0preposition; whereas In and To can both exist\u00a0by themselves and can be used as preposition or adverb as required. 

Into: In literal sense the word indicates direction. It's an action word and defines a particular movement. 

In to: In this case, the 'In' defines action and the 'to' depicts the objective for the action.

The following examples might help to simplify the terms:
\u2022 She walked into the police station.
\u2022 She turned the robber in to the police authority.

Hopefully, today's tip helps you guys a little more in avoiding those grammar police out there. Stay tuned for more of these.

title: Book Review
description: Book Review: The Giver of Stars
body:
Name of the book: The Giver of Stars
Author: Jojo Moyes
Rating: 4.8/5.0
Recommended: An absolute yes

\u201cA certain kind of man looked at God\u2019s own land, she thought, as she drew closer, and instead of beauty 
and wonder, all he saw was dollar signs.\u201d

 Jojo Moyes (from \u2018 The Giver of Stars.\u2019)

Claimed as one of her best works, this historical novel from Moyes has a very edgy take on societal standards and gender roles, based on the true story of the Pack Horse Library initiative. This was a Works Progress Administration project that ran from 1935 to 1943 which involved women into bookmobiles. As thrilling as the concept sounds, given the era, it was extremely difficult for any woman to overstep the boundaries of norms set by the typical society.

The storyline portrays the life of our protagonist Alice, who gets tired of the small town stifling life, her marriage and life in general and decides to join the Pack Horse Library program under Margery O\u2019Hare, who acts as a catalyst in liberating her free spirited self. Along with the other three women, these two embark on delivering books and literacy around the Eastern Kentucky's hills. The pages take you through the adventures and adversities they face.

Moyes successfully captures the depression era and delivers a very subtle transition of values in most of the social fields, delivering a 
meaning to feminism and stigmatized fields as marriage, race, and sex. All in all, this work of Jojo Moyes celebrates knowledge, learning, reading, female friendship, advancement of social standards and most importantly the triumphant love. For anyone who wants to enjoy a calm and captivating read about the tale of the traveling librarians in the beautiful rural Kentucky hills on a backdrop of the 1930s, this one's for you.

title: Word Worth Millions - Waldeinsamkeit
body:
Word: Waldeinsamkeit
Origin: German
Pronunciation: VAHYD-AHYN-ZAHM-KAHYT
Definition:  The feeling of being alone in the woods. In literal translation it refers to loneliness or solitude.

Usage:
In the rat race of success,
She longed for solitude.
After all the bullying she faced during her childhood,
Human race scared her to death.
But the misfortune of being born as a human had it\u2019s consequences.
She had to face human beings at every turning of her life.
So, she escaped to the forests,
Waldeinsamkeit soothed her nerves,
It gave the strength to face the harsh realities of life.
Spending a few days in the woods,
She retrieved the self-confidence that she would need till she returned back to the woods again.

title: Picture Thursday
body:
Located in between the snow-capped slopes of two hills, Manali is one of the most popular hill stations in the country. With mesmerizing views, lush green forests, vibrant flowers, gushing blue streams and a persistent fragrance of pines and other trees, Manali has been endowed with extraordinary scenic beauty. From museums to temples, from tiny villages to bustling upscale streets, river adventures to trekking trails, Manali has every reason to be an ideal tourist magnet.

Often known as the lover's paradise, it is a beautiful township known for its cold climate and snow-capped mountains. It is a classic blend of peace and tranquility which makes it a heaven for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts, who want to get off the main tourist trails and experience nature up close. 

Manali is an ideal tourist destination for couples and is a must visit place for all adventurers, as the glacial water of River Beas after rushing down the slopes of Rohtang Pass allows adventure sport activities of rowing, white water rafting and river crossing as it meanders through the valley from Manali to Kullu. While the other must visit places including Solang Nullah, Hidimba Devi Temple, Brighu lake, The manali Gompa and Nehru Kund. 

If you have ever imagined of sitting by the gushing water of a snow-fed stream, or waking up to a glorious sunrise with breathtaking views to soak in, Manali is the place to be.

title: Viral Corner
body:
As if the world didn't already have enough problem of its own, COVID 19 is the most recent addition to it all. Needless to point out that it already has made its way to India and we have a few crucial cases at hand. Starting from the newspapers, television channels to caller tune advertisements, the Coronavirus warning issues are being sent out to the people in every possible form.

The new coronavirus, now known as Covid-19, first encountered in Wuhan, China, December 2019 has affected over 93,000 people in over 80 countries around the globe, causing over 3,000 deaths.  The worst part is that we don\u2019t yet know how dangerous Covid-19 is, and we won\u2019t until more data comes in. Another probable issue is that we don't know how contagious Covid-19 is. Unlike flu, there is no vaccine for the new coronavirus. And people with weak immunity are very prone to be a victim to this disease. The mortality rate is estimated to be around 2% till now. The WHO hasn't still referred to this as a pandemic and at least that's a relief. 

The symptoms of this virus is simply pneumonic in nature. Those who have already succumbed to the situation have reportedly suffered from coughs, fever and breathing difficulties. In extreme cases there were organ failure. As it is viral pneumonia, antibiotics are of no use and the antiviral drugs we have against flu won't work. Immunity plays a great role for survival in this case. Many of those who have died were already in poor health.

Some of the basic measures one can take to stay unharmed includes washing hands, wearing masks, getting flu vaccines, maintaining personal hygiene and eating less under unhygienic surroundings. The origin of this virus is from animal hosts and thus human to human transmission is very possible. Thus, until the situation gets under control and we have a proper medical solution, all we can do is play safe. With global spread of this viral menace, we just hope that all of us make it out safe and sound, in best of our health.

title: Grammarism
body:
As a writer, you don't necessarily have to stop playing with words, because that obviously drains out the fun out of your piece. But the wrong application of words or poor grammar just points out that you were plain lazy and inattentive while writing; which is very disrespectful to the reader. Hence developing a correct sense of word usage is very important to acquire. For today's segment, we are going to discuss a little about the non-interchangeable aspect of the two very confusing words, 'further' and 'farther.'

Yes, just the 'u' and 'a' makes all the difference. Both apply in the field of describing distance. But in a literal sense, 'farther' deals with the physical distance i.e distances that can be measured. Whereas, 'further' refers to figurative distance and strictly in a non-physical aspect. Sometimes it also defines the higher degree of something. For example, it can replace the term 'moreover' in some cases.

Examples:
\u2022 He walked farther than the last time.
\u2022 He has no further queries regarding that.

Hopefully, you guys found today's article useful. Stay tuned for more of the same.

title: Word Worth Million
body:
Word: Sturmfrei
Origin: German
Pronunciation: St-urm-frai
Etymology: Sturm + Frei
Literal Meaning: Storm Free
Actual Meaning: The situation where one has the house/ flat all to himself, due to absence of parents, flatmates or housemates.

Today's pick of word is sure to bring sheer joy to the teenagers and frown lines to all the parents out there. The word 'Sturmfrei' easily translates to the phrase 'storm free', which might make us think of strong winds and dark weather. But in application, the word refers to something completely different from its literal translation. 

In reality, when parents leave their kid alone at home for a trip on any purpose, the kid has sturmfrei. As disclosed before, this is a very common situation and a little worrisome one for parents as well. In most of the cases, the house transforms into the venue for a grand house party and at times, that escalates real quick (and not in a good way.) So next time when you actually have a sturmfrei, make sure you keep things grounded i.e in place (winks).

Example:
Mum dad out for short vacay;
the house now on sturmfrei.
Party's on, loud songs on play;
they all up for night and day.

title: Word Worth Million - Petrichor
body:
Petrichor
Pronunciation: PET-ri-kuhr
Origin: Greek

Meaning: The mild and pleasant smell or scent of earth associated with the first rain after a dry spell.

Usage:

I love watching the raindrops braiding my windowpane
Like beautiful pearls, plucked from the necklace  
Of the charming Audrey Hepburn
They glitter and shine brightly 
To illuminate the dark expanse of my room.

The rain croons a song 
In its heavenly voice
As the warm notes flowed through my weary soul
It filled the cracks and smoothed over the creases 
Making me feel whole again
Like I was born anew.

Yearning for the sweet rain from heaven's door
The brittle dry earth longs to embrace her long-lost lover
And get lost in her soothing aroma of Petrichor.
Its honeyed greeting bewitches me
Ensnaring my soul with its magical touch
A welcoming sign that spring is nigh there.

title: Book Review
body:
Name of the Book: - The Chaos
Author: - Rachel Ward
Rating: - 4.1/5.0
Recommended: - Yes!!!
How do you warn people, when most of them think you're just crazy?
Adam is a teenager who sees the death of people in their eyes when he looks at them. What would he do when most of the people he sees around have the same day of death?
The Chaos is Rachel Ward\u2019s sequel to the novel \u201cNUMBERS\u201d which told the story of Adam\u2019s mother, Jem who had this ability to see people\u2019s death dates (referred to as numbers in the series). Jem died, but his son was riddled with the same ability. What severely horrifies him that the people around him all have the same date of death and so, he sets out to save them.
The narrative is quite unique as it tells the story from the protagonist\u2019s point of view and this time around, there are 2 protagonists \u2013 Adam (Jem\u2019s son) and Sarah (a girl Adam met in the metropolitan London who is terrified of him from their first meeting). The story is paced briskly and the narrative style of telling the story from 2 viewpoints really makes it feel closer to both the leads.
What makes this novel worth a read is that Adam and Sarah are by no means your traditional heroes; they are hurt beyond repair, are scared and have to tackle the problems which range from bullying to teenage pregnancy to the feeling of losing one\u2019s parents, all the while trying to save the world from an impending apocalypse. The Chaos packs in several eye-opening themes in one neat package and delivers the story with quite a bang.
While technically and chronologically a sequel, The Chaos is the kind of book that you can read even though you haven\u2019t read the prequel because it is strong enough to stand on its own. So reach out and read this exciting tale of two damaged protagonists who are driven by their gifts (or curses) to reach out and save the people.

title: Tips To Cope With Quarantine Boredom
description: Tips To Cope With Quarantine Boredom
body:
Remember that huge buzz about everybody demanding some ' Me time'? Well, for all those who wanted some hefty amount of time for their own selves, stars have aligned and now you can actually follow through with your plans. But for those, who are struggling with the pressure of ' social distancing' during this period of self quarantine, here are a few suggestions.

For starters, one can pick up a new hobby and work on it. In today's date, nothing is hard to learn with the availability of online tutorials at our tow. It's also a good time to start reading or picking up a new instrument. One may also delve into the spiritual side of the spectrum and try out meditation and yoga. Can't make it to the gym? Intensify your workout with the rapid rounds of pushups, stretching and freehand exercises. Also, all the plans that you had for self pampering, put them on your tables right now. What better way to enjoy life than starting with your skincare routine while binge watching your favorite movies or series. If not a big fan of shows, you can always scan through the latest podcast collections. 

Now that you've limited your life just to the boundaries of the walls, you can hone your cooking skills and test them out; or you might want to take a shot at gardening and plant some pot full of green lives. If you're more on the creative edge, then you can try out the super fun ' DIY' crafts all by yourself and make productive use of both the time and trash. You can also opt for perfect family evenings with board games full of fun conversations and lots of baked goodies. On the most boring days, try organizing your rooms and wardrobes and house cleaning. And last but not the least, make some time to call your dear loved ones to make sure if they're doing okay.

So, as our long list of proposals come to an end, we sure hope this page helps you cope with your leisure time a little better and make this stretchy period not so boring. After all, even Rapunzel had fun in her tower all by herself, before global exposure; so we sure will survive.

title: Picture Thursday!
body:
Khajjiar, Himachal Pradesh

Often regarded as \u201cMini Switzerland\u201d or \u201cSwitzerland of India\u201d, Khajjiar a hill station located in the Chamba district of Himachal Pradesh indeed lives up to its name. It is about 2,000 m above sea level in the foothills of the Dhauladhar ranges of the Western Himalayas and peaks can be seen in the distance. A small plateau surrounded by conifers and pines with crisp and clean air flowing through the branches, making them slightly rattle in a dulcet rhythmic way. Another major attraction is the Khajjiar lake, located in the very heart of the plateau provides many activities for the visitors like boating or bird watching. Every year it attracts a lot of tourists from all over India especially during the winter months when it snows. The snow clad plateau becomes a place of dreams, with its grace, peace and simply mesmerising beauty. For the rest of the year, the lush green meadows, the dense deodar trees, and the chirping birds make it equally tranquil and enthralling. Other activities include zorbing, sledging, paragliding, horse riding, and trekking as well.     
      
Though it is a tiny hill town, Khajjiar packs quite a punch in terms of adventure, nature, wildlife, and culture, therefore making it worth a visit while you\u2019re vacationing in the Abode of Snow.

title: Grammarism
body:
#Grammarism
Per se 

The loan phrase per se comes from the Latin itself, and in modern English, it is usually an adjective meaning in itself, by itself, of itself, or intrinsically. Unlike most adjectives in English, per se usually follows the word it modifies, as in these examples:
Our astonishment exists per se and isn\u2019t based on comparison with something else.
For the most part, the meetings focused less on currency levels per se and more on the underlying trade imbalances.

Per se is handy when you need to single out a particular element of a bigger thing. 
When you want to sound a little smart, inject a per se into what you're saying. It's one of those phrases, like "insomuch" or "as it were," that helps win arguments.

title: Viral Corner
body:
#ViralCorner
#JanataCurfew

While addressing the nation on Thursday regarding the coronavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged all the citizens to observe a self imposed curfew known as the "Janata Curfew" on sunday (22 March) from 7 AM to 9 PM. 

Janata curfew is basically the curfew of the people, by the people and for the people. During this self imposed curfew the Prime Minister requested all the citizens to stay in their homes for 14 hours and not to go out on roads unless extremely urgent. However, the medical workers, firemen and police and the people serving the nation need not follow this curfew.

The prime minister also requested all the citizens to go to their balconies at 5 PM and ring bells or clap as a gesture of appreciation and gratitude to all the doctors, nurses and other medical staffs, public transport employees and airline employees who are working around the clock to keep the country safe and also to the home delivery riders who are working tirelessly to serve the people in quarantine.

Thus Janata curfew is meant to encourage people to practice social distancing, keep away from the crowds and stay at home as much as possible in the coming weeks. Modi said this curfew will be a symbol of restraint and following our duty in the interest of the nation and the success of Janta Curfew and its experience will prepare the nation for future challenges.

title: Book Review
body:
#bookreview

Name of the book: The Silent Patient
Author: Alex Michaelides
Rating: 5.0/5.0
Recommended: A definite yes

\u201cChoosing a lover is a lot like choosing a therapist. We need to ask ourselves, is this someone who will be honest with me, listen to criticism, admit making mistakes, and not promise the impossible?\u201d

Alex Michaelides

Renowned and famed artist Alicia Berenson kills her husband, shooting him five times in their own house. But since that night, she has not uttered a word; neither about the killing nor anything else and there appears to be no obvious reason for the attack. Sent into a high-security criminal facility, she stays shut for six years until the arrival Theo Faber, a psychotherapist, who is convinced that he can get her to speak and uncover the motive for the murder. With crisp and uncluttered prose, Michaelides peels up the layers of Alicia\u2019s past, skilfully building tension with fascinating grip until the novel\u2019s jaw dropping climax.

The beautiful built and intense portrayal of characters in this novel, adds to the depth and originality of the plot. This story doesn't only progress as a journey of the characters, but instead dissects into the psyche of the protagonist and draws in the reader. Another fact that adds to the appreciation is that it is our author's debut crime novel and at that, an outstanding one. Thus for anyone looking for a high octane offering piece, this psychological crime thriller is a must read.
