title: Monday Hues
body:
#MondayHues
The capstone of the pyramid of intelligence,  Homosapiens, or in general, the arrogant and proud Humans. Fortunately, there is none kind enough to tell us how mistaken we are, when we take pride in the complexity of machines and the beauty we create artificially.
We highly believe in the facts that luxury provides happiness, technology begets development, and fashion is the only impound for beauty. Although some of these facts are true to some degree, in pursuing them, we somehow forget the true glamour and the ravishing complexities of our very beloved guardians- the plants, forests and the lush green gardens.
It\u2019s true that we have moved ahead a lot since the Stone Age, but the price was too high for Mother Nature to bear.
The colours in a garden are heart melting and the scent is an add-on that petrifies the soul, yet we choose to live under artificially created breeze and aromas, with no life at all.
True relaxation is not when you lie in a bed that\u2019s worth a million, it comes when one breathes in nature\u2019s true and deep affection. 
Though most have forsaken it as a bush and consider it only to decorate their vases, there are still some, who are lost in flowers\u2019 praises. 
There are still people who care for nature, just as they would for their own child. The pleasure it kindles is worth an eternity. Satisfaction on the face, filled with a smile, there could be nothing else more beautiful than that sight.
Though the flowers don\u2019t speak, if they like you, you will hear them whisper, and that is where beauty blooms through.  Something no dress or a layer on the face adhered could do. 
Love them, and enjoy while we still have the chance, because not long now before all of them wilts away in the heat and snow. And once they are gone, we will strive to attain it because the importance of a precious one stays unknown until it is lost forever.

title: TechBytes
body:
The news of the 30 series launched by Nvidia still hoards articles in tech pages like a parasite that won\u2019t go away. The 30 series, dubbed as \u201cBest for years to come\u201d boasted super specs like 24 gigs of VRAM and a multitude of \u201cCuda Cores\u201d. But for the keen eyes, the thing that never made much news was the Ampere architecture used to make the GPU itself. A successor to evergreen Turing architecture. Ampere upped the ante several times, let's take a look at some of them.

With the launch of Turing, Nvidia was already soaring sky-high, the inclusion of RT cores as well as Tensor cores made it readily available for any of the tasks, ranging from gaming to AI and workstation platforms. An NVimgurl added to the party as it made parallel GPU processing quite feasible, with imgurl speed being close to 100GBPS. It had set its claws in the gaming market with commercials and AI with its Titan series. What happened so radically that Ampere just threw it out of the window and took the crown of \u201cbest architecture till date\u201d?

For starters, Ampere has 8mm FinFET technology, a derivative of Samsung\u2019s 7mm technology that ensures more power and performance. It is said to be 1.9 times powerful than Turing. The reality, however, seems to be different. With a little over 45 percent increase, it lets down on its word but boy oh boy, the difference is visible even to the naked eye. While Turing bowed out at 4k PC, GPUs made with it can run on well above 80 fps.

But all is not merry, Ampere-based GPUs draw power like electro eating out the transformers (or at least that\u2019s what it seems when compared to some of the older generations). But keeping the power-hunger aside, the Ampere architecture might be Nvidia\u2019s answer to everything, at least for now.

title: A LAST NOTE FROM THE BATCH OF 2017-2021
description: A LAST NOTE FROM THE BATCH OF 2017-2021
body:
When we outgrow a place, all we want to do is to leave. However, when the time comes, all we want is to linger behind just a little longer. That's exactly how I felt when I had to leave home and come to Haldia Institute of Technology. We met confusing new faces on our first day and eventually made a home out of them. As a student myself, I can say on everyone's behalf that the entire duration of our college life wasn't a bed of roses. Sometimes it was tough, sometimes it was scary and sometimes it was devastating but at other times, it was so amazing.\u00a0 Yes, we didn't get KJo's picture-perfect college life, but we got our jamming sessions, our addas at theks, our gossips at 1 in the morning, our scolding from seniors, our ' treat dijiye bhaiya/didi' from our juniors, and so much more. And we had all of that in just 3.5 years. Isn't that incredible? A lifetime of experiences caught in the space of just a few years.

Indeed, we didn't get the farewell that we wanted, we didn't get to have our legendary pink shirts signed. The vibrant black and blue ink highlighted on a light pink background was the only pro for that uniform.\u00a0 But we missed that too. We also couldn't hug our best friends and ask them not to cry when we were drowning in a puddle of our own tears. We said our goodbyes long before it was time. But life doesn't work that way. It just doesn't give us disappointments; it also gives us silver linings.\u00a0 What's our silver lining you ask? We got to find out that long-distance actually works. We found out who truly were our friends all along. We got to find out the people who would stick around for hours on the phone to catch up on our lives. We found friends whom even school buddies can't beat.

The journey has finally come to an end. The optimism ends here. Times are tough and some of us are stepping into a life of uncertainty and hardships. However, hardships make us tough and maybe a little cynical. But it doesn't matter much because, in the long run, we all find the lanes that we wish to walk. Some of us on the other hand, are gearing up to conquer new jobs and nail new degrees. The best wishes are reserved for everyone. May we all be successful in our endeavours and above all learn to be happy in life.

When we outgrow a place, all we want to do is to leave. However, when the time comes, all we want to do is to linger behind just a little longer. That's exactly  how I feel while I am about to end my journey here at HIT. I am sure all our hearts are breaking to finally say it out loud, but
Adios Haldia Institute of Technology!

title: EID AL-ADHA
body:
*EID AL-ADHA ~ 'FEAST OF SACRIFICE'* 

Eid al-Adha, also known as Bakrid is one of the two official and most famous Islamic festivals celebrated all around the world. It is celebrated on the tenth day of Dhu al-Hijjah, the 12th month of the Islamic lunar calendar.

This year the crescent moon for the month of Dhu al-Hijjah was sighted on July 11 as per Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind, thus the Bakrid falls today on 21 July this year. The timings Of the celebration may vary across different countries depending upon the sighting of the crescent moon. 

Eid al-Adha lasts for three days and concludes the annual Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca made by the Islamic devotees. This festival commemorates the willingness of Prophet Ibrahim to sacrifice his son as an act of obedience and dedication to Allah. According to the holy Quran, a voice from heaven asked Ibrahim to make something else as a great sacrifice and a ram was slaughtered in place of his son. Ever since then, people re-enact Ibrahim's obedience and consider cattle sacrifice to be a major part of Eid al-Adha celebrations. Devotees offer Eid al-Adha namaaz at the mosques any time after the sun completely rises before entering Zuha time.

After the prayers, people embrace and exchange greetings with each other. Everyone wearing their best clothes gather with family and friends for the feast. Traditionally, the delicious meat prepared is divided into three parts- one for the family, one for the poor and needy, and the last for the guests. Giving charity to the poor and needy is also considered an important tradition of Eid al-Adha celebrations. This festival thus teaches us the lessons of devotion, sacrifice, and helping others in need.

The HIT Times wishes everyone Eid Mubark.

title: Spider Silk - A Wonder Biofiber
body:
Spider silk is a protein fiber spun by spiders primarily for making the web and sometimes for other purposes. Often compared with steel regarding strength, the elastic and adhesive properties of spider silk as studied recently, has made it one of many biomaterials that can be utilized for suspension bridge wires, bulletproof vests, military draglines and medical adhesives.

The properties of spider silk that makes it different than other naturally forming silks include its tensile strength, elasticity, adhesive nature and thermal stability in fiber form. Each strand of spider silk comprises of thousands of nano-strands; each of 20 millionth a millimeter in diameter. Just like a tiny cable, each silk fiber is entirely composed of parallel nano-strands, which measured to be at least 1 micron long. This doesn\u2019t sound like a lot, but is 50 times longer than their width and is capable of stretching further.

But the fact that spider silk is stronger than steel sounds too good to be true. Strength of any material is determined on the basis of several physical properties, tensile strength being one amongst them. The tensile strength of steel ranges from 0.2 to 2 Gigapascals, while the tensile strength of some spider silk is about 1 Gigapascal. The stiffness of silk, which is its ability to deform elastically when force is applied, is many times less than that of steel. Where spider silk seems to beat steel by a large margin is its density, which is almost six times less. On a per-weight basis then, silk starts to look more interesting, with the ratio of strength to density exceeding that of steel. 

Not being stronger than steel doesn\u2019t make spider silk any less interesting and unique. When exposed to water, these fibers exhibit a property called super contraction and can reduce up to 50% in size. Also, water cannot weaken the strong adhesive bonds which only dissolves at high pH. Elastic properties of spider steel allow it to be stretched 4 times its length without breaking and can retain these properties at temperatures as low as \u201340\u02da Fahrenheit.

Scientists are still working towards the commercial artificial production spider silk as it is primarily governed by the genome of the spider concerned hence making the silk of every spider species a bit different than the other one. Nonetheless, it\u2019ll always be a \u2018wonder-fiber\u2019, providing the prospect for several bio-engineering based projects.

title: Viral Corner
body:
Celebrating Non-Binary identity and inclusivity
July 11th marked the start of non-Binary awareness week which invited many conversations about the identity and how people are celebrating and also questions regarding\u2026what exactly is non-Binary as a gender identity?
The first question that does arise is, what exactly is Gender? Gender is a mere societal construct which is used to segregate people into two groups based on their birth sex. Gender identity and sex are two very different things. A person may be born as XY but can transition into a female or choose to be non-binary, unlabeled or remain a cis-gender male. 
Your Gender Identity does not equate to what you were born as, it equates to how you feel comfortable in your own body. 
That being said, what exactly is non-Binary as a gender identity? Strictly speaking, it could be anything. Most people who feel that they identify neither as a female nor a male conform to this label. It could also be those who feel like they can identify as both male and female and can choose to express it either way based on their comfort.
There exists a very stereotypical depiction of genders- Women are more docile and sensitive and look a certain way with long hair and other such descriptions, Men are seen as more strong, straight body and short hair and more. 
There is no certain way to look any gender and similarly, non-Binary people don\u2019t look more masculine or more feminine, they ARE non-binary and that should be respected. Being non-binary should not be equated with nonconforming clothing and style as wearing a dress doesn\u2019t make you a woman and wearing trousers doesn\u2019t make you a man.
These labels and descriptions often confuse people and lead them to struggle with their identities. You don\u2019t have to conform to a type or category of people to fit into the society, this is not a vegetable market where you can be neatly stacked up into little piles. 
Likewise, Non-Binary people are mostly unlabeled people who either feel comfortable expressing themselves in many ways than one or as neither. It is not a trend, this identity has existed in cultured for centuries. They don\u2019t need to explain their identity to people, it\u2019s time people respect them for who they are.

title: Word Worth Millions - Esprit D'Escalier
body:
Word- Esprit d'escalier

Origin- French

Pronounciation- e-SPREE des-kal-i-YE

Etymology- From French esprit de l'escalier, from esprit(wit)+ escalier(stairs).

Definition- A perfect repartee or a witty comeback which frustratingly comes to mind only when the moment for doing so has passed.

There are those moments in life when one finds oneself in an altercation with someone and unfortunately for them the esprit d'escalier kicks in at that very moment and they are unable to think of a retort on the spot. Esprit d'escalier usually occurs during a disputation when one feels threatened and they lose their cool. Eventually they resort to stuttering and are unable to think of a rejoinder at the moment. Only when they are back home, do they come up with a lot of great comebacks. People who experience esprit d'escalier are said to have a "staircase wit". The phrase "staircase wit" kind of makes sense, especially when one imagines a spiral staircase. In the midst of a discussion, the ideas which they wants to express can seem to spiral up and out of their consciousness similar to that of a spiral staircase. As soon as they leave the conversation,the ideas come flowing back to their conscious mind.

Example-

Engaged in an amiable altercation
Between their cups of tea
Sharing repartees amongst themselves 
One gave a clever quip
But the latter gripped by esprit d'escalier
Thought of the perfect retort
On his way back home.

title: MONDAY HUES
body:
#MondayHues

Sitting by the seashore, one learns from the waves. The mighty waves that come from the distant part of the sea, suddenly grow huge, but in turn, don't forget to move forward. The waves represent our lives. 
When we are born and we start growing, we don't think of anything else, other than moving forward in life. After some time when we reach a certain age, at that point, we have a lot of strength in us. At that point, we tend to leave the shade of our parents and try to search for success in our life on our own terms. At that time, we are at our most vulnerable selves, just like the waves. We tend to break down at any moment, but we keep our strength and move ahead.
And when things get too much out of hand, we perish just like the wave when it reaches the shore. Like the wave mixes with the water to rise again stronger after some time, we too take a break only to emerge stronger again. When we reach almost the end of our life, it is then we start thinking about "what did we do in our entire life?" Just prepare ourselves for the rat race to finally end up being one of those rats? When we become a part of the rat race, giving away all the golden years of our lives, we don't understand the importance of losing those carefree years until we reach a point of no return.
During the last days of our life, one realizes that mental health was so much important for him. He had years to prioritize his mental health and securing a peaceful life in the future. But then he was busy working hard to fit in the rat race of getting a pay rise. At that point, one doesn't care about being at peace or being truly happy. But, as one grows old, they start comprehending that living peacefully would have been the best gateway to a successful life.

title: Word Worth Million - Hiraeth
body:
Word : Hiraeth
Origin :\u00a0Welsh
Pronunciation : here-eyeth

Meaning : It refers to homesickness mixed with longing for the lost and departed.

Usage: 

Sitting there in my lawn at five in the morning,
Just enjoying the winds blowing through my hair,
When my fellow mates were quite busy sleeping.

The last night would have been quite dark,
Leaving behind the sweet fragrance of soil, 
And the raindrops on the leaves with a unique spark.

Making me move down the memory lane,
When I used to be quite small.
Life used to be so simple then,
Playing outside when it used to rain.
Making paper boats,
And sailing them into the puddles,
It was quite easy then.

Dragging me back to the hiraeth , 
in the turmoil of the lost.
The hot sip of coffee brought me back to the present,
I could hear my friend call me,
Making me remember,
There were many more things for me to do.

title: Lotus Effect
body:
Lotus Effect

Have you ever wondered how the surface of a lotus leaf never gets wet and always seem to appear clean despite of growing in muddy areas? Scientists pondered upon these questions too and found out that the self-cleaning properties as exhibited by the lotus leaf and some other insects is due to a phenomenon that was named \u201cLotus Effect\u201d.

The term Lotus Effect refers to the self-cleaning properties that are a result of ultra-hydrophobicity (also called super-hydrophobicity) as exhibited by the leaves of Lotus.

Upon studying the chemical composition and topography of the lotus leaves, scientists found that the leaves had two levels of structures that explained this behavior: a microstructure level consisting of surface lumps and a nanostructure level formed by small hairs. Both systems were constituted by a waxy coating, which together made the surface of a lotus leaf repel water and gave it its characteristic ultra-hydrophobic nature. Plants with a double structured surface like the lotus can reach a contact angle of 170\u00b0 for fluids, whereby the droplet's contact area is only 0.6%. Dirt particles with an extremely reduced contact area are picked up by water droplets and are thus easily cleaned off the surface. All this leads to a self-cleaning effect.

Unlike hydrophobicity which is a chemical property, ultra-hydrophobicity is fundamentally a physical property thus providing a vast opportunity to scientists to mimic an artificial surface constituting of similar properties. There are several possible interesting applications like developments of paints to prevent corrosion. Due to its extreme water-resistant quality, nanotechnological ultra-hydrophobic solution developed to mimic the surface of lotus leaf is widely being used on glass and windshields which guarantees visibility in every weather condition and also as an insulator in electrical equipment. This effect is also useful in producing anti-bacterial surfaces.

Lotus effect proposes nanotechnology products with molecular activity and solutions will high technological value in several sectors; from transport to biomedical. All it needs is a closer look in simple things around us!

title: Women who made India proud in the Olympics
body:
Initially regarded as an all-male domain, the arena of the Olympics was globally kept, well out of reach for all women athletes. They were looked down upon as delicate and fragile beings. But, over the years, they have fought vigorously to break this so-called notion that "Women are the weaker sex". And now it's not the men but the women who are taking the Olympic world by storm. 

Indian star weightlifter Mirabai Chanu created history on 24th July to become the first Indian weightlifter to bag the silver medal on the very first day of the Olympic Games. Chanu lifted 87 kg in snatch and the clean and jerk segment. She hoisted 115 kg successfully which, set a new Olympic record. From picking woods in the jungle to winning an Olympic silver, Mirabai has come a long way to become a champion. 

Aced badminton player PV Sindhu wrote her name in the pages of history on 1st August, right after she scored a scintillating win against He Bingjiao of China and secured a bronze medal for India. With this win and the silver earned at the previous Games in Rio de Janeiro, Sindhu then went on to become the first Indian woman to win two Olympic medals. Reeling from the semi-final loss on Saturday to Tai Tzu-Ying, Sindhu becomes even more driven to seize the one medal at all costs. And this showed in this Hyderbadi's play as she crafted the contest's template as her efforts bore fruit eventually. 

There's another superwoman on the list whose name is worth mentioning. Lovlina Borgohain scripted history on 4th August by signing off with a bronze medal in the Tokyo Olympics to become the third Indian boxer to claim bronze after Vijender Singh(2008) and M.C. Mary Kom(2012). Before going down against Busenaz Surmeneli, she fought with a tenacity and determination which will continue to inspire many young Indians in the years to come. 

This Tokyo Olympics 2020 will be memorable for its remarkable displays of women autonomy. Mirabai Chanu, PV Sindhu and Lovlina Borgohain will become the epitome of what women can achieve and the heights of excellence they can reach. Their performances will call on all women to challenge gender stereotypes, encourage them to break these social norms and keep pursuing their dreams.

title: MONDAY HUES
body:
#MondayHues 

As the people are just wandering through the streets, he stands there with a beautiful smile on his face to serve us with love. A tradition followed through centuries, not a sign of poverty or something to be ashamed of, but a sign of inner peace and relief when a tired office clerk returning home smiles after seeing that guy still serving even late at night.
 
He stands there enjoying the delicacy of hunger that ties his knots and bounds him to these ill streets. His attire is always full of stained dirt and grease, even at its best. However, he still keeps on hustling with no hope of appreciation and applause for his work to fulfil the daily needs of his family, who are waiting for him at home. 

As we all know, life isn't just a bed of roses. The thorns count too. Once, where there was immense joy and excitement in these streets, suddenly there was silence all around, darkness in someone's house whose efforts once made others smile. 

Yes, the good times just flew away. The times spent together on those streets while having our favourite street foods are now just mere memories. Even in those days, he didn't lose hope as he knew that nothing lasts forever. He believed that better days were coming. And they will come faster with faith.

His journey teaches us a lesson to fight through the bad days to earn the best days of our life. Today's scenario is far better than before. But the best is yet to come. So, don't stop. Just believe in yourself and keep on hustling for the best.

title: Monday Hues
body:
At first there was nothing only clay and water
Fingers weaved through the silken fabric as the days grew shorter 
The journey that lies ahead will be rough
But it will be harder to crack a nut this tough

There will be dark days in these shadows
With all joy vanished you will be left with your sorrows
Then with the right key a door may open 
And happiness waltzes back right in to brighten
The days with memories of simpler times
Keeping the trials at bay with your hymns 

What a sight to behold on the last day
To see all of it coming together steals your breath away
What begins one day has to end someday
So soak it all in while it lasts
Before it all ends and has to pass away.

title: Joystick Junkies - Pacify
body:
Name of the game: Pacify

Can you run it?

These are the minimum requirements to run Pacify on your system:
OS: Windows 7 \u2013 64 bit
Processor: Intel i5
Memory: 4 GB RAM
Graphics: 1GB Video RAM
DirectX: Version 10
Storage: 2 GB available space

Synopsis
Enter a haunted house to destroy the soul of a demon living in a girl.

Gameplay Analysis
Pacify is a single/multiplayer game that is all about running from a ghost! The player enters the game as a member of Paranormal Activity Helper Incorporated in a house over 100 years old to see whether it is haunted. The ghost, our antagonist, can switch between normal and evil mode. In the evil mode, it can transform the player into a doll and the player has to run from this. In the house are two kinds of dolls; marked and coloured. Of these, only nine marked dolls can move, and the player has to burn all of them to reach the end. The player needs to pick up props like keys and dolls to proceed through the game. The 5 keys open 5 doors, including the main door. The evil gets faster and smarter with the game, and once 8 of the nine marked dolls are burnt, the girl will never return to normal mode.

Plot Analysis
The player enters an antique house as a PAH member which a broker wants to sell. The player has to see whether the rumors of it being haunted are true or not.  And that is almost giving away all of it. The plot is simple, ending in two or three trials. A series of clues/notes tell the story behind the girl living in this house. Adopted as means to hold talks with a dead through dolls, some mishaps led to Emilia killing her mother and putting the entire family in danger. The story has ample time to mature and by the time it nears its end, you start to sympathize with the girl and all the hardships she had to bear. A good motive, a solid backstory, some basic elements and boom, you have a plot that can keep you engaged until you complete the game.

TL; DR
Pacify is all about entering a haunted house, finding and burning some dolls to \u201cpacify\u201d the ghost living in there. Rather simple with a hint of spookiness! So, why wait? Join the PAH now!

title: Viral Corner
body:
Adieu to twenty-one years of love and unforgettable memories: Messi joins PSG after Barca exit

In a shocking turn of events, it was announced that Lionel Messi was leaving the Catalan club Barcelona due to the financial strains the club was facing due to debts. In a teary press conference, Messi explained his desire to stay was strong and has even agreed to cut down fifty percent of his fee, but as fate would have it, the club had to let go of him due to financial fair play rules.
This was a decision that a lot of fans did not see coming and the heartbreak was expressed over all platforms. Moreover, F.C. Barcelona is expected to make a loss of around 450 million Euros in merchandise sales and sponsorships due to Messi leaving the Catalan Club.
Messi has now joined the French team Paris Saint-Germain under a two-year contract with an option for a one-year extension. He will now join former Barca teammate Neymar Jr. and trade his iconic number 10 jersey for a new number 30 navy blue jersey. Neymar played a key role in convincing Messi to join PSG.
He will also share the PSG squad with fellow Argentinian players Angel Di Maria, Leandro Paredes, and Mauro Icardi. This sudden change will take time to settle in with a lot of people because Messi has always been a One Club Man and the position of Messi in Barca had taken an iconic spot in football history.
Now begins a new journey for Lionel Messi and his new partnership with PSG. All the fans can do is wish for the best for his new football journey.

title: Monday Hues
body:
In the silent but still deafening hubbub of the world, the peace of an artist immersed in their craft is infectious yet serene, hanging over the crowd like a cool cloud. But for that person wielding the delicate-coloured brushes like a sharpened tool, their world exists in the small words of shapes and strokes. Each run of the brush creates a unique portrait of their mind.
An artist\u2019s life is varied and obscure, only luck bringing them a notice worth a lifetime of achievements. An artist is defined by their popularity in the world, how far they go with their name and money. A job as an artist is seen as a disarming and often a strange path until and unless their names are in papers and their money is in showers. 
But then comes along a silent worker in meagre environments, moving their hands along like smooth laps of water on the sand, creating a unique impression each time. The wonder of their world is never-ending and once we look around and see, we can\u2019t help but stop in the tracks of our mundane lives and be mesmerized before we go about again.
It is strange how the beauty of natural talent gets relegated to mere commercial value. Something so peaceful and beautiful has been reduced to a useless task until it pays right. But one day, maybe not far away, like that child with eyes of god when they first created and marvelled at the universe, we will all stop and witness tiny creations of glorious beauty and feel the love and passion that goes into a simple line on a paper or a lion on a shirt.

title: Joystick Junkies - Insurgency : Sandstorm
body:
Name of the game:- 
Insurgency : Sandstorm

Can you run it?
The game can be a bit slow in low end PC. Minimum requirements are:
\u2022OS: Windows 7/8/10(64 bits)
\u2022Processor: Intel Core i5-4440(3.10 GHz)
\u2022Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 760 or AMD Radeon HD 7970
\u2022System Memory: 8 GB RAM
\u2022Storage: 40 GB available space 
\u2022DirectX: Version 11

Synopsis:
Find your way through various militant groups in an unnamed fictional middle Eastern region with the proper balance between realism and fun in this multiplayer tactical first-person shooter game.

Gameplay analysis: 
This insurgency series has 'slow' tactical, realistic gameplay, with moments of intensity. Weapons are accurate and extremely deadly putting an emphasis on teamwork. Most of the game modes here do not feature instant respawn. Instead, on death, the players are left with no option other than spectating and waiting for their team to complete an objective in order to respawn. But with the addition of fire support, a player progression system, character customization, cosmetic unlocks, larger maps and drivable technical, it surely stands out from all its series predecessors. It provides the players with a handful of options in the game mode and a wide range of alms to chose from during the course of the game.

Story Analysis: 
It doesn't have much of a story. The entire game is based on conflicts between two factions- "Security", loosely based on various world militaries and "Insurgents", loosely based on various militant groups.

TL;DR: 
Shoot and fight with deadly armaments against militant groups in this game but be sure not to drop your guard. Once dead, your respawn totally depends on your teammates. So be ready for the adrenaline rush once you log on to this super realistic game.

title: Monday Hues
body:
Since time immemorial, humans has used animals as means of entertainment. During historic periods, there were contests of taming angry bulls. Because of such entertainment people got hurt badly and even death cases were predominant. Even in current times, animals have often become the means of entertainment for fellow human beings. Humans embraced urbanisation and modernisation and thus erased vast expanses of forest covers from the face of the earth. This caused a huge turmoil in the life of the birds. When maximum succumbed to the radiation of mobile towers others were caged up for the entertainment of those humans who were in the first place responsible for their homelessness. Things went smooth for humans until they were caged inside their homes during the pandemic. It was this time that we got a little idea of what the importance of freedom was to any living being. Before this, we had never thought about these birds or their freedom. These birds who were promised the entire sky by the almighty got only a few cubic centimetres of a cage because of us humans. It was during this pandemic that we humans realised the true essence of freedom. Being caged inside our houses with our family members made us crazy to go outside. But then these birds remain caged for years just so that we human beings get some entertainment from our hectic and tiresome lives. Every year on Independence Day we ask ourselves, \u201cAre we truly free?\u201d 
I feel we cannot get the true essence of freedom when we have the guilt of snatching away someone else\u2019s freedom from them.

title: TechBytes - Chernobyl: The terror isn\u2019t over yet
body:
Till date the worst nuclear accident witnessed by mankind is undoubtedly the explosion of reactor at Chernobyl Nuclear power plant in 1986. 35 years have passed following that accident. Yet the fear isn\u2019t completely over.
In 1986, just after the explosion, liquidators constructed a sarcophagus over the ruins of the destroyed reactor. That was supposed to be a temporary solution; only meant to keep all the fuel and the radiation within for about 30 years. The sarcophagus made of steel and concrete failed to stand the test of time and started degrading and developing leaks that led in rainwater to underground chamber inaccessible since the explosion. In 2016, the New Safe Confinement was placed over the sarcophagus sealing all the radioactive waste within it for the next decade. As much as this sounds promising, the reality is a lot complex than this.
The rainwater that managed to enter the inaccessible rooms of the reactor basement have so far acted as the moderator slowing down neutrons hence keeping the rate of fission rather low. But with the new structure in place and the remaining water drying out to reach a critical level, fission reactions are spiking in these chambers, especially in a basement room 305/2.
Although the reactions spiking in these rooms are not alarmingly high to generate enough energy for another nuclear explosion, the situation is still a matter of grave concern. Scientists are not fully ruling out the possibility of another accident. The rate of neutron emission in room 305/2 has doubled since 2016 and if it continues to increase at such a high pace, scientists may have to intervene. This might involve using robots to drill holes and install solid neutron absorbers like boron cylinders which act like control cylinders and soak up excess neutron to choke the nuclear reaction.
To prevent any further mishap, the government of Ukraine aims to remove the waste and store it in a geological repository by September.

title: Word Worth Million - Bilita Mpash
body:
Word: Bilita Mpash

Origin: Butan

Pronunciation: B- lit M-pash

Meaning: An amazing, pleasant dream.

Usage :

From the dusk to the dawn,
Wandering around in my lawn. 
Admiring the beauty of the twinkling stars,
I wish there was a magical land,
Above those cotton clouds so far.

Flying above the golden streams,
And walking in the purple fields, 
Swimming like dolphins in the ocean,
Soaring like birds in the sky.

No gravity to pull me down, 
No one to stop me from dancing all around.

The winds blowing through my hair,
I felt someone sitting beside me on the chair,
I felt something very strange, 
Maybe all the lost pieces of my life,
Were going to rearrange.

Just like Alice followed the rabbit to reach her wonderland,
Just like Peter Pan enjoyed his childhood in the Neverlands,
Rejoicing in the magical land of my dreams,
I could feel someone tightly holding my hand.

Not promising a forever carefree life,
But the one with lots of love and little strife.

It felt like bliss,
To have someone to stand by my side.
With whom, I could speak my heart out,
And there was nothing to hide.

Too good to be true in reality,
I pinched myself, 
And to my surprise,
I could see the BILITA MPASH of mine,
Flashing before my eyes,
And the creative vision of mine,
Just became a part of my life.

title: Monday Hues
body:
Beyond the colorful spectra of light lies the monochromatic world. Coexisting with ours, away from the prying eyes, only visible to some. At times, it can coincide and is visible in the busiest of streets or the darkest alleyways.

Their beauty lies in being the blank canvas our eyes fill colors. Like flower petals that were once in a whirlpool, the hues dance around until they find their correct spot, fitting in nicely at their designated place. Mostly, the almost instantaneous fill robs us of any chance to enjoy the beauty, but there are times when everything feels slow, when you want to sit back and unwind, and that\u2019s when it reveals its grace. When the feelings and thoughts superimpose and hum the same tunes, when the lights go a little bit dim, that is when you\u2019ll catch a glimpse. Lie down and watch as a single color \u2013 black takes up the sky in various intensities.

And when it ends, you will be left wondering whether it was real or not because once the moment passes, you can\u2019t have it back. But that is what life is all about; living the moment, absorbing the thoughts, and processing them while new ones form. So take a minute, relax, and watch as darkness plays hide and seek with the light to paint the world in black and white, away from the bustle of hues, a moment of tranquility in this ever screaming world.

title: VIRAL CORNER
body:
#ViralCorner
#ReopenSchools
Youth, the biggest asset for any nation and the capstone of the evolution of humanity; At least as long as they are better than their predecessors in terms of knowledge. The base of it all, proper education and the world right now is heavily undermining this very basic yet necessary aspect of children\u2019s lives.
Finally, someone has looked deep enough and understood the situation; The UNICEF (United Nation Children\u2019s Fund) has raised serious concerns about schools being completely closed even when people have been freely gathering at gyms, spas, salons, and a lot of extravagant spaces.
 According to the numbers by UNICEF around 77 million students have been out of their classrooms for almost 18 months. Although schools are fully open in 117 countries with 539 million students back in their classrooms, there are still 18 countries with full closures in place.
So, to peacefully make a stand against this grave calamity, UNICEF, on Thursday 16th September, went dark on their social media channels, with the last message urging to #ReopenSchool.
UNICEF states, \u201cThis generation of children and youth, cannot afford any more disruptions to their education.\u201d 
The last two academic years were huge losses for students even though they were continuing their classes online, according to UNICEF. It is an undeniable fact that the communication gap created in online mode does not provide a very healthy medium for education. Safety should be a concern, but educational well-being cannot get sidelined either.
Vaccinations, sanitization, wearing masks, and all other safety protocols followed at different workspaces can also be used at schools. Thus, allowing students to gain the most with least to lose.
To allow the holes to be filled properly, every aspect needs to be worked properly. And to make that possible UNESCO, UNICEF, and the World Bank have partnered in an initiative called Mission: Recovering Education 2021, to support governments get both their education system and the students back on track.

title: Viral Corner
body:
#ViralCorner

Pakistan once again became a target for memers as it blamed India for New Zealand cancelling the tour, it became so because of the name. They blamed a certain Om Prakash Mishra. New Zealand's decision to call off the tour of Pakistan came as a big setback to the cricket-crazy nation. It was to be conducted from September 17 and would have been the first international assignment in Pakistan since 2004.

Pakistan on Wednesday alleged that a threatening mail was sent to the New Zealand cricket squad from India. The Minister of Information and Broadcast of Pakistan, Fawad Chaudry narrated the chain of events at a press conference. He stated that the fake threat, launched on August 2019 from India became active on September 25. The fake post was created in the name of "Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan" asking the cricket squad to leave or else they will be targeted, he elaborated.

Continuing his speech, the minister said the name behind all this was no one else but someone named Om Prakash Mishra who, created a fake email id "Hamza Afridi" and used the location of Singapore. Did the name sound familiar to you? Well! You are quite right. The owner of the crass, misogynistic "Aunty ki ghanti" song and the beloved memechild of the Indian meme community has the same name, and they grabbed this golden chance with both hands.

Soon, the netizens took the internet by storm and flooded the social media with memes targeting PCB and crowning Om Prakash Mishra as \u201cLord.\u201d Unaware of what he did, he has now become trending on social media again as he (allegedly) was successful in single-handedly maneuvering Pakistan's agency and has become the reason behind the cancelation of the tour too.

title: Word Worth Million - Ya'aburnee
body:
YA\u2019ABURNEE

ORIGIN-ARABIC

PRONUNCIATION- yak-ber-nee

MEANING- YOU BURY ME

USAGE - A DECLARATION OF ONE\u2019S HOPE THAT THEY\u2019LL DIE BEFORE ANOTHER PERSON BECAUSE OF HOW UNBEARABLE IT WOULD BE TO LIVE WITHOUT THEM

EXAMPLE- 
Being friends with Ananya was the best thing that happened to Sunaina. Sunaina had a troubled childhood. Her parents separated when she was quite young and thus she was quite ill-treated at school. No one wanted to be friends with her. During all those years her grandmother was her best friend. But the world ceased to exist for her after the old lady\u2019s death. Sunaina was left with absolutely no friend or companion.  The feeling of being left alone started to reflect on the academics and her mother unaware of anything decided to change her school. That was where she met Ananya and somehow the two instantly hit off. From being mere classmates to becoming best friends it took less than a month. Sunaina was leading the best phase of her life when suddenly the thought of losing Ananya started haunting her. She couldn\u2019t afford to lose Ananya like she lost her grandmother. One day while sharing this insecurity with Ananya she told her a word that she had come across recently. The word was \u201cya\u2019aburnee\u201d. Sunaina explained her fears to Ananya and said, \u201cFor a long time in life I was all alone and without a friend. After many 
years I got you. I can\u2019t bear to lose you Ananya! I have already lost my grandmother, another loss cannot be endured by me. Promise me that you won\u2019t leave me alone, and you will let me die before you.\u201d 
Maybe for the first time in years, God answered Sunaina\u2019s prayers. She succumbed to an accident a few months later.

title: Monday Hues
body:
A bright dash on a muddled, neutral palette is always something that stops people in their tracks, leading them to stare either with amazement or, no particular thought. Just stare at that bright speck lighting up the garish swirls around them on the artist\u2019s wooden palette.

We don\u2019t know who that artist is in this context, maybe god, maybe another energy beyond our grasp, but in middle of this stillness, maybe the artist sat back to admire the red crowned beings in their peace as they adorned the green and brown surroundings. 
The light flighty birds, when they whiz past with their tiny form, a flash of red never ceases to excite the canvas of the meager scenery. The Scarlet dash across the blue sky, the crimson dot in midst of a green foliage peeking through, exciting giggling children with their bright magic. The flutter of wind barely noticeable yet you notice the red day shooting star as toddlers point at it in amazement. Nature\u2019s canvas has all these vivid bright spots lurking around, we would be lucky enough to see the mad dash of the painter\u2019s brush and when we do, we frame in our minds. For a night full of shooting stars and wishes, this is day full of bizarre and unique strokes which vanishes. But once caught, it is worth the luck of a thousand stars.

It is a wonder how nature created its own mad dash of rainbows, the little splash that lands on the palette and captivates the universe, but it is a thing of beauty indeed.
But for now, let us stare at this beauty frozen in time, a peaceful resting stroke of brush caught, a cherished and framed memory.

title: TechBytes - Northwestern's Winged microchip: The World's Smallest Ever Flying Machine
body:
The wonders of technology never cease to amaze the world. Northwestern University engineers broke the barriers of antiquated technology by creating the smallest-ever human-made flying structure in the form of a tiny moving microchip. Taking a page from Marvel Studios "Ant-Man", scientists have developed this "microflier" to resemble the size of a grain of sand and is much smaller than a regular-sized ant. Without a motor or engine, this microflier operates by catching a flight on the wind and spinning like a helicopter through the air making one think of those propeller seeds from maple trees. Research journals talked about the interiors of the chip which is equipped with sensors, power sources, antennas for wireless communication, and even an embedded memory to store data. 

By surveying the dispersal mechanism of the maple Samaras and other wind-dispersed seeds, engineers were able to optimize the microflier's aerodynamics to ensure that it falls at a slow, controlled velocity when dropped from a height. This behaviour stabilizes its flight, ensures dispersal over a broad area, and increases the amount of time it interacts with the air, making it ideal for monitoring air pollution and airborne diseases.

The framework of this winged contraption is inspired by the shape of the tristellateia, a flowing vine with star-shaped seeds." We think we beat nature," said John Rogers, who lead the device's development, referring to the microflier's ability to descend more sedately and stably than the seeds of the same size falling from trees. " We were also able to build these 'helicopter' flying structures at sizes much smaller than those found in nature." he further added. This was extremely important owing to the growing frenzy over increasingly smaller devices in the electronics industry.

title: Monday Hues
body:
#MondayHues

Every entity known seeks just one thing, stability. Be it the big bang or the smallest of chemical reactions. If it\u2019s happening, it always wants to attain proper order.
The irony stands pretty bold that every attempt to create order leads to mesmerizing chaos.

The results don\u2019t matter because true beauty emerges in the process that knows no such bounds as a systematized subpoena or proper order. In the depths of space, time flows even after billions of years, and chaos still brews, yet its beauty continues to ravish unparalleled. 
 Order is when a garden has been mowed, cleaned, and grows just like the master wishes. Its beauty is indeed exquisite but still lacks when compared to nature\u2019s esteemed gardens blossoming everywhere at random.
When a river sprouts, it doesn\u2019t have a path; it just goes on jumping around. The scene is indeed chaotic, but its beauty is unattainable. Dozens of pebbles, clashing on its bed; leaves floating with the flow and colourful sprouts fill the river\u2019s undergrowth. No number of human interventions could ever achieve what veristically transpires in nature.

The two entities are not entirely independent rather moreover relative. What might be chaotic for some could also stand as veracious order for others. Yet, we struggle to attain a state that could be considered orderly.

 In the end, do we need it? Can\u2019t we stand back and enjoy the view? Understanding how the changes come about, learning all along.
Admiring the beauty of what truthfully ensues keeping our noses out of it. Allowing nature to run its course, not ruining how it develops into a glamorous flow.

title: Viral Corner
body:
El Classico, that too without Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo? It was something unthinkable for ages to football lovers worldwide. But time does make things change, even the strongest of all beliefs are bound to shake when it comes to the probabilities in the future.
Ronaldo had already withdrawn from Real Madrid a couple of seasons back and recently Messi left F.C. Barcelona for Paris Saint-German(PSG). With the withdrawal of both the titans, a lot of possible outcomes have occupied the minds of the other footballers, critics, netizens, and the public in general. But as stated with professional judgments, El Classico was and will always be superior to any single player. Both the clubs, Real Madrid and Barcelona have a very rich history dating back more than a century. The thrill and rivalry between the clubs and not to mention the supporters have never seen a downfall, be it the age before the two or during their era.
Though it is evident that the hardcore Messi-Ronaldo fans were a bit damped, however when it comes to football, they are the first ones to grab a seat in front of the nearest available communication system. The new flag bearers have a major role to play in this regard. People worldwide are looking forward to the new jersey 10 of Barcelona, Ansu as well as Memphis, who will be playing his first-ever El Classico this session.
Footballers come and go but what remains is nothing but "Football" itself. The fire that was once kindled between Barcelona and Real Madrid will always be the same irrespective of the circumstances. So? Real Madrid or Barcelona whichever the preference may be, get ready for the upcoming thrill!

title: Monday Hues
body:
When a shutterbug is awestruck\u00a0

The day was about to cease
And here I was out looking for some solace and peace.
Dissatisfied with everything around me 
wanting to discover what happiness means. 
People find comfort in the womb of mother nature, 
so I tried capturing that but
Nothing made me dazed enough.

Seeking the answer to my question 
I kept strolling around until my solace was found.
I had no idea what it would look like or feel, 
but I for sure know if it's real or reel.\u00a0\u00a0
In the norm of my quest, I came to a halt.

It was as if I was just hypnotized,
Lost the power to look beyond that smile.
The happiness I was looking for was there in their eyes.
I could feel the time stop around me, I just had an epiphany. 
The happiness I always looked for 
was always there within me.\u00a0

The eyes were so pure that they touched my soul.
I could feel the warmth of tears trickling down my cheeks. 
I fail to describe what those eyes could make me feel, 
a smile so infectious that it spread across my lips. 
The reason was both unknown and unsure, 
but I fail to see any forgery. It was so pure.

In a world full of fakes, such a genuine one was hard to find. 
I hope that it remains secure. 
This might be my only time coming across something like this, 
but I am glad I could capture it once and for all.
